recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Wrap
ingredients: 4 slices smoked salmon or smoked trout
directions: Step 1: Lay the tortilla flat on a clean surface, ensuring not to overfill.
Step 2: Spread 1 tablespoon of Greek yogurt evenly over the tortilla.
Step 3: Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of dill on top of the yogurt without adding salt, as the salmon is already salty.
Step 4: Place one slice of smoked salmon on the tortilla.
Step 5: Add a handful of mixed salad greens, or sliced cucumbers and tomatoes, to your preference.
Step 6: Roll the tortilla tightly from one end to the other, ensuring the filling stays inside.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Smoked Salmon Wrap by styling it on a rustic wooden platter, layered with fresh salad greens peeking out. Use natural light from a window to highlight the glossy texture of the Greek yogurt and the rich colors of the smoked salmon. Angle the shot slightly above to emphasize the wrap's layers, focusing on a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background. Add a sprig of dill as a garnish, creating a fresh, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Duck Breast Salad Sandwich
ingredients: 1 head of crisp lettuce, washed and torn
1 large baguette, cut into sandwich lengths
directions: Step 1: On a serving plate, arrange the lettuce and diced tomatoes evenly.
Step 2: Place a few slices of smoked duck breast on top of the salad.
Step 3: Add a spoonful of red wine onion confit to the center of the salad.
Step 4: Dot the edge of the plate with mayonnaise and arrange the sliced hard-boiled egg decoratively.
Step 5: Serve with a large piece of fresh baguette on the side.
Step 6: Alternatively, in a mixing bowl, combine the lettuce, diced tomatoes, and sliced duck.
Step 7: Mix the salad with mayonnaise until everything is coated.
Step 8: Cut open the baguette and fill it with the salad mixture, then top with the red wine onion confit.

recipes.name: Breaded Tomato and Mozzarella Croque
ingredients: 125 grams mozzarella cheese, sliced and drained
1 tablespoon milk, plus extra for brushing
2 tablespoons oil (olive or vegetable) and 2 tablespoons butter for frying
directions: 1. Remove the crusts from the bread slices. Place one slice of mozzarella cheese in the center of a piece of bread. Top with 2 pieces of chopped sun-dried tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Brush the edges with milk, then place another slice of bread on top and press to seal. Repeat with the remaining ingredients.

2. In a mixing bowl, beat together the egg, heavy cream, and milk. Season with salt and pepper. Dip each breaded sandwich into the mixture, ensuring all sides are well-coated, then roll in the bread crumbs.
3. Heat the oil and butter in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the breaded sandwiches until golden and crispy on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Use natural light to emphasize the crispy texture of the bread and the melty mozzarella oozing from the sides. Surround the dish with fresh basil leaves and a sprinkle of coarse sea salt for color contrast. A soft-focus background featuring a blurred vintage tablecloth adds warmth, while a shallow depth of field draws attention to the croque's delicious details, creating an inviting and cozy atmosphere.

recipes.name: Tosta Mista Sandwich
directions: 1. In a mixing bowl, thoroughly combine the softened butter, grated Emmental cheese, ground ham, and finely chopped onion.
2. Add the chopped hard-boiled eggs and mustard to the mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste and mix well.
3. Spread the filling evenly over each slice of sandwich bread, then close each with another slice to form 4 sandwiches.
4. Place the prepared sandwiches in an oven-safe dish and toast them under the grill setting of the oven until golden and crispy.

recipes.name: Ratte du Touquet Croque-Monsieur
ingredients: 800 grams Ratte du Touquet potatoes, peeled and grated
directions: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
Step 2: Peel and wash the Ratte du Touquet potatoes, then grate them. Thinly slice the onion and mince the garlic.
Step 3: In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs, then add the grated potatoes, grated cheese, minced garlic, and sliced onion. Mix well, then incorporate the chopped basil, salt, and pepper to taste.
Step 4: Pour the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Spread it evenly, pressing down firmly, then place it in the oven to bake for approximately 30 minutes.

Step 5: While the potato galette is baking, sauté the slices of filet mignon in a skillet until cooked through. Remove the baking sheet from the oven, flip the galette carefully, and allow it to cool for a few minutes before slicing it into 8 equal portions.

Step 6: On half of the portions, place a slice of soft cheese, followed by a slice of filet mignon, and then another slice of cheese. Top each with the remaining portions of the galette, then return to the oven for a few minutes until the cheese is melted.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a mouthwatering Ratte du Touquet Croque-Monsieur on a rustic wooden board, elevated to showcase its layers of golden, crispy potato and melted soft cheese. Use natural, diffused light to accentuate the vibrant colors of the fresh basil and the warm tones of the cooked filet mignon. Style with a few scattered basil leaves and a small bowl of garlic aioli nearby. Aim for a shallow depth of field, focusing on the crispy edges, while keeping a soft, blurred background to evoke a cozy, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Italian Crunch Sandwich
ingredients: 8 strips of bacon, cooked until crispy
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 260°C (thermostat 9).
Step 2: Open the jar of tomato sauce and slice the mozzarella cheese into thin pieces.
Step 3: Spread the fresh tomato sauce evenly on 4 slices of sandwich bread. Top each slice with half of the mozzarella slices and one strip of crispy bacon.
Step 4: Place another slice of sandwich bread on top of each sandwich, with the sauce side facing inward.
Step 5: Spread additional tomato sauce on top of each sandwich, then add another strip of crispy bacon and the remaining mozzarella slices.
Step 6: Place the sandwiches on a baking tray lined with parchment paper and bake for approximately 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Niçoise Pan Bagnat Sandwich
ingredients: 6 round breads (preferably ciabatta or crusty rolls)
2 tablespoons black olives, pitted and sliced
directions: 1. Cut the round breads in half horizontally.
2. Layer the bottom half of each bread with slices of tomato and red onion.
3. Add the julienned green bell peppers, sliced black radish, halved radishes, and quartered hard-boiled eggs.
4. Top with drained tuna and sprinkle with sliced black olives.
5. Add a handful of arugula on top.
6. Drizzle with olive oil and season with fleur de sel to taste.
7. Cover each sandwich with the top half of the bread and press down firmly to secure the filling.

Complement with scattered arugula leaves and a few radish halves, enhancing the composition with a few black olives for contrast.

recipes.name: Gourmet Bresse Bleu Burger
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven grill to a high setting.
Step 2: In a bowl, combine the mayonnaise, harissa, chili powder, ketchup, and a pinch of salt.
Step 3: Peel and finely chop the onion. Wash and slice the tomatoes. Season the turkey cutlets on both sides.
Step 4: Heat the sunflower oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Grill the turkey cutlets for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until cooked through.
Step 5: Slice the burger buns in half and toast them under the grill until golden.
Step 6: Spread the harissa mayonnaise mixture on the bottom halves of the buns. Top with sliced onions and tomatoes.
Step 7: Place a hot turkey cutlet and a slice of Bresse Bleu cheese on each bun. Return the burgers to the grill for 1 minute or until the cheese begins to melt.
Step 8: Add a handful of mixed salad greens on top, place the bun lids on, and serve immediately.

Surround with a handful of mixed salad greens for freshness. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance textures and colors, focusing on the burger with a shallow depth of field to blur the background. Incorporate a small dish of harissa on the side for added color and interest, creating an inviting, warm mood.

recipes.name: Classic Croque-Monsieur
ingredients: 4 slices of ham (preferably cooked or smoked)
100 grams of melting cheese (such as Gruyère or Emmental), grated
directions: 1. Spread 1/2 tablespoon of softened butter on one side of each slice of bread.
2. In a bowl, whisk together the beaten eggs, whole milk, salt, and black pepper until well combined.
3. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a skillet over medium heat. Remove the skillet from heat.
4. Quickly dip the unbuttered side of 4 slices of bread into the egg mixture, allowing it to soak briefly, then place them, soaked side down, into the skillet.
5. Layer each of the soaked slices with grated cheese and a slice of ham, then top with another slice of cheese and a second slice of bread, unbuttered side facing up.
6. Return the skillet to medium heat and cook until the bottom is golden brown and the cheese begins to melt, about 3-4 minutes.

7. Carefully flip the sandwiches using a spatula, adding another tablespoon of butter to the skillet if necessary, and cook the other side until golden and the cheese is fully melted, about 3-4 minutes.
8. Repeat the process for the remaining ingredients, renewing the egg mixture if needed.
9. Serve hot, cut in half if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Classic Croque-Monsieur on a rustic wooden board, with the sandwich cut in half to reveal the gooey melted cheese and layers of ham. Use soft, natural lighting from the side to enhance the golden-brown crust and textures. Incorporate a light sprinkle of fresh black pepper and herbs for garnish. Set against a muted linen backdrop, shoot from a 45-degree angle to create depth, with a shallow depth of field focusing on the sandwich, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Livarot Chicken Burger
ingredients: 1 small oak leaf lettuce, washed and drained
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven grill. Lightly toast the cut sides of the hamburger buns under the grill and set aside to cool.
Step 2: Grill the pancetta slices for a few minutes under the grill until crispy.
Step 3: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook the sliced chicken for 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Season with salt.
Step 4: Peel the onion and slice it into thin rings. Slice the pickles and the Livarot cheese.

Step 5: Spread mustard and ketchup on 4 bottom halves of the buns. Layer with sun-dried tomatoes, grilled pancetta, chicken, and Livarot cheese. Place the loaded buns under the grill to melt the cheese.
Step 6: Top with lettuce and pickle slices. Spread mustard and ketchup on the top halves of the buns, place them on the burgers, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Croque Mie (French Ham and Cheese Roll)
ingredients: 50 grams Comté cheese, cut into sticks
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Prepare the Mornay sauce: In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the cornstarch and cook for 2 to 3 minutes without browning. Gradually pour in the whole milk while stirring continuously until it reaches a boil. Cook for an additional 3 to 4 minutes until thickened. Stir in the grated Gruyère cheese, then season with salt and pepper.

Step 2: Trim the crusts off the slices of bread and place them in the oven to dry out slightly, then allow to cool. Roll each slice of bread gently with a rolling pin to flatten without tearing. Spread a thin layer of Mornay sauce on each slice, then place half a slice of ham on top. Add more sauce, followed by a stick of Comté cheese in the center.
Step 3: Roll the bread tightly to enclose the filling, ensuring the edges meet. Wrap each roll tightly in plastic wrap and place in the freezer for approximately 5 minutes to firm up.

Step 4: In the meantime, crack the remaining egg into a bowl, season with salt and beat well. Dip each roll in the egg mixture, then roll in the dried bread crusts to coat. Place the rolls on a baking dish and bake for 5 to 6 minutes, until golden brown. Cut into thick slices or rounds and serve warm.

Place the dish on a rustic wooden board, accompanied by a small dish of Dijon mustard and a sprinkle of fresh herbs for color. Use soft, natural light to enhance the textures, casting gentle shadows. Ensure a shallow depth of field, focusing on the sandwich while softly blurring the background, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Pizza Dough Sandwich with Bresse Bleu Cheese
ingredients: 1 handful mixed salad greens, washed and dried
directions: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
Step 2: Roll out the pizza dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Step 3: Prick the dough with a fork to prevent it from puffing up during baking.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Step 5: Once baked, cut the dough into squares resembling the size of sandwich bread.
Step 6: Spread a layer of softened Bresse Bleu cheese on one square of dough.
Step 7: Top with half of the arugula, a few slices of tomato, and a couple of slices of turkey ham.
Step 8: Add additional pieces of Bresse Bleu cheese on top.
Step 9: Season lightly with salt and pepper, then cover with another square of pizza dough.
Step 10: Repeat the process to make additional sandwiches.
Step 11: Serve immediately and enjoy.

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon and Guacamole Sandwich Cake
ingredients: 4 fresh cheese segments (such as carré frais)
A few cherry tomatoes for decoration
directions: 1. Prepare the guacamole by mashing the avocados in a bowl. Add the juice of half a lemon, a few drops of Tabasco, and season with salt and pepper. Stir well and taste to adjust the seasoning as needed.
2. Spread a generous layer of guacamole on two slices of polar bread.
3. On two other slices of bread, spread the St-Moret cheese evenly and layer with the smoked salmon, which has been lightly drizzled with lemon juice.
4. Assemble the sandwich cake by alternating the guacamole-covered bread with the salmon-covered bread, finishing with the last slice of plain bread on top.

5. In a separate bowl, mix the Philadelphia cream cheese with the St-Moret cheese, adding a touch of lemon juice to prevent the mixture from becoming too runny. Use a spatula to spread this mixture over the entire sandwich cake as if icing a cake.
6. Decorate the sandwich with chives and cherry tomatoes. Place in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

Employ a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the sandwich cake's enticing details while evoking a fresh, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Cucumber, Salmon, and Radish Sandwich Cake
ingredients: 1/2 bunch radishes, washed and sliced into thin rounds
1/2 cucumber, peeled and sliced into thin rounds
12 cherry tomatoes (red and yellow) for decoration
A few sprigs of dill for garnish
directions: Step 1: Wash and dry the radishes, trimming the ends before slicing them into thin rounds. Wash and dry the cucumber, then slice half into very thin rounds.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and fresh cheese. Add finely chopped chives, a pinch of fleur de sel, and freshly ground pepper. Mix well until smooth.

Step 3: On a serving platter, place 3 slices of polar bread side by side (like a cake). Spread a layer of the cheese mixture over the bread. Top with cucumber slices, slightly overlapping them. Add the second layer of bread, spreading more cheese mixture on top and covering it with the smoked salmon, drizzled with lemon juice.
Step 4: Add the final layer of bread and spread it with the cheese mixture again. Place the radish slices evenly over the top ensuring full coverage. Finish with a final slice of bread.
Step 5: Trim the chives to lengths matching the height of the sandwich cake, and press them against the sides for decoration. This operation enhances the presentation, though it may take some time.
Step 6: Garnish the top with additional radish slices, cucumber rounds, and assorted cherry tomatoes for decoration. Refrigerate before serving.
Step 7: Enjoy your delicious sandwich cake! For more recipes, visit: http://bellatrice.canalblog.com/

Add a few scattered radish slices and chive sprigs for texture. Use a shallow depth of field to keep the sandwich in sharp focus while softly blurring the background, evoking a fresh, inviting mood.

ingredients: 1 head of Romaine lettuce (can substitute with iceberg lettuce if unavailable)
A few slices of bread, diced into small cubes
Salt and black pepper, to taste (or use ready-made Worcestershire sauce)
directions: Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the diced bread and toast until golden brown, stirring occasionally. Remove and set aside.

Step 2: In the same skillet, add the remaining olive oil and cook the chicken tenders over medium-high heat until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat and cook through for an additional 5-10 minutes until fully cooked.
Step 3: Add the lemon juice and sugar to the skillet with the chicken, cooking for an additional 2 minutes to caramelize. Remove from the heat and let cool.
Step 4: To make the sauce, combine the mayonnaise, white wine vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Whisk until fully combined.

Step 5: To assemble the wraps, place the chopped Romaine lettuce in the center of each wrap. Drizzle with sauce, then top with the caramelized chicken, Parmesan shavings, and toasted bread cubes. Wrap tightly by folding the bottom up over the filling, then folding the sides in, securing with a toothpick if needed.

recipes.name: Crispy Sweet Potato and Ham Baguette
ingredients: 2 large North Carolina sweet potatoes (approximately 400 g), peeled and cut into 5 mm thick slices
Salt and black pepper, to taste
1 baguette (approximately 300 g), sliced in half lengthwise
100 g air-dried French ham, thinly sliced
directions: 1. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them lengthwise into slices approximately 5 mm thick. Blanch the slices in boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Drain and set aside on paper towels. Season each slice with salt and pepper.
2. Prepare the coating by first dredging each sweet potato slice in flour, then dipping it into the beaten egg, and finally coating it with breadcrumbs.
3. Heat cooking oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the coated sweet potato slices until golden brown on all sides, around 5 to 7 minutes. Remove and allow to cool on paper towels.
4. For the Dijon mustard cream, combine the mayonnaise and Dijon mustard in a bowl. Mix until well blended.
5. Rinse and prepare the watercress. Cut the baguette into four pieces and carefully open each piece with a knife. Spread the Dijon mustard cream generously on both sides of the bread.
6. Layer the bottom half of each baguette with the fried sweet potato slices, followed by the slices of ham and a handful of watercress. Close each sandwich with the top half of the baguette.

Use natural light to enhance the vibrant colors of the dish, casting soft shadows for depth. Arrange fresh watercress elegantly beside the baguette and drizzle the mayonnaise-Dijon mixture artfully over the filling. Opt for a slightly overhead angle to highlight the textures, with a blurred rustic wooden table as a warm, inviting backdrop. Aim for a shallow depth of field to draw focus to the baguette while softly blurring the props, creating a cozy, appetizing mood.

recipes.name: Warm Truffle Sandwich with Salted Butter
ingredients: 180 grams fresh Tuber melanosporum truffles, sliced
directions: 1. Slice the fresh truffles into thick slices, about 2 to 3 mm.
2. Generously spread the softened salted butter on each slice of sourdough bread.
3. Place approximately 30 grams of sliced truffles on top of the buttered side of each slice of bread.
4. Close the sandwich and wrap it tightly in film; refrigerate for at least two days to allow the flavors to meld.
5. Preheat a salamander or broiler and toast both sides of the sandwich until golden and warm.
6. Serve the sandwich hot alongside a small salad of fresh arugula.

recipes.name: Beef Hamburger with Cheddar and Beetroot
ingredients: 2 soft burger buns (Rigolo Burger Nature Jacquet)
2 small ground beef patties (100 g each)
A handful of baby leaf salad (such as lamb's lettuce)
2 tablespoons cream cheese or spreadable cheese
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Place the burger buns in the oven to warm and slightly toast them.
2. While the buns are toasting, slice the cooked beetroot into thin rounds and the tomato into even slices.
3. Spread cream cheese evenly on the inner sides of both burger buns. Place a few leaves of baby salad on the bottom buns.

4. In a frying pan over medium heat, cook the ground beef patties with a little cooking fat. Once one side is browned, flip the patty and place a slice of cheddar on top. Cook until the beef reaches your desired level of doneness (rare, medium, or well-done).
5. Transfer the cooked patties with melted cheddar onto the buns over the salad, then layer on the sliced tomato and beetroot.
6. Finally, place the top bun on each burger and serve immediately.

Use natural light to enhance the rich colors and textures, casting soft shadows. Incorporate a blurred background of lush greenery and a small dish of cream cheese. Use a low angle to emphasize height and layers, with a shallow depth of field focusing on the burger, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Goat Cheese and Eggplant Wraps
directions: Step 1: Prepare the eggplant caviar by cooking the diced eggplant in a skillet with olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper over medium heat for about 10 minutes, or until soft. Blend until smooth, then spread the eggplant caviar evenly over each wrap.
Step 2: In the center of each wrap, place a handful of lamb's lettuce and drizzle with olive oil. Top with chopped walnuts, halved cherry tomatoes, and a drizzle of honey.

Step 3: For the goat cheese, coat each piece in flour, then dip in the beaten egg, and finally cover with breadcrumbs. Sauté in a skillet over medium heat until both sides are golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Step 4: Place the crispy goat cheese on top of the fillings in each wrap, then roll up the wraps tightly and slice in half for serving.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich with Grilled Chicken, Tomatoes, Greens, and Cream Cheese
ingredients: 8 slices of Le Bon Poulet Grilled Chicken Fillet
100 g plain soft goat cheese for spreading
directions: 1. Slice the tomatoes into rounds. Peel and thinly slice the red onion. Wash and slice the Granny Smith apple into thin strips, then drizzle with lemon juice to prevent browning. Slice the pickles thinly lengthwise.
2. Dress the arugula salad with olive oil and apple cider vinegar. Toast the crustless sandwich bread in a toaster until golden brown.

3. To assemble the club sandwich, spread a layer of soft goat cheese on one slice of bread, then layer with a slice of grilled chicken, a slice of mimolette cheese, two rounds of tomato, red onion slices, arugula, and apple strips.
4. Spread goat cheese on both sides of a second slice of bread, then repeat the layering process with the previous ingredients. Finish with a third slice of bread spread with goat cheese.
5. Cut the sandwich in half and secure with wooden picks. Repeat the assembly for the remaining sandwiches. Serve immediately.
6. Culinary tip: For an extra indulgence, add a slice of crispy bacon!

recipes.name: Homemade 100% Vegetarian Hamburgers
ingredients: Condiments (mustard, ketchup, or curry sauce to taste)
directions: Step 1: In a bread machine, use the dough program or dissolve the yeast in warm milk and gradually mix it into the combined flours.
Step 2: Add the egg, softened butter, brown sugar, and salt to the mixture. Knead well and cover with a cloth. Let rest for 30 minutes.
Step 3: Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and shape into balls. Sprinkle toppings on top and allow to rest for an additional 30 minutes.
Step 4: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Brush the tops of the dough balls with milk and bake for 15 minutes.
Step 5: While the buns are baking, cook the soy patties in a skillet over medium heat until heated through.
Step 6: Slice each bun, insert a slice of cheese, add a soy patty, and drizzle with your choice of condiment. Serve hot with a side of green salad.

Arrange the burgers on a rustic wooden board, accompanied by a side of sweet potato fries. Include fresh herbs as garnishes, with a blurred background to create depth and focus on the burgers, evoking a cozy, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Freshness Sandwich
directions: Step 1: Boil the eggs in a pot of water for approximately 10 minutes. Drain, cool, peel, and set aside.
Step 2: Spread mayonnaise on 2 slices of sandwich bread. Place half a slice of ham on each slice.
Step 3: Slice the boiled eggs into rounds and arrange them over the ham. Top with the Gouda cheese slices.

Step 4: Rinse and slice the tomato, then place the tomato slices over the Gouda cheese. Finish by adding the lettuce leaves and cover with the remaining slices of sandwich bread. Press down gently to compact.

recipes.name: Niçoise Pan Bagnat Sandwich
ingredients: A handful of black olives, pitted and sliced
directions: Step 1: Boil the eggs in water for 10 minutes. While the eggs are cooking, toast the flatbreads in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for about 5 minutes.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the drained tuna, mayonnaise, chopped chives, salt, and pepper. Mix well and set aside.
Step 3: Rinse all vegetables under cold water and slice the radishes, tomatoes, hard-boiled eggs, and black olives. Thinly slice the basil, iceberg lettuce, and half the onion.
Step 4: Slice the toasted flatbreads in half. Drizzle olive oil on the cut sides and sprinkle with garlic powder.

Step 5: On one half of each flatbread, layer the tomato slices, radishes, a few leaves of iceberg lettuce, and a slice of hard-boiled egg. Add a generous amount of the tuna mixture, followed by a few anchovy fillets (if using), basil, and sliced black olives.
Step 6: Cover with the other half of the flatbread, press down gently, and cut each sandwich in half diagonally. Serve immediately or pack for a picnic.

Arrange the sandwich diagonally, with hard-boiled egg slices artfully displayed. Incorporate fresh basil leaves and a small bowl of anchovy fillets as props for color contrast. Utilize a shallow depth of field to keep the sandwich in sharp focus while softly blurring the background, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Ham, Salad, and Carrot Wraps
ingredients: 8 leaves of lettuce, washed and dried
directions: 1. Wash the lettuce leaves and dry them thoroughly.
2. Peel and wash the carrots, then grate them and set aside.
3. Spread 1 tablespoon of mayonnaise evenly on each tortilla.
4. Lay 2 lettuce leaves on each tortilla, followed by 1 1/2 slices of ham, and sprinkle with grated carrots.
5. Roll each tortilla tightly, then cut them in half diagonally and serve on a plate with your choice of side salad.

directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the plain yogurt and whole grain mustard until well mixed. Set aside.
Step 2: Halve the smoked chicken slices, slice the tomatoes thinly, and cut the Bresse Bleu cheese into rounds.
Step 3: Spread a thin layer of the yogurt-mustard mixture on each tortilla. Top with a lettuce leaf, a few tomato slices, a piece of smoked chicken, and a slice of Bresse Bleu cheese.

recipes.name: Chicken Nugget Wraps
ingredients: 2 cups mixed salad greens, washed and dried
directions: Step 1: Preheat your deep fryer to 180°C (350°F).
Step 2: Wash and dry the mixed salad greens thoroughly.
Step 3: Wash and slice the tomato into thin rounds.
Step 4: Fry the chicken nuggets in the preheated deep fryer for 2 to 3 minutes or until they are golden brown and crispy.
Step 5: Heat the tortilas in the microwave for about 30 seconds to warm them slightly.
Step 6: Spread aioli sauce evenly on each tortilla, then layer with the salad greens and sliced tomatoes.
Step 7: Add the fried chicken nuggets to the center of each tortilla and drizzle with samurai sauce if desired.
Step 8: Microwave the cheddar slices for a few seconds just until they start to melt.
Step 9: Place the melted cheddar over the chicken nuggets, then roll up the tortilla tightly.
Step 10: Serve immediately and enjoy your meal!

recipes.name: American Hamburger with Homemade Meatloaf Buns
ingredients: 4 large hamburger buns, preferably from a reputable brand
6 small fresh white onions, finely chopped
A few sprigs of chives, chopped
1 head of iceberg or butter lettuce, shredded
Special burger American sauce for serving
directions: Step 1: Peel and finely chop the onions. Place them in a food processor and chop until very fine. Add the crackers, eggs, salt, pepper, paprika, lemon juice, cornstarch dissolved in a small amount of cold milk, and chives. Blend until combined; the mixture should be slightly liquid.
Step 2: In a large bowl, place the ground beef patties and break them apart with a fork. Mix in the blended onion preparation. Optionally, add some chopped fresh cilantro for additional flavor.

Step 3: Form the meat mixture into balls using disposable gloves. Coat the meatballs lightly in flour and place them on a plate. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to firm up (they can be made earlier in the day for evening cooking).

Step 4: In a hot skillet, heat oil and a little butter. Flatten each meatball to a diameter slightly smaller than the hamburger buns. Cook over medium heat on both sides until cooked to your desired doneness (medium-rare to medium). Transfer to a plate.

Step 5: Prepare to assemble the hamburgers: Shred the lettuce into chiffonade strips. Slice the tomatoes into thin rounds (beefsteak tomatoes are ideal for their low acidity and fewer seeds). Lightly toast the split hamburger buns. Line a baking tray covered with aluminum foil with the bottom halves of the buns.

Step 6: To assemble the hamburgers: Spread American sauce and ketchup on each bottom bun slice, top with a slice of melted cheddar cheese, some shredded lettuce, a slice of tomato, and a cooked beef patty. Repeat the layering with a slice of tomato, lettuce, cheese, American sauce, and ketchup, then cap with the top half of the bun. Gently press down to compact the burger.

recipes.name: Salmon and Fresh Vegetable Wraps
ingredients: 5 tablespoons light sour cream or plain yogurt
directions: 1. Prepare the sauce: Roughly chop the parsley and chives. In a mixing bowl, combine sour cream (or yogurt) with chopped herbs and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to use.

2. Prepare the vegetables: Slice the tomato and remove seeds and excess juice. Lay out the tortillas and spread 2 slices of smoked salmon on each one. Spread a layer of the prepared sauce over the salmon.
3. Add the sliced tomatoes on top of the sauce, followed by a few leaves of batavia lettuce.
4. Roll the filled tortillas tightly to form the wraps.
5. Preheat a sandwich press or grill pan. Warm the wraps for 2 to 3 minutes until they are slightly heated.
6. Serve the wraps alongside sautéed or fried potatoes for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Duck Confit Burger with Lautrec Pink Garlic Cream
ingredients: 80 grams soft butter, at room temperature
Sesame, sunflower, poppy, or pumpkin seeds, for topping
20 grams Lautrec pink garlic cloves, peeled and germ removed (approximately 3-4 cloves)
4 duck confit thighs from Gers, de-boned and chopped
Mixed greens (such as arugula), for garnish
directions: 1. Begin by preparing the burger buns. In the bowl of a stand mixer, crumble the fresh yeast and add the warmed milk. Mix and let it rest for 10 minutes.

2. Add the flour, sugar, and salt to the yeast mixture. Using a dough hook, knead on medium speed for about 5 minutes. Incorporate the soft butter and increase the speed to high for a few seconds until well combined. Lower the speed back to medium and knead for an additional 10 minutes until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl and is elastic.

3. Preheat your oven to 50°C (122°F) for a few minutes, then turn it off. Place the dough ball in a buttered bowl, cover it with a dry kitchen towel, and let it rise in the turned-off oven for 1 hour until it doubles or triples in volume.
4. After 1 hour, transfer the dough to a floured work surface and briefly knead it by hand. Shape it into a log and cut it into 6 equal pieces.

5. Preheat the oven to 50°C again. Shape each piece into a bun by tucking the dough under itself. Place the shaped buns on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, cover them with a towel, and allow to rise in the turned-off oven for another hour.
6. Once risen, brush the tops of the buns with the beaten egg and sprinkle with seeds. Preheat your oven to 180°C (356°F) and bake the buns for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown.
7. Next, prepare the Lautrec pink garlic cream. Peel and germ the garlic, then blanch it in cold water. Bring the water to a boil, drain, and cool. Repeat the blanching process once more.
8. In a saucepan, combine the blanched garlic, milk, water, and chopped mushrooms. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes.
9. Blend the mixture in a blender or with an immersion blender until smooth. Set aside.
10. Now prepare the duck confit filling. In a skillet, heat the duck confit (with its fat) over medium heat. Remove the meat from the bones and coarsely chop it.

11. In the same skillet, add the sliced onions and sauté in olive oil for about 10 minutes until caramelized. Add the chopped duck confit and deglaze the pan with balsamic vinegar. Stir in the spinach and cook for a few minutes until wilted. Remove from heat and mix in the ricotta cheese until combined.

12. To assemble the burgers, slice the buns in half and lightly warm them in the oven. Spread a layer of Lautrec pink garlic cream on the bottom half of each bun, then use a round cookie cutter to place about 1 to 1.5 cm thick layer of duck confit on top. Top with spinach and drizzle additional garlic cream before serving.

recipes.name: Faluches Recipe
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the active dry yeast and salt. Dissolve the mixture in a little warm water.

Step 2: On a clean work surface, place the all-purpose flour and form a well in the center. Add the yeast-salt mixture and olive oil into the well. Gradually incorporate the warm water until a non-sticky dough ball forms.

Step 3: Knead the dough for about 10 minutes, ensuring to add air into the mixture. Place the dough in a bowl, cover it with a cloth, and let it rise in a warm place at 18-20°C (64-68°F) for approximately 3 hours until it has doubled in size.

Step 4: Once risen, knead the dough again on a floured surface. Divide it into 4 equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. Flatten each ball into a disc using your palm. Repeat this process for the remaining portions.
Step 5: Dust the discs (faluches) with flour and place them on a baking board. Cover them with a cloth again and allow them to rest for about 1 hour until slightly puffed.

Step 6: Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F). Once the faluches have risen again, place them in the preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes. To prevent them from being soggy on the bottom, flip them halfway through the baking time.

scenes.voice_over: Knead the dough for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Then, place it in a bowl, cover with a cloth, and let it rise for 3 hours at 18-20°C.

scenes.image_prompt: The risen dough being punched down and kneaded again on a floured surface, with sections being cut for portions.
scenes.voice_over: Once risen, knead again, divide into 4 equal portions, and flatten each into a disc.

scenes.image_prompt: The discs (faluches) dusted with flour and resting on a baking board covered with a cloth.
scenes.voice_over: Dust the discs with flour and let them rest for about 1 hour until slightly puffed.

scenes.image_prompt: An oven preheating while the faluches are placed inside, showcasing the baking process.

You can add herbs or spices to the dough for extra flavor.

recipes.name: Mozzarella Croque Sandwiches
ingredients: 8 slices of bread (white or whole grain)
directions: Step 1: Drain the mozzarella and slice it. Also, slice the tomatoes into 12 rounds.
Step 2: Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread. Place 4 slices buttered-side down on a plate.

Step 3: On each slice of bread, layer half a slice of Serrano ham, followed by 3 slices of tomato. Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar, then add 2-3 slices of mozzarella cheese, and sprinkle with chopped basil.
Step 4: Cover each sandwich with another slice of bread, with the buttered side facing up. Press down slightly to secure the layers.
Step 5: Cook the sandwiches in a non-stick skillet for 3 minutes on each side, or use a sandwich press for optimal results. For best results, use a medium heat.

recipes.name: Chicken Pita Sandwiches
directions: Step 1: Lay out each pita bread on a clean surface.
Step 2: Evenly distribute the shredded lettuce inside each pita.
Step 3: Top the lettuce with a small handful of finely chopped onions.
Step 4: Add the halved cherry tomatoes evenly into each pita.
Step 5: Place 3 cooked chicken nuggets on the bed of vegetables in each pita.
Step 6: Generously drizzle pepper sauce over the fillings and sprinkle with ground black pepper.
Step 7: Roll each pita tightly and secure with toothpicks, or wrap in aluminum foil.
Step 8: Place the rolled pitas on a baking sheet and heat in the oven at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Homemade Burger with Savora Sauce
ingredients: 3 sweet and sour gherkins (Amora brand), sliced
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Season the ground beef with fine salt and mix thoroughly. Shape the mixture into 6 patties using your hands or a cookie cutter.

Step 2: Shred the Iceberg lettuce and mix it with half of the Savora sauce. Set aside. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining Savora mustard with the Amor ketchup. Slice the Cantal cheese into thin strips using a vegetable peeler. Peel the red onion and slice it into thin rings.

Step 3: In a hot skillet with a drizzle of olive oil, cook each beef patty on both sides to your desired level of doneness. Place the slices of Cantal cheese on the patties while they are still hot. In the same skillet, sauté the onion slices for 2 minutes until soft, adjusting the seasoning to taste.

Step 4: Toast the hamburger buns in the oven for 2 minutes. Assemble the burger by layering: bottom bun – Savora mustard and Amor ketchup – shredded lettuce – sautéed onions – beef patty with melted Cantal cheese – 3 slices of sweet and sour gherkin – remaining Savora sauce and ketchup – top bun.

Step 5: Optionally, add small cubes of preserved lemon to the ground beef for an extra burst of flavor. If desired, once fully assembled, return the burger to the oven for an additional minute to heat through.

Use natural light to enhance the rich colors and textures, casting soft shadows. Style the scene with rustic wooden boards and a side of sweet and sour gherkins on a small white plate. Shoot from a slight overhead angle to showcase the burger's height and layers, with a shallow depth of field focusing on the burger while softly blurring the background for a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Banh Mi Sandwich
ingredients: 1/3 French baguette or 1 small whole grain bun or 1/2 toasted ciabatta
4-5 small lettuce leaves, washed and dried
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 140°C (284°F) and roast the sweet potato for about 1 hour, or until it's cooked through and tender but still firm enough to slice.
2. Allow the sweet potato to cool to room temperature, then peel and cut into 5 mm slices.
3. Peel the carrot and slice it into long strips using a vegetable peeler. Use about half a carrot for each sandwich. Mix the carrot strips with rice vinegar and set aside.
4. Slice the baguette in half lengthwise and remove excess bread from the inside.
5. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise and Hoisin sauce on both sides of the baguette. Add sriracha sauce to taste.
6. Layer the lettuce leaves, roasted sweet potato slices, pickled carrots, and chopped cilantro inside the baguette. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.

Use natural light to enhance the warm tones of the roasted sweet potato and the fresh greens. Style with a side of sriracha and a small dish of Hoisin sauce to add color. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to highlight the sandwich's layers, ensuring a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background while keeping the sandwich as the sharp focal point. Add fresh cilantro sprigs as a garnish for an inviting touch.

recipes.name: Pumpkin Burgers (Vegetarian and Non-Vegetarian)
ingredients: 3 cups pumpkin buns (prepared according to recipe)
200 g ground meat (beef or other choice)
50 g grated Tomme de Savoie cheese
A few leaves of salad (e.g., lettuce)
Sauce of choice (e.g., mustard, mayonnaise, ketchup)
directions: 1. Prepare the pumpkin buns: Peel and cut the pumpkin into large chunks, removing any seeds. Boil in salted water for 30 minutes until tender. Mash to create a puree and let cool completely.
2. In a small bowl, heat the milk in the microwave for 30 seconds. Add the yeast and mix well to activate.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, pumpkin puree, and egg. Gradually add the yeast mixture while kneading the dough until smooth. Incorporate the pumpkin seeds into the dough.
4. Allow the dough to rise in a warm place for 1 hour, then knead again and divide it into small balls the size of mandarins. Let them rise for an additional 30 minutes.
5. Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Brush the tops of the buns with milk and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 20 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.

6. For the carnivore version: In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the chopped onion until soft. Add the ground meat, season with salt and pepper, and cook until browned, forming small patties that match the size of the buns. Cook the patties in the skillet until fully cooked.

7. Assemble each burger: Spread a tablespoon of your chosen sauce on the bottom bun. Add a lettuce leaf, then the meat patty, followed by slices of mushroom and cheese. Secure with a toothpick. Optionally, return to the oven for a few minutes to melt the cheese.
8. For the vegetarian version: In a skillet, sauté the diced eggplant and zucchini in olive oil until tender. Season with salt and pepper.

9. Assemble each vegetarian burger similarly: Spread a tablespoon of your chosen sauce on the bottom bun, add a lettuce leaf, the sautéed eggplant and zucchini mixture, cheese, and sliced mushrooms. Secure with a toothpick. Optionally, heat in the oven for a few minutes to melt the cheese.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant shot of pumpkin burgers, showcasing both the vegetarian and non-vegetarian versions on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to accentuate the warm hues of the pumpkin buns and the golden sesame seeds. Style with fresh arugula and slices of roasted pumpkin beside the burgers. Opt for a slightly overhead angle to reveal the textures and layers, while maintaining a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background, creating a cozy, inviting atmosphere.

recipes.name: Gourmet Chicken and Gorgonzola Salad with Fried Eggplant
ingredients: 1 large eggplant, sliced into thin rounds
Spread of your choice (chicken spread, vegetable spread, crab dip, tuna spread...)
1 to 2 slices sandwich cheese (cheddar, goat cheese, blue cheese, or to taste)
directions: 1. Prepare the breaded eggplant: Wash and dry the eggplant, then slice it into thin rounds. Sprinkle with coarse salt and let it drain for at least 1 hour to remove excess moisture. Rinse with cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
2. In a bowl, mix the breadcrumbs and grated Parmesan cheese. Dip each eggplant slice into the beaten egg, then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. Refrigerate for 1 hour to help the coating adhere.
3. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry the breaded eggplant slices in hot oil for about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
4. Toast the walnuts in a dry skillet over medium heat for about 4 minutes until fragrant, stirring regularly. Set aside.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, black pepper, and salt to create the dressing.
6. In a large salad bowl, combine the mixed greens, diced chicken, sliced apple, sliced pear, dried cranberries, and the prepared dressing. Toss gently to combine.
7. Add crumbled Gorgonzola and diced mozzarella to the salad. Top with toasted walnuts and fried eggplant just before serving.

8. For the accompanying cheese toast: Spread your choice of spread onto the toasted bread. Add cheese slices, close the sandwich, spray lightly with oil, and grill in a skillet until golden brown. Alternatively, toast in a toaster and let the cheese melt gently.
9. Optionally, bake eggplant slices in the oven for about 10 minutes, sprayed lightly with olive oil and seasoned as desired.

recipes.name: Homemade Cheeseburger
ingredients: 4 leaves of lettuce, washed and dried
4 slices of hard cheese (e.g., cheddar or gouda)
Condiments of your choice (e.g., ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise)
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, beaten egg, finely chopped onion, chopped chives, salt, and pepper. Mix until evenly combined.
Step 2: Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape each into a patty.
Step 3: In a non-stick skillet, heat over medium heat and cook the patties for about 10 minutes, flipping halfway through, until cooked through.
Step 4: Meanwhile, toast the hamburger buns in a toaster until golden.
Step 5: Assemble the cheeseburgers by placing a slice of cheese on each patty, followed by a lettuce leaf, and your desired condiments. Place the top half of the bun on each and serve immediately.

Add a few scattered chives and a small bowl of condiments nearby for pops of color, and include a fresh lettuce leaf protruding from the side for added freshness. Aim for a 45-degree angle to accentuate the layers and create a mouthwatering appeal.

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken and Bresse Bleu Sandwich
ingredients: 4 small bread rolls, sliced in half
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Season the chicken tenders with salt and black pepper and cook for 4 to 5 minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through. Keep warm.
Step 2: While the chicken is cooking, wash and slice the tomatoes into rounds, and slice the Bresse Bleu cheese.
Step 3: Open the bread rolls in half and toast them lightly under a grill until golden.
Step 4: Distribute the sliced tomatoes and mixed salad greens evenly inside each toasted roll.
Step 5: Place the warm chicken tenders on top of the vegetables, followed by the slices of Bresse Bleu cheese.
Step 6: Serve the sandwiches immediately, or enjoy them cold if preferred.

recipes.name: Sweet Life Comté Sandwich
ingredients: 3-4 leaves of salad (arugula or mixed greens)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the basil dressing by combining mustard in a bowl and seasoning with salt and pepper. Whisk while gradually adding olive oil until emulsified. Stir in lemon juice and finely chopped basil. Refrigerate until ready to use.
Step 2: Cut the baguette in half lengthwise and drizzle a little olive oil on the inside.
Step 3: Layer the cured ham on the bottom half of the baguette, then add the salad leaves, fresh tomato slices, and sun-dried tomatoes. Drizzle the basil dressing generously over the top.
Step 4: Add the slices of Comté cheese on top of the vegetables and dressing.
Step 5: Close the sandwich with the top half of the baguette, press gently, and slice into portions if desired. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Reimagined Tuna Sandwich
ingredients: 70 grams cream cheese (such as Philadelphia), softened
110 grams canned tuna in water, drained and flaked

directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese, flaked tuna, lemon juice, mango chutney, and chopped coriander leaves.
Step 2: Use a spatula to mix thoroughly until all ingredients are well incorporated. Season with black pepper to taste.
Step 3: To assemble the sandwich, choose your preferred bread (e.g., ciabatta, bagel, baguette). Spread a generous layer of mango chutney on one side of the bread.
Step 4: Add a generous layer of the tuna mixture on top of the chutney, then finish with a few slices of cucumber if desired. Place the other slice of bread on top and press down gently.

recipes.name: Chaource Cheese Burger
ingredients: 4 large lettuce leaves, washed and halved
directions: 1. Finely dice the red onion and set aside.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the ground beef with diced onion, chopped parsley, egg yolk, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well to form a uniform mixture.
3. Divide the meat mixture into four equal portions and shape each portion into a patty.
4. Wash the lettuce leaves and tomatoes. Slice the tomatoes into thin rounds and halve the lettuce leaves.
5. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and cook the beef patties to your desired doneness.
6. Meanwhile, prepare the burger buns by spreading ketchup on the inside of each half (or use your favorite sauce).
7. Set the top halves of the buns aside and place the bottom halves on a baking sheet.
8. Layer each bottom half with a halved lettuce leaf, a few tomato slices, the cooked beef patty, and a slice of Chaource cheese. Top with another halved lettuce leaf.
9. Place the assembled burgers in the oven for 3 to 4 minutes to melt the cheese slightly.
10. Remove from the oven, top with the bun halves, and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a mouthwatering Chaource Cheese Burger stacked high on a rustic wooden board, showcasing the melted cheese oozing over the juicy beef patty. Use natural light to emphasize the vibrant colors of fresh lettuce, ripe tomato slices, and the rich texture of the ground beef. Style with a side of crispy fries in a metal basket and a small bowl of ketchup. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to highlight the layers, with a shallow depth of field focusing on the burger, creating a warm, inviting mood. Add a soft linen napkin and a couple of vintage forks to enhance the rustic charm.

recipes.name: Tomato and Cucumber Sandwich Recipe
ingredients: 8 slices of bread (preferably a round loaf)
4 slices of dry cured sausage (saucisson sec)
directions: 1. Spread butter evenly on two slices of bread.
2. On one slice, layer 2 slices of dry cured sausage and 2 slices of tomato.
3. In a bowl, whisk together vinegar and mustard to create a vinaigrette. Add mixed salad greens, cucumber slices, and cubed Saint-Nectaire cheese. Toss to combine.
4. Spoon the salad mixture over the tomato layer on the sandwich. Drizzle with mayonnaise for decoration.
5. Top with the other buttered slice of bread.
6. Repeat the process for the second sandwich. Use any remaining salad mixture and top with additional cucumber or sausage if desired.

recipes.name: Kiwi and Smoked Salmon Bagel
ingredients: 2 ripe Adour kiwis, peeled and thinly sliced
100 grams plain yogurt or cottage cheese
a few sprigs of fresh cilantro, for garnish
a few sprigs of watercress, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Peel the kiwis and slice each into eight thin rounds. Halve the bagels horizontally and lightly toast them.

Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the plain yogurt with salt and wasabi, adjusting the wasabi to taste for your desired level of spiciness. Spread the yogurt mixture generously on both halves of each bagel.
Step 3: Arrange the kiwi slices in a circular pattern on top of the bagel halves, slightly overlapping them over the edges.
Step 4: Top the kiwi with the smoked salmon, folding it into bite-sized pieces or chiffonade. Sprinkle cilantro and watercress over the top.
Step 5: Place the other half of the bagel on top to create a sandwich.

recipes.name: Croque Signore
directions: Step 1: Toast the slices of whole grain bread in pairs until golden brown and let them cool. Spread softened butter evenly on one side of each slice.
Step 2: Place four slices of bread in a large skillet, buttered side down.
Step 3: Top each slice with one slice of Parma ham.
Step 4: Add shaved Parmesan cheese on top of the ham.
Step 5: Layer a handful of arugula over the cheese.
Step 6: Cover each with the remaining slices of bread, buttered side facing up.
Step 7: Heat the skillet over medium-low heat and cook for 3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.

recipes.name: Spicy Chicken Bagels
ingredients: 1 egg yolk, beaten with a splash of water
Poppy seeds and sesame seeds for topping
2 tablespoons chili sauce (or sweet and sour sauce, if preferred)
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the lukewarm water and active dry yeast. Allow it to sit for 5 minutes until foamy. Then add the flour, salt, vegetable oil, and brown sugar. Mix well until a cohesive dough forms.
Step 2: Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place it in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size.

Step 3: Once risen, punch down the dough and divide it into 10 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a rope and shape it into a bagel by joining the ends together. Place the bagels on a greased parchment paper, cover, and let them rise for an additional 30 minutes.
Step 4: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the brown sugar. Gently poach each bagel for 1 minute on each side. Remove with a slotted spoon and place them on paper towels to drain.
Step 5: Arrange the bagels on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush the tops with the beaten egg yolk and sprinkle with poppy seeds and sesame seeds before baking.
Step 6: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees Celsius (482 degrees Fahrenheit) and bake the bagels for about 12 minutes or until golden brown.
Step 7: While the bagels bake, prepare the filling. In a skillet, sauté the sliced chicken with the chopped shallot and bell pepper over medium heat until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 8: Stir in the tomato paste and chili sauce, cooking for an additional 10 minutes until heated through.
Step 9: Once the bagels are done baking, slice them in half. Fill each bagel with the chicken mixture and add fresh lettuce leaves. Serve immediately and enjoy.

video_script.title: Spicy Chicken Bagels Recipe Tutorial
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious spicy chicken bagels from scratch with this step-by-step tutorial.

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully plated spicy chicken bagel with fresh lettuce, surrounded by colorful ingredients.
scenes.text: Welcome to our Spicy Chicken Bagels tutorial!
scenes.voice_over: Today, we will be making spicy chicken bagels, a perfect combination of flavors and textures!

scenes.image_prompt: An overhead view of all the ingredients needed for the recipe, neatly arranged on a kitchen countertop.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you will need flour, yeast, chicken, vegetables, and spices. Let's check them out!

scenes.image_prompt: A mixing bowl filled with lukewarm water and active dry yeast, with a whisk ready to mix.
scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, combine 350ml of lukewarm water with 2 teaspoons of active dry yeast. Let it sit for 5 minutes until foamy.

scenes.image_prompt: A countertop showing a person mixing flour, salt, vegetable oil, and brown sugar in a large bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add 550 grams of flour, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil, and 1 tablespoon of brown sugar. Mix until a cohesive dough forms.

scenes.image_prompt: A person kneading dough on a floured surface, showcasing their hands working the dough.
scenes.voice_over: Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until it's smooth and elastic. Then let it rise for 1 hour.

scenes.image_prompt: An overhead view of formed bagels ready to rise for a second time, covered with a cloth.
scenes.text: Shape the bagels and let them rise.
scenes.voice_over: After rising, punch down the dough, divide it, shape into bagels, and let them rise for another 30 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A large pot of boiling water with brown sugar, and a slotted spoon ready to poach bagels.
scenes.text: Poach the bagels in boiling water.
scenes.voice_over: Bring a pot of water to a boil, add brown sugar, and gently poach each bagel for 1 minute on each side. Drain on paper towels.

scenes.image_prompt: Bagels arranged on a baking sheet, brushed with egg yolk and topped with poppy and sesame seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Brush the poached bagels with a beaten egg yolk, sprinkle with poppy and sesame seeds, and bake at 250°C for about 12 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A skillet with sautéing chicken, shallots, and bell peppers, with steam rising.
scenes.voice_over: While the bagels bake, sauté 2 sliced chicken fillets with shallots and bell peppers until cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: A skillet with cooked chicken mixture stirred with tomato paste and chili sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in 2 tablespoons of tomato paste and chili sauce and cook for an additional 10 minutes until heated through.

scenes.image_prompt: Freshly baked bagels being sliced in half with steam rising from them.
scenes.text: Slice the bagels and fill them.
scenes.voice_over: Once the bagels are baked, slice them in half, fill with the chicken mixture, and add fresh lettuce.

scenes.image_prompt: The final plate of spicy chicken bagels with fresh ingredients, ready to serve.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Delicious spicy chicken bagels served fresh. Enjoy your meal!

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, marinate the chicken in the chili sauce before cooking.
You can customize the toppings on the bagels with your favorite seeds or spices.

recipes.name: Homemade Kebab Recipe
ingredients: 3 pieces of lamb shoulder (approximately 1.5 kg), cut into strips
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine 4 tablespoons of olive oil with the minced garlic, four-spice powder, sweet pepper, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add the juice of 2 lemons and mix well to create a marinade.
Step 2: Place the lamb strips in the marinade, ensuring they are well-coated. Cover with plastic wrap and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.

Step 3: After marinating, remove the lamb from the refrigerator. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add the lamb strips in batches, browning them until cooked through and slightly charred, about 8-10 minutes. Sprinkle with additional paprika while cooking.

Step 4: To assemble the kebabs, open each pita bread and spread a layer of garlic yogurt sauce (optional) or your preferred sauce inside. Fill with the shredded salad, diced tomatoes, sliced onions, and top with the cooked lamb strips.
Step 5: Serve immediately and enjoy your homemade kebabs!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, overhead shot of homemade kebabs skewered on a rustic wooden board, glistening with marinade. Surround them with warm, toasted pita breads and a colorful array of diced tomatoes, sliced onions, and shredded green salad. Use diffused natural light to enhance the textures of the lamb and vegetables, creating a warm, inviting mood. Incorporate fresh lemon wedges for a pop of color and use a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the kebabs.

scenes.voice_over: Add lamb strips to the marinade, ensuring they're coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least four hours for maximum flavor.

recipes.name: Mexican Beef Pita Recipe
ingredients: 1 red bell pepper, sliced or use mini peppers
Shredded cheddar or emmental cheese, to taste
directions: Step 1: Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Rinse the yellow and red bell peppers, then slice them thinly. Chop the chives and rinse the salad leaves. Cut the salad into strips and arrange on a plate with the cheese. Set aside.

Step 2: In a large skillet or wok, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onion and garlic until translucent, about 2-3 minutes. Add the ground beef and cook until browned, approximately 5-7 minutes.

Step 3: Add the yellow bell pepper and red bell pepper to the skillet. Stir everything together and cook for another 3-4 minutes until the peppers are slightly softened. Mix in a handful of the chopped chives.

Step 4: Pour in the can of diced tomatoes along with their juices and let simmer for about 5 minutes. Season the mixture with chili powder, dried oregano, ground cumin, dried thyme, brown sugar, red wine vinegar, and cornstarch. Stir well and let simmer for an additional 20 minutes.

Step 5: When ready to serve, quickly heat the pita breads in a toaster or stove. Serve the plate of salad with cheese alongside a small bowl of sour cream. Slice a small opening in the top of each pita bread and fill with the spicy Mexican beef mixture, followed by the salad, cheese, and a dollop of sour cream. Enjoy your meal!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of Mexican Beef Pitas arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to emphasize the rich colors of the ground beef, diced tomatoes, and bell peppers. Include fresh cilantro and lime wedges as garnishes for a pop of freshness. Use a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, directing focus to the pitas overflowing with juicy filling. Add textured cloth napkins and a small bowl of salsa to enhance the composition, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich with Roasted Chicken, Bacon, Eggs, and Tomatoes
ingredients: 3 roasted chicken wings or 1/2 cooked chicken breast, shredded
1 cup mixed salad greens (e.g., lettuce, butterhead, romaine)
directions: Step 1: Boil the eggs in water for about 9-10 minutes. Once cooked, cool the eggs in ice water, then peel and slice them.
Step 2: Rinse the tomato and slice it. Rinse the salad greens and chop into bite-sized pieces. Shred the roasted chicken to ensure easy assembly.
Step 3: In a skillet over medium-high heat, cook the bacon until crispy, then drain on paper towels to remove excess fat.
Step 4: Toast the slices of whole wheat bread until golden brown using a toaster or skillet.
Step 5: On the first slice of toasted bread, spread 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise, then add a layer of salad greens, followed by 2 slices of tomato, and the shredded chicken.
Step 6: Place a second slice of bread on top, spread with more mayonnaise, and layer on the sliced eggs, crispy bacon, and another handful of salad greens.
Step 7: Top with the final slice of bread, then cut the sandwich diagonally. Secure with toothpicks in each triangle and arrange on a plate.
Step 8: Serve with chips or fries on the side for a complete meal.

Use a rustic wooden board as a backdrop, complemented by a soft linen napkin. Position the sandwich at a 45-degree angle to showcase its height and layers. Employ soft, natural light to enhance the textures of the whole wheat bread and greens. recipes.name: Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich
directions: 1. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add olive oil and lemon juice.
2. Add the sliced chicken breast to the skillet and sauté until browned.
3. Pour in the teriyaki sauce, and simmer until the sauce thickens and is slightly syrupy. Remove from heat and set aside.
4. In the meantime, prepare the vegetables: shred the cabbage and dice the red bell pepper as desired.
5. Slice the bread lengthwise on one side to create a pocket.
6. Place the shredded cabbage and fresh bean sprouts inside one half of the bread.
7. Add the cooked chicken with teriyaki sauce on top of the vegetables, then sprinkle diced red bell pepper over the filling.
8. Close the sandwich and grill it in a panini press or under the broiler until heated through.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich, with two golden toasted bread slices cradling juicy sliced chicken breast glazed in teriyaki sauce, topped with vibrant shredded white cabbage, crunchy bean sprouts, and diced red bell pepper. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the glossy textures and rich colors. Position the sandwich on a rustic wooden board, accompanied by a small bowl of teriyaki sauce and a sprinkle of sesame seeds, creating a warm, inviting mood with a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the sandwich.

recipes.name: Fresh Salmon Tortilla Wraps
directions: Step 1: Spread the fresh herb cream cheese evenly over the center of each tortilla.
Step 2: Slice the cucumber into medium rounds and place 5-6 slices onto the center of each tortilla.
Step 3: Cut the Dutch cheese into thin slices and layer them on top of the cucumber slices.
Step 4: Chop the smoked salmon into small pieces and scatter them over the cheese.
Step 5: Drizzle a few drops of balsamic vinegar over the filling mixture.
Step 6: Fold the sides of the tortilla over the filling and roll it tightly to enclose the wrap.
Step 7: Cut each wrap in half and serve in tall glasses or verrines.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Tofu Burger
ingredients: 60 grams firm tofu, pressed and sliced
A handful of green oak lettuce or leaf lettuce, washed and dried
A handful of fresh cilantro leaves, washed and dried
directions: 1. Press and drain the tofu, then cut a slice of approximately 60 grams.
2. Peel and thinly slice the red onion. Wash, core, and dice the tomato.

3. In a skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the tofu slice and cook until golden brown, about 1 minute on each side. Add 1/4 of the sliced red onion and the diced tomato, and sauté for an additional 2 minutes.
4. Stir in the barbecue sauce and let it simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.
5. While the tofu is cooking, halve the avocado and carefully remove the pit. Slice the flesh and drizzle with lemon juice, then season with salt and pepper.
6. Wash and dry the lettuce and cilantro leaves.
7. Toast the burger bun in a toaster until golden brown.

8. Assemble the burger by placing a lettuce leaf on the bottom half of the bun, followed by the tofu mixture, slices of avocado, and remaining red onion. Add cilantro leaves, and finally, cap with the top half of the bun.

Use natural lighting from a side window to enhance the textures and colors, creating soft shadows. Incorporate fresh green oak lettuce and cilantro as garnish, while a drizzle of barbecue sauce adds a glossy finish. recipes.name: Francesinha Sandwich
ingredients: 1 can of Portuguese sausages, sliced lengthwise
directions: Step 1: In a saucepan, combine the chopped onions, minced garlic, bay leaves, beef bouillon cubes, tomato paste, port wine, and beer. Cook over medium heat for 30 minutes.
Step 2: Remove the bay leaves from the sauce and blend until smooth. Stir in 1 tablespoon of flour to thicken the sauce, then set aside.
Step 3: Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F).
Step 4: In an oven-safe dish, layer 1 slice of bread, followed by 1 slice of ham, and 1 sliced sausage. Cut the pork escalopes in half and place them on top of the sausages.
Step 5: Cover with another slice of bread and top with 4 slices of cheese.
Step 6: Place the dish in the oven until the cheese melts, approximately 10-15 minutes.
Step 7: Remove from the oven, generously pour sauce over the sandwich, and serve with potato fries.

Style the sandwich on a rustic wooden board, garnished with fresh parsley and a side of crispy fries. recipes.name: Roast Pork Sandwich with Sea Salt, Mustard, and Sweet Potato Fries
ingredients: 1 kg roast pork, ready for seasoning
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
Sweet potato fries and red onion
1 kg sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into long strips
Fleur de sel (Le Guérandais), for serving
directions: Step 1: Wash the sweet potatoes and cut them into long strips about 1 cm thick. Peel and slice the red onion into thin rings. Soak the sweet potato strips in ice water for 15 minutes. Heat the frying oil in a deep fryer.

Step 2: Drain the sweet potato strips and pat them dry using paper towels. Fry them in the hot oil for 5 minutes until they are golden. Remove them from the oil and drain on paper towels. Repeat the process with the sliced red onion.

Step 3: Preheat the oven to 230°C (450°F). In a bowl, mix the chopped sage, grated nutmeg, crushed mustard seeds, crushed coriander seeds, and a few turns of black pepper. Rub this mixture all over the pork roast and wrap it in slices of Parma ham.
Step 4: Line the bottom of a Dutch oven with a 2 cm thick layer of coarse sea salt. Place the pork roast on top and cover it with the remaining salt, ensuring an even 2 cm layer over the top.

Step 5: Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Let the roast rest for 15 minutes before breaking the salt crust. Carefully break the crust and remove the excess salt. Slice the roast into thin pieces.
Step 6: Assemble the sandwiches by placing the sliced roast pork into the halved poppy seed rolls. Add a spread of mustard and some rings of red onion.
Step 7: Serve with sweet potato fries, garnished with a sprinkle of Espelette pepper and fleur de sel.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a beautifully assembled Roast Pork Sandwich, showcasing the glistening layers of seasoned roast pork, Parma ham, and vibrant mustard between poppy seed rolls, garnished with sage leaves. Use natural light to emphasize the textures of the crispy sea salt and the golden-brown sweet potato fries arranged artfully on the side. Employ a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, focusing on the sandwich while maintaining a warm, inviting mood with rustic wooden surfaces and elegant ceramic dishware.

recipes.name: Duck Breast Bagels with Marinated Duck Breast, Foie Gras, Onion Compote with Floc de Gascogne & Dried Apricots
ingredients: 1 duck breast (magret de canard), sliced thinly
Salt and freshly cracked black pepper, to taste
2 tablespoons Floc de Gascogne, for onion compote
directions: 1. Prepare the marinated duck breast: Remove the fat from the duck breast and slice it into very thin pieces. In an airtight container, place the sliced duck breast, add the lime juice, olive oil, and Floc de Gascogne. Season with salt and freshly cracked pepper. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.

2. Prepare the bagels according to Mercotte's recipe: In a bowl or a mixing bowl of a stand mixer, combine the flour, crumbled yeast, salt, sugar, olive oil, and water. Knead for about 10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. Divide the dough into 6 equal pieces and shape each piece into a ball. Then, create a hole in the center of each ball and enlarge it to about 5 cm in diameter. Place the bagels on a lightly floured surface, cover with a cloth, and let rise for about 2 hours until they double in size. After rising, preheat the oven to 220°C. Boil 3 liters of water with salt, brown sugar, and potato starch. Poach each bagel for 1 minute on one side and 30 seconds on the other side. Remove with a slotted spoon and place on a clean towel to absorb excess moisture. Place them on an oiled baking sheet, brush with beaten egg, sprinkle with pine nuts, and bake for 15 minutes.

3. Prepare the onion compote: Finely slice the onions and cook them in a saucepan with 2 tablespoons of sugar and 2 tablespoons of Floc de Gascogne. Cook over low heat for about 10 minutes, then set aside.

4. Assemble the bagels: Slice each bagel in half. On one half, layer with arugula, the onion compote, marinated duck breast slices, chopped dried apricots, and foie gras slices. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Serve and enjoy!

Arrange the bagels on a rustic wooden board, garnished with dried apricots and lime wedges for a pop of color. Use soft, diffused natural light to accentuate the glossy textures of the duck and compote. Employ a shallow depth of field to blur the background, focusing sharply on the bagels, creating a warm, inviting mood perfect for a gourmet magazine spread.

recipes.name: Teriyaki Chicken Sandwich
ingredients: 1,500 g chicken thighs, skinless and boneless, marinated
100 g sweet soy sauce or teriyaki sauce
500 g potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks
1 small red apple, sliced with skin
50 g sweet soy sauce for dressing
1 head of butter lettuce (batavia), washed and leaves separated
directions: 1: The day before, pierce the chicken thighs with a fork and marinate them in sweet soy sauce overnight.
2: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F). Place the marinated chicken on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake until cooked through, about 20-25 minutes.
3: For the teriyaki filling, peel and wash the potatoes and carrots. Cook the potatoes and carrots separately in the microwave until tender, about 10 minutes each.
4: Mash the potatoes while they are still warm. Finely slice the onion and add it to a large mixing bowl.
5: Chop the apple, keeping the skin on, and add it to the bowl along with the hard-boiled eggs and diced ham.
6: Mix in the mashed potatoes, sweet soy sauce, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper until well combined.
7: Add the thawed peas to the mixture and stir gently to combine.
8: For assembly, slice the sandwich rolls in half and spread mayonnaise evenly on both sides.
9: Layer two leaves of butter lettuce on the bottom half, followed by the teriyaki chicken and the filling generously.
10: Drizzle extra sweet soy sauce over the filling, place the top half of the roll on, and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Arrange the sandwich on a rustic wooden board, surrounded by vibrant, colorful sides of roasted potatoes and peas, with finely chopped carrots artistically scattered. Use a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the sandwich's layers. Add fresh herbs as garnish, and incorporate a textured linen napkin to enhance the inviting, homey mood.

recipes.name: Vietnamese Banh Mi with Pulled Pork
ingredients: 60 g pulled pork, cooked and shredded
For the pulled pork: Approximately 700 g cooked pulled pork
1.2 kg pork shoulder or pork roast, boneless
For the mixed pickled vegetables (for ~4 sandwiches):
100 g fermented red cabbage or raw shredded white or red cabbage
directions: 1. Prepare the pulled pork in advance if desired: Massage the pork shoulder with coarse salt, black pepper, and granulated sugar. Refrigerate overnight.
2. Cook the pork in a covered Dutch oven or baking dish in a preheated oven at 120°C (248°F) for 6 hours, basting occasionally with pan juices. Reserve the cooking juices.
3. Allow the cooked pork to cool for 30 minutes at room temperature, then shred it using two forks.
4. In a separate bowl, prepare the pickled vegetables: Grate the carrots and cabbage if necessary, and finely slice the young onion. Combine all ingredients and let them sit for at least 30 minutes.
5. To assemble the sandwiches: Cut the baguette in half and remove excess bread from inside. Spread mayonnaise, followed by Hoisin sauce, and Sriracha sauce if using.
6. Layer the lettuce leaves and drained pickled vegetables on the baguette. Top with warm pulled pork, adding a final drizzle of mayonnaise and Hoisin sauce.
7. Garnish with coriander leaves and mint. Add a pinch of salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste.

Use natural light to emphasize the textures of the pulled pork and the fresh, vibrant colors of the pickled vegetables and herbs. Incorporate soft-focus mint leaves in the foreground for depth, while keeping the sandwich as the sharp focal point. Add a small bowl of Sriracha sauce nearby for an inviting touch, and enhance the scene with a light, airy background to evoke freshness.

recipes.name: Reblochon, Honey, and Walnut Sandwich
directions: 1. Place the arugula leaves on one half of the slice of country-style bread.
2. Lay the slices of reblochon cheese over the arugula. Coarsely chop two walnut halves and gently press them into the reblochon. Drizzle with honey.
3. Top with the slice of cured ham, then cover with the other half of the bread. Press down lightly.
4. For a finishing touch, garnish with an additional walnut half and a drizzle of honey if desired.

Use natural light from a window to enhance the golden tones of the honey and the creamy texture of the cheese. recipes.name: Goat Cheese and Basil Croque Monsieur
ingredients: 8 slices of bread (white or whole grain)
1 bunch of fresh basil, with 3-4 leaves per sandwich
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 230°C (450°F). Rinse the fresh basil and set it aside. Slice the goat cheese and tomato into thin rounds.

Step 2: On the first slice of bread, layer a slice of Emmental cheese followed by a slice of ham. Add 2 slices of tomato, then top with 3 slices of goat cheese and finish with fresh basil leaves and a pinch of dried basil. Place a second slice of bread on top and press down gently.
Step 3: Brush the outer sides of each sandwich with olive oil. Prepare a baking tray lined with parchment paper and place the sandwiches on it.
Step 4: Bake in the oven for 10 minutes at 220°C (430°F) or until the sandwiches are golden brown and crisp. Serve immediately alongside a fresh salad.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a Goat Cheese and Basil Croque Monsieur, sliced diagonally to reveal its creamy, textured layers of fresh goat cheese, ham, and vibrant basil. video_script.title: Goat Cheese and Basil Croque Monsieur Recipe

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully plated Croque Monsieur on a rustic wooden table, with fresh basil leaves and a side salad, showcasing the golden brown crust and melted cheese.

scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today we’re making a gourmet take on the classic Croque Monsieur with goat cheese and fresh basil.

scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you will need 8 slices of bread, 4 slices of ham, 200 grams of fresh goat cheese, a bunch of fresh basil, dried basil, optional Emmental cheese, and a medium tomato. Don't forget olive oil!

scenes.image_prompt: A chef preheating an oven and rinsing fresh basil in a bowl, with the sliced goat cheese and tomato visible on a cutting board.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 230 degrees Celsius. Rinse your basil, slice the goat cheese and tomato into thin rounds.

scenes.voice_over: On one slice of bread, layer Emmental cheese, ham, tomato slices, goat cheese, fresh basil leaves, and a pinch of dried basil. Top with another slice of bread.

scenes.voice_over: Brush the outer sides of each sandwich with olive oil and place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.

scenes.voice_over: Bake in the oven for 10 minutes at 220 degrees Celsius, or until golden brown and crisp.
