scenes.voice_over: Look at that golden brown perfection! Your Croque Monsieur is ready to serve.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished Croque Monsieur served on a plate with a side salad and garnished with extra basil leaves, making it visually appealing.
scenes.voice_over: Serve immediately alongside a fresh salad for a delightful meal! Enjoy your Goat Cheese and Basil Croque Monsieur!

cooking_tips: Use a combination of fresh and dried basil for enhanced flavor.
Feel free to substitute with any cheese you prefer.

recipes.name: Chicken Fajitas Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Mexican spices (adjust according to preference)
Salt and black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: In a sauté pan, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onion and red bell pepper, and sauté for about 5 minutes until softened.
Step 2: Add the sliced zucchinis to the pan. Season with salt and pepper, and cook for an additional 5 minutes until the zucchinis are tender.
Step 3: Slice the chicken fillets into thin strips. In a separate pan, heat a bit of olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook for 4 to 5 minutes until browned and cooked through.

Step 4: Combine the cooked chicken with the sautéed vegetables. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato purée, and the dissolved chicken bouillon cube in 100 ml of water. Stir well and let simmer covered on low heat for 25 minutes. Add more water if needed.

Step 5: Warm the tortillas in a separate skillet or in the microwave. To assemble, place some salad leaves on a tortilla, add a generous tablespoon of guacamole, and sprinkle with grated edam cheese. Roll up the tortilla, secure with a toothpick, and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of Chicken Fajitas, artfully arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use soft, natural light to illuminate the dish, enhancing the glossy textures of the chicken and colorful veggies. Incorporate a few scattered fresh cilantro leaves and lime wedges for garnish. Utilize a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the fajitas, tortillas, and diced tomatoes, evoking a warm, inviting mood perfect for a culinary magazine spread.

recipes.name: Croque Pesto with Mozzarella and Serrano Ham
ingredients: 30 grams fresh basil leaves, washed and dried
A handful of arugula or microgreens for garnish
directions: Step 1: Prepare the pesto: In a blender, combine the basil, grated Parmesan, toasted pine nuts, garlic, and olive oil. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Step 2: Take 3 slices of white bread and spread a generous amount of pesto on each slice.
Step 3: Layer a slice of Serrano ham over the pesto on each slice of bread, followed by slices of fresh mozzarella cheese.
Step 4: Add a little more pesto on top of the mozzarella, and then place the remaining 3 slices of bread on top to make sandwiches.
Step 5: Cook the sandwiches in a sandwich maker or place them on a baking tray in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 15 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.
Step 6: Serve the croque pesto with a garnish of arugula or microgreens drizzled with a little olive oil. Enjoy your meal!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a beautifully stacked Croque Pesto with Mozzarella and Serrano Ham on a rustic wooden board. Use natural, diffused light to accentuate the vibrant green of the pesto and the creamy texture of the mozzarella. Incorporate a soft-focus background with muted earth tones to enhance the dish's colors. Garnish with a sprinkle of pine nuts and a handful of arugula, creating depth with a shallow depth of field that draws attention to the layers of ingredients.

video_script.title: Croque Pesto with Mozzarella and Serrano Ham Recipe Tutorial
video_script.description: Learn how to make a delicious Croque Pesto with fresh mozzarella and savory Serrano ham in this step-by-step recipe tutorial.

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully plated Croque Pesto sandwich, showcasing golden bread, melted mozzarella, and vibrant green pesto, garnished with arugula and a drizzle of olive oil.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to our cooking channel! Today, we are making a delightful Croque Pesto with mozzarella and Serrano ham.

scenes.voice_over: Let's start by gathering our fresh ingredients: basil, pine nuts, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and olive oil for our homemade pesto.

scenes.image_prompt: A blender filled with basil, garlic, Parmesan, pine nuts, and olive oil ready to blend, with ingredients artfully arranged around it.
scenes.voice_over: In a blender, combine 30 grams of basil, 50 grams of grated Parmesan, 50 grams of toasted pine nuts, 1 garlic clove, and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Blend until smooth and creamy.

scenes.image_prompt: Three slices of white bread laid out with a generous layer of vibrant green pesto spread on top of each slice.
scenes.voice_over: Take 3 slices of white bread and spread a generous amount of pesto on each slice.

scenes.image_prompt: A hand layering slices of serrano ham over the pesto-covered bread, with fresh mozzarella nearby.
scenes.voice_over: Next, layer a slice of Serrano ham over the pesto on each slice, followed by slices of fresh mozzarella cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: A drizzle of pesto being added on top of the mozzarella on the assembled croque sandwiches.
scenes.voice_over: Add a little more pesto on top of the mozzarella, and then top with the remaining 3 slices of bread to form sandwiches.

scenes.image_prompt: Sandwiches placed in a sandwich maker or on a baking tray, with an oven in the background set to 180°C.
scenes.voice_over: Cook the sandwiches in a sandwich maker, or place them on a baking tray in a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius for 15 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.

scenes.image_prompt: Final plated Croque Pesto with a handful of arugula on the side, drizzled with olive oil, creating an inviting serving presentation.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your delicious Croque Pesto with a garnish of arugula or microgreens drizzled with olive oil. Enjoy your meal!

cooking_tips: Feel free to customize the pesto by adding nuts like walnuts or almonds.
For a vegan version, substitute mozzarella with an plant-based cheese.

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Wraps
ingredients: 4 slices of Mimolette cheese or cheese of your choice
4 tablespoons cream cheese (such as Saint-Moret or Greek yogurt)
50 g cucumber, thinly sliced or diced
Fresh dill, chives, parsley, or herbs of your choice, chopped
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, mix the cream cheese with the red lumpfish roe and season lightly with pepper. Add the chopped herbs and mix well.
Step 2: Spread the cream cheese mixture evenly over each tortilla.

Step 3: For two of the tortillas, layer a lettuce leaf, a slice of smoked salmon, and some cucumber slices. Roll the tortillas tightly without tearing them, and secure them with a toothpick if necessary.
Step 4: Repeat the process with the remaining two tortillas, this time using slices of Mimolette cheese in place of smoked salmon.
Step 5: Enjoy your wraps!

recipes.name: Greek Pita Sandwich
directions: Step 1: Slice the onion and olives into thin rounds. Dice the tomato, bell pepper, cucumber, and feta cheese into small cubes. Shred the lettuce.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, sugar, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to form a dressing.
Step 3: Add the prepared vegetables to the dressing and mix until the vegetables are coated.
Step 4: Lightly toast the pita breads. Carefully open each pita and fill with the prepared vegetable mixture. Roll up the pita to serve.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Greek Pita Sandwich on a rustic wooden board, styled with a drizzle of olive oil glistening on the yogurt sauce. Use natural light to illuminate the textures of the crispy pita and fresh lettuce, creating soft shadows. Incorporate fresh oregano sprigs and a lemon wedge as props, enhancing the Mediterranean feel. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to showcase the layers inside the sandwich, with a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the sandwich while softly blurring the background. Aim for a warm, inviting mood that highlights freshness and flavor.

video_script.title: Delicious Greek Pita Sandwich Recipe

scenes.text: Welcome to our Greek Pita Sandwich tutorial!

scenes.voice_over: First, slice the onions and olives, and dice the tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, and feta cheese. Shred the lettuce. This will add freshness to your sandwich.

scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, combine 6 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 cup of yogurt, 2 tablespoons of lemon juice, 1 clove of minced garlic, 1 teaspoon of sugar, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until smooth.

scenes.image_prompt: A large mixing bowl filled with colorful diced vegetables being tossed in the dressing.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the prepared vegetables to the dressing and mix until everything is well coated with that creamy goodness.

scenes.voice_over: Lightly toast the pita breads until they're warm and slightly crispy, just a couple of minutes is enough.

scenes.voice_over: Carefully open each pita and fill with the vegetable mixture. Roll them up gently, and they're ready to serve!

scenes.image_prompt: Two assembled Greek Pita Sandwiches on a plate, surrounded by a side of Greek olives and small bowl of tzatziki sauce.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Enjoy your delicious Greek Pita Sandwich, rich in flavor and perfect for your next meal.

cooking_tips: For added flavor, marinate the vegetables in the dressing for 30 minutes before serving.
Serve with a side of tzatziki for a traditional touch.

recipes.name: Homemade Hamburger Buns
ingredients: 30 grams soft butter, at room temperature
directions: Step 1: Place all ingredients in a bread machine and select the dough program.
Step 2: Once the program is finished, divide the dough into 8 to 12 equal pieces, depending on the desired size of the buns.
Step 3: Shape each piece into a ball and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Step 4: Allow the buns to rise in a warm place for 40 minutes or until doubled in size.
Step 5: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Step 6: Brush the tops of the buns with a little milk to give them a nice glaze.
Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes or until golden brown.
Step 8: Once baked, allow to cool slightly before serving. Customize with cheese, hamburger patties, lettuce, and ketchup as desired.

recipes.name: Kebab with Marinated Turkey and White Sauce
directions: 1. Cut the turkey cutlets into small cubes. In a large mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, paprika, ginger, curry powder, salt, pepper, vinegar, and Herbes de Provence. Mix well and add the turkey pieces, coating them evenly in the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.
2. In a separate bowl, mix the plain yogurt with the lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and parsley until well combined to create the white sauce.
3. Heat a pan over medium-high heat and cook the marinated turkey until browned and cooked through, approximately 7-10 minutes.
4. While the turkey is cooking, prepare the vegetables by slicing the tomatoes and onions, and chopping the lettuce.

5. To assemble the kebabs, lay the flatbreads flat or slightly open the faluches and spread a layer of the white sauce on the bottom. Add chopped lettuce, sliced tomatoes, and onions. Top with the cooked turkey and drizzle more white sauce atop. Fold or wrap the flatbreads, securing with a toothpick if necessary.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant close-up of marinated turkey kebabs elegantly arranged atop warm Lebanese flatbreads, surrounded by fresh sliced tomatoes and crisp lettuce. Use natural diffused lighting to accentuate the juicy textures and colors of the turkey and creamy white sauce. Incorporate a rustic wooden background, with a side of lemon wedges for a pop of color. Opt for a shallow depth of field to blur the background slightly, directing focus on the kebabs, creating a warm, inviting mood.

scenes.voice_over: Now heat a pan over medium-high heat and cook the marinated turkey for about 7 to 10 minutes until it's browned and cooked through.

recipes.name: Croque au Bresse Bleu
ingredients: 200 grams Bresse Bleu cheese, sliced thinly
8 large slices of crustless sandwich bread
4 large slices of thin white ham, cut into pieces
60 grams unsalted butter, melted for brushing
directions: Step 1: Preheat the broiler of your oven.
Step 2: Melt the unsalted butter in a microwave-safe bowl.
Step 3: Slice the Bresse Bleu cheese into very thin pieces.
Step 4: Cut the slices of ham into pieces that match the size of the bread.
Step 5: Place half of the ham on 4 slices of bread, then layer with the slices of Bresse Bleu and the remaining ham.
Step 6: Top each with another slice of bread and press down lightly.
Step 7: Brush the melted butter on both sides of the sandwiches using a pastry brush.
Step 8: Toast the sandwiches under the broiler for 3 minutes per side or until golden brown.
Step 9: Remove the sandwiches, cut them into thirds, and serve immediately.
Step 10: Serve with small pieces of tomatoes and arugula dressed in vinaigrette.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a freshly toasted Croque au Bresse Bleu, showcasing the rich, melty cheese oozing from between the golden-brown crusts of sandwich bread. Use natural light to enhance the textures and colors, positioning the dish on a rustic wooden board. Include a delicate sprig of thyme for garnish and a small dish of melted butter nearby. Employ a shallow depth of field to create a soft background, drawing focus to the layers of cheese and ham, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Mini Madeleine Burgers
directions: Step 1: For the madeleines: Pour the milk into a shallow dish. Add the sweet mustard, salt, and pepper; mix well. In a separate dish, beat the eggs. Cut the madeleines in half and dip the cut sides into the milk to soak slightly, then into the beaten eggs. Heat a bit of butter in a frying pan and fry the madeleine halves for about 1 minute and 30 seconds on the cut side; set aside.
Step 2: In a bowl, mix together the heavy cream and fromage blanc. Add the chopped shallot, chives, and parsley; season to taste. Slice the cherry tomatoes.
Step 3: Shape the beef patty into six smaller patties the same diameter as the madeleines. Cook them in a very hot frying pan to your desired doneness.

Step 4: For assembling: Place the cheese pieces on the cooked patties while they are still warm. On one half of each madeleine, spread some of the herb sauce, add a few arugula leaves, then place the beef patty on top. Top with a slice of cherry tomato and finish with the diced avocado. Secure the madeleine with a toothpick to hold the layers together.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning overhead shot of Mini Madeleine Burgers arranged on a rustic wooden board. Position the halved madeleines as the top and bottom buns, with the juicy beef patty peeking through. Nestle slices of cherry tomatoes and diced avocado artfully around the burgers, with a handful of vibrant arugula cascading over one side. Use soft, diffused natural light to illuminate the textures, enhancing the golden madeleines and vibrant colors. A shallow depth of field should blur the background slightly, drawing focus to the dish while a few scattered mustard droplets add a playful touch.

recipes.name: Spinach Croque-Madame with Quail Eggs
directions: 1. Toast the sandwich bread until golden brown.
2. In a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the washed spinach for 2 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and add the grated ginger. Reserve the mixture.
3. In a non-stick skillet, melt the butter over low heat. Crack the quail eggs into the skillet and cook until the whites are set and the yolks remain runny.
4. Assemble the toasts: place a generous spoonful of the sautéed spinach on each slice of toasted bread, top with three quail eggs per slice, and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Spinach Croque-Madame with Quail Eggs on a rustic wooden board. Use soft, natural light from a window to illuminate the dish, enhancing the rich greens of the spinach and the golden hues of the quail eggs. Style with a delicate white porcelain plate and accent with fresh herbs for garnish. Focus on a slightly elevated angle to showcase the layers of the sandwich, with a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background, creating an inviting, warm mood.

scenes.voice_over: Toast two slices of sandwich bread until they are golden brown, about 3-4 minutes.

scenes.voice_over: In a pan, heat one teaspoon of olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the washed spinach for about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper, then add 10 grams of grated ginger.

scenes.image_prompt: A non-stick skillet on the stove with six quail eggs, some of them being gently cracked open.
scenes.voice_over: In a non-stick skillet, melt 10 grams of butter over low heat. Crack six quail eggs into the skillet and cook until the whites are set, but the yolks remain runny, roughly 3-4 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Two slices of toasted bread with sautéed spinach layered on top, ready for the quail eggs.
scenes.voice_over: Now, assemble your toasts by placing a generous spoonful of the sautéed spinach on each slice of toasted bread.

scenes.voice_over: Top each slice of toast with three quail eggs and enjoy their delicate flavor.

scenes.voice_over: Your Spinach Croque-Madame with Quail Eggs is ready to serve. Enjoy this delicious dish with a fresh salad on the side.

cooking_tips: Use fresh spinach for the best flavor and texture.
Be gentle when cracking the quail eggs to avoid breaking the yolks.

recipes.name: Moroccan Stuffed Bread (Batbout) with Carrots
ingredients: 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (for filling)
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, semolina, yeast, sugar, olive oil, and salt. Gradually add warm water until a soft dough forms. Knead the dough for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Step 2: Cover the dough with a cloth and let it rise in a warm place for 30 minutes.

Step 3: In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the chopped onion until golden, then add the grated carrots, parsley, cilantro, sliced olives, cumin, harissa, and additional salt. Mix well and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, then stir in the grated hard-boiled eggs and allow to cool.
Step 4: Divide the dough into small balls and cover with a cloth. Let them rest for 10 minutes.

Step 5: On a floured surface, flatten a ball of dough. Spoon the filling on top, fold the dough over to enclose the filling, and reshape it into a disc. Repeat with remaining dough and filling, then let them rest for 20 minutes.
Step 6: In a skillet over medium heat, cook each disc for 30 seconds on each side until golden and cooked through.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of Moroccan Stuffed Bread (Batbout) with Carrots, styled on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to enhance the golden crust and vibrant orange filling, creating soft shadows for depth. Incorporate fresh herbs like cilantro as garnishes, and a small bowl of cumin on the side. Choose a shallow depth of field to blur the background, emphasizing the textures of the bread and carrots, while maintaining a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Delicious Moroccan Stuffed Bread (Batbout) with Carrots
video_script.description: Learn how to make traditional Moroccan Batbout stuffed with flavorful carrots and spices in this easy-to-follow recipe tutorial.

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully plated Moroccan stuffed bread (Batbout) showcasing golden-brown discs filled with vibrant carrot filling, garnished with fresh herbs.
scenes.text: Welcome to our Moroccan cooking tutorial!
scenes.voice_over: In today's video, we'll be making delicious Moroccan Batbout, a stuffed bread filled with flavorful carrots and spices.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out neatly on a table, including flour, semolina, olive oil, carrots, onion, spices, boiled eggs, and herbs.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you'll need flour, semolina, olive oil, grated carrots, onion, and a selection of spices and herbs.

scenes.image_prompt: A mixing bowl with flour, semolina, yeast, sugar, and olive oil being measured and prepared.
scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, combine 150 grams of all-purpose flour, 150 grams of fine semolina, 1 teaspoon of dry yeast, 1 tablespoon of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Gradually add warm water to form a soft dough.

scenes.image_prompt: A person kneading dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic.
scenes.voice_over: Knead the dough for about 10 minutes until it's smooth and elastic.

scenes.image_prompt: A covered bowl of dough rising in a warm kitchen, indicating a resting phase.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the dough with a cloth and let it rise in a warm place for 30 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A skillet with olive oil heating up, and chopped onions being added to sauté.
scenes.voice_over: In a skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the chopped onion until golden, then add 400 grams of grated carrots, parsley, cilantro, cumin, harissa, and a pinch of salt. Cook for 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl of colorful filling with grated boiled eggs mixed in, ready for use.
scenes.voice_over: Remove from heat and stir in 2 grated hard-boiled eggs. Allow the filling to cool.

scenes.image_prompt: Dough balls resting under a cloth, indicating preparation for shaping.
scenes.voice_over: Divide the dough into small balls and let them rest under a cloth for about 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A floured surface with a flattened dough ball being filled and shaped into a disc.
scenes.voice_over: On a floured surface, flatten each dough ball, spoon the filling on top, fold the dough over, and shape it into a disc. Repeat and let them rest for another 20 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A skillet showing the cooking process of the stuffed discs, sizzling and browning.
scenes.voice_over: In a skillet over medium heat, cook each disc for about 30 seconds on each side until golden brown and cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished Moroccan stuffed bread served with dips and garnished with herbs.
scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Enjoy your Moroccan stuffed bread, perfect for sharing with family and friends.

cooking_tips: Ensure the water is warm, not hot, to activate the yeast without killing it.
Feel free to customize the filling with other vegetables or proteins as desired.

recipes.name: Chicken Wraps with Satay Sauce
ingredients: 1 package of plain corn tortillas (8-10 pieces)
A few sprigs of fresh coriander, washed
directions: Step 1: Prepare the satay sauce by blending the peanuts, coriander, red curry paste, minced garlic, and 1 tablespoon of coconut milk in a food processor until smooth.
Step 2: Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a drizzle of neutral oil. Pour the blended mixture into the skillet and cook, stirring constantly, until it becomes aromatic, about 2-3 minutes.
Step 3: Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the remaining coconut milk, lime juice, soy sauce, and sugar until well combined and creamy.
Step 4: In a separate skillet, cook the sliced chicken fillets over medium-low heat until cooked through, approximately 5-7 minutes.
Step 5: Warm the corn tortillas in a microwave or in a skillet until pliable, about 30 seconds each side.
Step 6: To assemble each wrap, layer the cooked chicken, arugula, tomato wedges, fresh coriander, and a generous drizzle of the satay sauce on each tortilla.
Step 7: Roll the tortillas tightly to form wraps and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant shot of Chicken Wraps with Satay Sauce arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to accentuate the golden-brown chicken and the fresh green arugula. Position the wraps slightly open, revealing the colorful tomato and coriander inside. Scatter roasted peanuts artfully around the wraps for texture. Utilize a shallow depth of field to keep focus on the wraps while softly blurring the background. Add a small bowl of satay sauce and a lime wedge for a pop of color, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Surprise Mini Baguettes
ingredients: 130 grams of canned tuna, drained and flaked
2 slices of cured meat (Viande des Grisons)
Salt and black pepper, to taste
Dried parsley or persillade, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). In a mixing bowl, combine the eggs, crème fraîche, and cottage cheese. Stir in the grated Emmental cheese (approximately 30 grams per mini baguette), diced tomato, and flaked tuna or cured meat. Season with salt, black pepper, and dried parsley to taste.

Step 2: Carefully slice the top of each mini baguette lengthwise with a knife and remove some of the interior bread to create space. Fill the hollowed baguettes with the tuna or meat mixture, then sprinkle the remaining grated Emmental cheese on top.
Step 3: Place the filled baguettes on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes or until the tops are golden and the cheese is bubbling.

Step 4: Serving suggestion: You can replace the baguettes with small rolls and feel free to personalize the filling with additional ingredients such as mushrooms, bell peppers, parmesan, chicken, ground meat, goat cheese, or honey.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning overhead shot of Surprise Mini Baguettes on a rustic wooden board. Arrange the baguettes filled with vibrant layers of flaked tuna, diced tomato, and cured meat, topped with a creamy blend of crème fraîche and cottage cheese, finished with a sprinkle of grated Emmental and dried parsley. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the textures and colors. Incorporate a warm, neutral backdrop and a small bowl of extra crème fraîche as a prop, maintaining a shallow depth of field to create an inviting, appetizing mood.

recipes.name: Sweet Club Sandwich Recipe
ingredients: 8 slices soft white bread, crusts removed
directions: 1. Dice the Comté and Ossau Iraty cheeses into small cubes that fit the slices of bread. Then, spread softened butter on each slice of bread.

2. On 2 slices of buttered bread, layer the Ossau Iraty cheese, followed by the fig puree and crushed walnuts. On another 2 slices, layer the Comté cheese, followed by the strawberry puree and crushed hazelnuts.
3. Assemble the sandwiches by stacking the prepared bread slices over each other. Trim any excess bread that extends beyond the filling. Cut the sandwiches into triangles, squares, or rectangles.
4. Secure each sandwich with a wooden pick and decorate with additional purees, walnuts, and hazelnuts for a visually appealing presentation.

Use natural light to enhance the rich colors and textures, focusing on a shallow depth of field to blur the background, drawing attention to the sandwich's layers. Shoot from a 45-degree angle for an inviting perspective, creating a warm, cozy mood.

recipes.name: Breaded Sandwiches with Ham and Brie
ingredients: 1 slice of ham, cut into 8 equal parts
directions: 1. Using a rolling pin, flatten each slice of bread individually. Cut each slice into two triangles.
2. Place the 10 crispbreads in a resealable plastic bag, seal the bag, and crush them into fine crumbs. Set aside.
3. In a bowl, beat the eggs and mix in 1 tablespoon of water. Cut the 8 slices of Brie and the ham into 8 equal parts.
4. Take one triangle of bread, place a slice of Brie and a piece of ham in the center, then top with another triangle of bread. Press the edges lightly to seal.
5. Dip the sandwich into the egg mixture, then coat it with the crushed crispbread. Repeat this process for all sandwiches.
6. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer until hot. Carefully place the coated sandwiches in the oil and fry for about 1 minute, or until golden brown.
7. Remove from the oil, drain on paper towels, and serve warm, either alone or with a side dish.
8. Enjoy your meal!

recipes.name: Swiss Emmental Bagels with Grilled Vegetables
ingredients: 4 sesame bagels, sliced in half and toasted
A handful of fresh basil leaves, for garnish
4 slices of Emmental AOC Swiss cheese
directions: Step 1: Slice the bagels in half and toast the inside until golden.
Step 2: Slice the eggplant into rounds and sauté them in a non-stick pan until they are tender and lightly browned, without excessive oil.
Step 3: Slice the beefsteak tomato into rounds and set aside.
Step 4: Prepare a handful of fresh basil leaves for garnishing.

Step 5: On the cut side of the first half of the bagel, layer a slice of tomato followed by two basil leaves. Next, add a slice of sautéed eggplant, another slice of tomato, a few more basil leaves, and another slice of eggplant.
Step 6: Top with a slice of Emmental AOC Swiss cheese and place the other half of the bagel on top.
Step 7: Season the assembled bagels with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

Use natural light to accentuate the warm, golden tones of the bagels and the rich colors of the vegetables. Arrange fresh basil leaves artfully around the plate for a pop of green. Include a rustic wooden table as the background and a soft linen napkin for texture, creating a cozy, inviting mood. Utilize a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the bagels while softly blurring the background.

recipes.name: Beef and Bell Pepper Samosas
ingredients: 1 tablespoon ras el hanout spice blend
directions: Step 1: Rinse the bell peppers, remove their stems, and slice them into thin strips. Peel and finely chop the onion.

Step 2: In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onion until it becomes translucent, then add the bell peppers, cumin, and ras el hanout. Cover and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Step 3: While the vegetables are cooking, crumble the ground beef into small pieces and add it to the skillet. Stir well and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until the beef is no longer pink. Avoid overcooking, as the beef will be cooked again when frying.

Step 4: To fold the brick pastry sheets, cut each sheet in half. Take one half and fold the rounded edge over to create a pocket. Place a tablespoon of the beef and pepper filling in the left corner, then fold the corner over to form a triangle. Continue folding downwards to seal the filling until you reach the end of the strip.

Step 5: Once all samosas are folded, heat enough oil in a skillet for frying. Fry the samosas for about 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. There is no need to use butter prior to frying as the beef contains enough fat.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of golden-brown beef and bell pepper samosas arranged artfully on a rustic wooden board. Use a soft, diffused natural light to enhance the crispy textures of the brick pastry. Incorporate fresh herbs, like cilantro, scattered around for color contrast. A small bowl of spicy dipping sauce should be placed nearby. Blur the background slightly to focus on the samosas, creating a warm, inviting mood that emphasizes their savory appeal.

video_script.title: Delicious Beef and Bell Pepper Samosas Recipe
video_script.description: Learn how to make mouthwatering Beef and Bell Pepper Samosas with this step-by-step tutorial!

scenes.voice_over: First, rinse the bell peppers, remove their stems, and slice them into thin strips. Finely chop the onion.

scenes.voice_over: In a skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the onions until translucent, then add bell peppers, cumin, and ras el hanout. Cook for 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef being crumbled into the skillet with vegetables and spices, mixed well with a cooking spatula.
scenes.voice_over: Crumble the ground beef into the skillet and stir well. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until the beef is no longer pink. Remember, it will cook more when frying!

scenes.image_prompt: Cutting board with the brick pastry sheets being cut in half, ready for folding.
scenes.voice_over: Cut each brick pastry sheet in half. Fold one half over to create a pocket, fill it with a tablespoon of the beef mixture, and fold to seal.

scenes.voice_over: Heat oil in a skillet for frying. Fry the samosas for about 2 minutes on each side until golden brown.

scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Serve your beef and bell pepper samosas hot with chutney. Enjoy your delicious creations!

cooking_tips: For extra flavor, consider adding fresh herbs like cilantro or parsley to the filling.
Make sure the oil is hot enough before frying to ensure the samosas are crispy.

recipes.name: Quenelle Sandwiches with Comté and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
ingredients: 6 pieces of nature Saint Jean quenelles
12 sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained and sliced
6 slices of prosciutto or cured ham
directions: Step 1: Preheat your grill, frying pan, or oven to a high setting.
Step 2: Cut the quenelles in half lengthwise.
Step 3: Slice the Comté cheese into thin pieces.
Step 4: Drain the sun-dried tomatoes and reserve the oil for later use.
Step 5: On the open side of one half of a quenelle, layer the sliced Comté cheese and two sun-dried tomato strips.
Step 6: Place the other half of the quenelle on top to form a sandwich.
Step 7: Wrap a slice of prosciutto around the quenelle sandwich, ensuring it is well covered.
Step 8: Cook the quenelle sandwiches on the grill, frying pan, or under the grill setting in your oven, regularly brushing them with the reserved sun-dried tomato oil during cooking.
Step 9: Once they are golden brown and heated through, remove from heat and serve hot.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a top-down shot of Quenelle Sandwiches artfully arranged on a rustic wooden board, with golden Comté cheese melting slightly over the edges. Use natural light to create soft shadows that accentuate the textures of the quenelles and sun-dried tomatoes. Include a sprig of fresh basil for color contrast and a drizzle of olive oil for sheen. Utilize a shallow depth of field to blur the background, focusing on the sandwiches to evoke a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Mini Spelt Club Sandwiches with Flounder and Winter Vegetables
ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil or hazelnut oil
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to grill mode. Place the spelt bread slices on a baking tray and grill until golden brown. Remove the crusts from all four sides and cut each slice into four equal squares.

2. Using a sharp knife, slice the flounder into carpaccio-style pieces. Wash and dry the cucumber and apple; without peeling, cut both into thin slices using a mandoline. Peel the beetroot and slice it finely.

3. To assemble the sandwiches, take a square of toasted bread and layer it with cucumber slices, beetroot, flounder, a sprig of dill, and apple slices. Garnish with a few red berries. Top with a second square of bread that has been lightly brushed with oil. Secure the layers vertically in the center with a skewer.

Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the textures of the spelt bread, flounder, and crisp apple slices. Incorporate a blurred background of a cozy kitchen setting, with a shallow depth of field that keeps the sandwiches in sharp focus, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Tomato and Goat Cheese Sandwich
ingredients: 1 ball of whole grain bread (300g), sliced
1 handful of arugula, washed and dried
directions: Step 1: Preheat a grill pan or toaster. Slice the whole grain bread into even slices and lightly toast until golden brown.
Step 2: Slice the Torino tomatoes and the goat cheese log into even rounds.
Step 3: Brush each slice of toasted bread with olive oil using a pastry brush.
Step 4: Layer the washed and dried arugula onto each slice of bread, followed by the tomato slices and goat cheese.
Step 5: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle a generous amount of balsamic vinegar over the top before serving.

recipes.name: Cheeseburger with Caramelized Onions
directions: 1. Prepare the beef patties by seasoning the ground beef with salt, pepper, and parsley. Shape the seasoned meat into 2 patties.

2. Peel and finely slice the onions. In a buttered skillet over medium heat, cook the onions, stirring occasionally. When they become translucent, add 2 tablespoons of sugar. Mix well and continue to cook until caramelized. Set aside.

3. In the same skillet, add a little more butter and cook the beef patties to your desired doneness. About 30 seconds before they are done, place a slice of cheese on each patty. Once melted, remove from heat.
4. Cut the burger buns in half and place them on a plate. Microwave for 30 seconds to warm them.

5. Assemble the burgers: On the bottom half of each bun, spread some burger sauce. Layer with mâche, a slice of tomato, a bit of caramelized onion, a cheesy beef patty, more burger sauce, additional caramelized onion, a slice of tomato, and finally, the top half of the bun spread with more burger sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a mouthwatering cheeseburger stacked high with two juicy beef patties, melted croque-monsieur cheese, and luscious caramelized onions, nestled between toasted burger buns. Style with fresh mâche greens and vibrant tomato slices peeking out. Use soft, diffused natural light to accentuate the burger’s textures and colors, highlighting the glossy sheen of the sauce. Position the shot at a slight angle for depth, with a blurred background of rustic wood and minimal props like a small bowl of burger sauce, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Spicy Espelette Sausage Hot Dog
ingredients: 4 spicy Espelette sausages, grilled or pan-fried
1 large red onion, finely chopped or 1 bunch of green onions, sliced
directions: Step 1: Peel and finely slice the large red onion or slice the green onions. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over low heat, add the onions, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook gently until the onions are soft and caramelized, about 15 minutes. If needed, add a tablespoon of water to facilitate cooking.

Step 2: Wash and dice the red bell pepper. In a separate pan, heat the remaining olive oil over medium heat, add the bell pepper and a pinch of salt. Cover and sauté until softened, about 10-15 minutes.
Step 3: After cooking, blend the bell pepper mixture until smooth and set aside.
Step 4: Grill or pan-fry the spicy Espelette sausages until fully cooked.
Step 5: To assemble, spread the bell pepper coulis inside each toasted hot dog bun, add a sausage, and top with a spoonful of caramelized onions. Close the bun and serve.

Incorporate rustic wooden boards as a background, with a few scattered pepper flakes and a small bowl of olive oil to enhance the composition. Utilize a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the hot dogs while softly blurring the background, evoking a cozy, gourmet feel.

recipes.name: Italian Subway-Style Bread
ingredients: 110 ml warm water (50 ml + 60 ml for kneading)
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine 50 ml of warm water, yeast, sugar, and salt. Mix well and let it sit for 5 minutes until foamy.
Step 2: In a large mixing bowl, add the flour and make a well in the center. Pour in the yeast mixture and 40 ml of olive oil. Gradually incorporate the flour into the liquid until a dough forms.
Step 3: If needed, add up to an additional 60 ml of warm water to achieve the right consistency. Knead the dough for 7-10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Step 4: Shape the dough into a ball, cover it with plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm area for 1 hour and 30 minutes, or until doubled in size.
Step 5: Meanwhile, mix together Parmesan cheese, garlic powder, oregano, and the additional tablespoon of olive oil in a small bowl. Set aside.
Step 6: Once the dough has risen, divide it into 2-4 equal portions. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and shape each portion into elongated bread forms.
Step 7: Use a sharp knife to make diagonal slashes on the tops of each loaf. Brush the Parmesan mixture over the top of each bread.
Step 8: Cover the loaves with plastic wrap and allow them to rise for another 30 minutes.
Step 9: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F), adding a pan of water to the oven to create steam.
Step 10: Bake the bread for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Keep an eye on the baking to ensure they don’t over-brown.

recipes.name: Sausage and Merguez Wraps
ingredients: 100 grams white radish, peeled and julienned
directions: 1. Peel and wash all the vegetables. Julienne the carrots, radish, and zucchini. Coarsely chop the coriander, mint, and basil.
2. Sauté the sausages in a pan over medium heat for 10 minutes until cooked through.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine the julienned vegetables and chopped herbs, then drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil. Add the Dijon mustard with tarragon and mix well.
4. Place a portion of the vegetable and herb mixture onto the center of each wrap, then add a cooked sausage on top.
5. Roll each wrap tightly, then slice in half lengthwise to reveal the sausage inside. Secure each half in an upright position with a sprig of chives if desired.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Club Sandwich
ingredients: 2 leaves lettuce (such as batavia or iceberg)
directions: 1. Slice the firm tofu into thin pieces. Heat a skillet over medium heat, add a little olive oil, and fry the tofu for 7 minutes on each side until golden. Meanwhile, prepare the marinade by mixing mustard, olive oil, lemon juice, sugar, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of pepper in a small bowl. Once cooked, place the tofu on a paper towel to absorb excess oil. Arrange the tofu in a shallow plate and pour the marinade over it. Cover and refrigerate for 30 to 60 minutes.

2. While the tofu marinates, prepare the toppings. Boil the eggs in a pot of water for 10 minutes, then slice and set aside. Rinse the lettuce and tomato, and slice the tomato. Thinly slice the shallot. In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise and ketchup together. Toast the bread slices.

3. Take the first slice of toasted bread and spread with the ketchup-mayonnaise mixture. Place a square of marinated tofu on top, followed by a layer of tomato slices and then the sliced egg. Top with another slice of toasted bread, spreading the ketchup-mayonnaise mixture on this slice before placing it down.
4. Repeat the layering: Spread another layer of ketchup-mayonnaise on the new slice of bread, add another square of tofu, sprinkle with shallots, and then cover with the lettuce leaves.
5. Finish by spreading ketchup-mayonnaise on the final slice of bread, place it on top, and cut the sandwich diagonally into triangles.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Vegetarian Club Sandwich on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light from the side to accentuate the textures of the toasted bread and vibrant tomato slices. Style the sandwich with a diagonal cut, revealing layers of tofu and hard-boiled eggs. Surround with fresh herbs and a small bowl of mustard for color contrast. Opt for a shallow depth of field, focusing on the sandwich while softly blurring the background, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Classic French Burger
ingredients: 150 ml warm liquid (half milk, half water)
Optional: Milk and sesame or poppy seeds for topping
directions: Step 1: In a bread machine, combine the warm milk and water, active dry yeast, flour, salt, sugar, olive oil, and the beaten egg. Select the dough program and let it run for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
Step 2: Once the dough is smooth and homogenous (if it’s too sticky, add an extra tablespoon of flour), stop the machine.

Step 3: Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F). Divide the dough into 4 equal portions and shape them into balls. Place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper, ensuring they are spaced apart as they will rise.
Step 4: Cover the dough balls with a clean kitchen towel and allow them to rise at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Step 5: Before baking, brush the tops of the balls with a little milk and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds if desired.
Step 6: Bake the dough balls in the preheated oven for 15 minutes at 200°C (392°F) until golden brown.

Step 7: Meanwhile, cook the beef patties on a stovetop or grill as per your preference. Once cooked, slice the freshly baked buns in half and assemble the burgers with the patties, slices of raclette cheese, and fresh lettuce. Serve with Béarnaise sauce.
Step 8: For a complete meal, consider serving with homemade fries.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Classic French Burger with an overhead angle that emphasizes the layers of the juicy beef patties topped with melting raclette cheese, nestled between freshly baked, golden-brown buns. Use natural light to highlight the rich textures and colors, creating soft shadows that enhance the burger's allure. Style with a rustic wooden cutting board as a backdrop, fresh lettuce leaves artistically arranged beside the burger, and a few strategically placed herbs for garnish. Employ a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the burger while softly blurring the background, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Egg Salad Sandwiches
directions: Step 1: Boil the eggs in a pot of water for 11 minutes. Once done, remove the eggs from the water and let them cool.
Step 2: Peel the cool eggs and place them in a mixing bowl. Use a fork to mash the eggs.
Step 3: Add the vinaigrette, salad dressing, parsley, chives, and mustard (if using) to the mashed eggs. Mix until well combined.
Step 4: Take a slice of bread and spread a generous amount of the egg salad mixture on top. Place another slice of bread on top to create a sandwich.
Step 5: Repeat this process with the remaining slices of bread and egg salad mixture.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a delectable egg salad sandwich, showcasing vibrant yellow egg filling peeking from between slices of rustic whole grain bread. Style the sandwich on a textured wooden board, adorned with fresh chives and parsley sprigs for a pop of color. Use soft, diffused natural light to accentuate the creamy texture and glisten of the vinaigrette. Opt for a shallow depth of field to blur the background, drawing focus to the sandwich while evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich with Egg and Spinach
ingredients: 2 large eggs, fried with runny yolks
2 servings (approximately 200 grams) fresh or frozen spinach, sautéed without oil
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Place the halved whole grain rolls in the oven for 5 minutes to toast them until crispy.
Step 2: While the rolls are toasting, sauté the spinach in a pan with a small amount of water over medium heat. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until wilted, approximately 3-5 minutes.
Step 3: In a separate pan, fry the eggs until the whites are set and the yolks remain runny, about 3 minutes.
Step 4: Once the rolls are toasted and the ingredients are cooked, place one fried egg on each bottom half of the rolls. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Step 5: Add a generous portion of sautéed spinach on top of the eggs. If there is excess spinach, serve it alongside the sandwich rather than overstuffing it to avoid a messy outcome.
Step 6: Close the sandwiches with the top halves of the rolls. Serve immediately and enjoy your meal!
recipes.image_prompt: Compose a visually striking image of a club sandwich with egg and spinach, showcasing the golden runny yolks spilling onto the whole grain rolls. Use natural light to enhance the rich greens of the sautéed spinach and the warm browns of the rolls, creating a vibrant contrast. Position the sandwich at a slight angle on a rustic wooden surface, with a soft-focus background of a light-colored linen. Garnish with fresh spinach leaves and sprinkle a pinch of salt and pepper for visual interest, ensuring the depth of field emphasizes the sandwich as the main focal point, evoking a cozy and inviting mood.

recipes.name: Mini Club Sandwich Recipe
ingredients: 1 small head of sucrine lettuce, leaves separated
directions: 1. In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat and add the minced garlic, thyme, and slices of smoked duck breast. Cook until the duck is crispy, about 5 minutes.
2. Slice the sesame baguette lengthwise into thin slices, then cut each slice into 5 cm pieces.
3. Prepare the vinaigrette by whisking together the chopped shallot, olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, and piment d'Espelette until well combined.

4. To assemble the sandwich, start with a piece of baguette. Layer with sucrine leaves, tomato slices, and crispy duck, drizzled with a little vinaigrette. Add a second layer with more asparagus and duck, seasoned with additional vinaigrette.
5. Top with another slice of baguette and cut each sandwich diagonally to create triangles.
6. Insert a sprig of rosemary into each sandwich for garnish.

Arrange the sandwiches on a rustic wooden board, garnished with rosemary sprigs. Use natural light to accentuate the textures of the sesame baguette and the glossy tomatoes. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to highlight the sandwich's height, with a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background, creating an inviting, warm mood. Sprinkle a touch of Piment d'Espelette around for color contrast.

recipes.name: Balanced Beetroot and Chicken Sandwich
ingredients: 30 grams of white cheese, such as ricotta or quark
20 grams of black radish, thinly sliced
100 grams of cooked chicken breast, thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Prepare the sauce by peeling and blending the cooked beetroot with the white cheese and chopped chives until smooth.
Step 2: Slice the half baguette lengthwise and remove some of the soft bread inside to create more space for the filling.
Step 3: Spread the beetroot and cheese sauce generously inside the sliced baguette.
Step 4: Add the thinly sliced black radish on top of the sauce for added crunch.

recipes.name: Pea and Fresh Goat Cheese Croque Monsieur
ingredients: A few sprigs of fresh mint, chopped
directions: 1: Drain the canned peas. In a sauté pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat, then add the chopped green onion and minced garlic. Sauté until the onion is translucent, about 3 minutes.
2: Add the drained peas to the pan with the onions and garlic, mixing well. Remove from heat and coarsely mash the mixture with a fork. Fold in the chopped mint and set aside.

3: Butter one side of each slice of sandwich bread. On the unbuttered side, spread a generous amount of the pea mixture, then top with slices of fresh goat cheese. Place another slice of bread on top, with the buttered side facing out.
4: Cook the assembled croque monsieur in a sandwich maker or on a skillet over medium heat for approximately 4 to 5 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
5: Serve the croques hot.

recipes.name: Homemade Hamburger Buns
directions: 1. Prepare the yeast according to the package instructions.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine half of the flour, salt, sugar, and yeast. Make a well in the center and add the warm milk, warm water, egg, and softened butter.
3. Mix the ingredients for about 5 minutes until combined, then add the remaining flour. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it is smooth and elastic.
4. Shape the dough into a ball and place it in a lightly oiled bowl. Cover it with a clean kitchen towel and let it rise for 2 hours.
5. After the dough has risen, divide it into 8 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball and place them on a floured surface. Cover with a towel and let them rest for 10 minutes.
6. Gently flatten each ball. Moisten the top of the buns and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Press the seeds lightly into the dough.
7. Place the shaped buns onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and let them rise again for 1 hour.
8. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Bake the buns for 15 minutes while placing a bowl of ice cubes in the oven to create steam. Allow them to cool on a wire rack before serving. Enjoy!

Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the golden-brown crust and glistening sesame seeds. Incorporate a light sprinkle of flour around the buns for texture, and position a vintage butter dish and a small bowl of sesame seeds in the background. Opt for a shallow depth of field to draw attention to the buns, creating a warm, inviting mood perfect for a gourmet magazine spread.

recipes.name: Duck Croque Monsieur
ingredients: 50 g gingerbread, cut into small cubes
1 pinch fleur de sel (French sea salt)
80 g cooked foie gras (terrine or jar)
Salt and black pepper, to taste
directions: 1. Prepare the gingerbread croutons: In a pan, melt 10 g of butter with a pinch of fleur de sel over low heat. Add the gingerbread cubes and sauté until golden. Transfer them to a baking sheet and dry them in an oven set to 100°C for 30 minutes.

2. Sauté the shallots in vermouth: Peel and finely dice the shallots. In a saucepan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat, add the shallots, and season with salt and pepper. Cook until they are translucent, then add the vermouth. Cook until the liquid has completely reduced.

3. Prepare the duck breast: Trim any excess fat from the duck breast and score the skin in a crisscross pattern. Generously season with quatre-épices and fleur de sel. In a hot skillet, place the duck skin-side down and sear for 3 minutes, then cook the flesh side for 2 minutes. Let the duck rest on a wire rack for 5 minutes before slicing it into thin strips (3 mm thick).

4. Preheat the oven to the broil setting. Melt the remaining butter. Spread a generous layer of the shallot compote on 2 slices of bread. Layer the duck slices and top with shavings of foie gras, then cover with the other slices of bread. Brush both sides of the sandwiches with melted butter.
5. Broil the sandwiches in the oven for 2 minutes on each side until golden brown.
6. Finally, mix the baked gingerbread croutons and sprinkle them on top of the croque. Serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Duck Croque Monsieur on a rustic wooden board, elegantly layered with crispy duck breast and rich foie gras, garnished with finely diced shallots and a sprinkle of fleur de sel. recipes.name: Buckwheat Galette Rolls with Surimi
ingredients: For the sauce: 100ml light fresh cream
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the light fresh cream, curry powder, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt until smooth.
Step 2: Cut each buckwheat galette into rectangular pieces. Spread the fresh herb cream cheese evenly over the surface of the galettes to a thickness of about 2mm.
Step 3: Place 2 surimi sticks end to end on each galette and roll them tightly like sushi. Repeat this process for all 4 rolls.
Step 4: Take the remaining 2 surimi sticks, unroll them and slice them into 5mm strips. Use these strips to wrap each roll like a gift.
Step 5: Serve the rolls with the curry cream sauce for dipping.

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken Bagels with Hummus
ingredients: 1 small bunch arugula, washed and dried
12 sun-dried tomatoes, marinated in oil, cut into quarters
Hummus: 1 can chickpeas (400 g total, 240 g drained weight), drained
1 clove confit garlic in oil (or 1/4 fresh clove and 1 teaspoon olive oil)
directions: 1. Toast the pine nuts in a dry skillet over medium heat until golden brown.
2. Season the chicken fillets with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Heat a thick-bottomed skillet over high heat, add a drizzle of olive oil, and sear one side of the chicken until well browned.
4. Flip the chicken, cover the skillet, then turn off the heat and let it rest for 15 minutes.
5. Check that the chicken is cooked through before removing it from the skillet.
6. Prepare the hummus: in a blender, combine the drained chickpeas with the garlic.
7. Add the lemon juice, tahini, and salt, then blend until smooth.
8. Gradually add the reserved chickpea liquid until the hummus reaches a creamy, airy consistency.
9. Optionally, add a drizzle of extra virgin sesame oil for flavor.
10. Assemble the bagels: spread a generous layer of hummus on the bottom half of each bagel.
11. Place slices of grilled chicken on top of the hummus.
12. Add three quarters of sun-dried tomatoes, three coriander leaves, a sprinkle of toasted pine nuts, salt, pepper, and finish with a few arugula leaves.
13. Top with the other half of the bagel and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Asparagus and Smoked Duck Hot Dog with Béarnaise Sauce
ingredients: 1 kg medium-sized white asparagus from the Landes region, trimmed
200 g smoked duck breast, thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Blanch the asparagus in boiling salted water for about 2-3 minutes, then ice them in cold water. Cut the asparagus to fit the length of the hot dog buns.
Step 2: Place the sliced smoked duck breast on a baking tray and dry it out in the oven at 130°C (266°F) for 1 hour. Once dried, finely chop the duck.

Step 3: Prepare the Béarnaise sauce by whisking together the shallot, white wine vinegar, and a pinch of salt in a saucepan over medium heat until the mixture is reduced by half. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.

Step 4: In a bowl, whisk the egg yolks and then slowly add the reduced vinegar mixture while continuously whisking. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water (double boiler) and whisk until the mixture thickens.

Step 5: Slowly incorporate the melted unsalted butter into the egg yolk mixture while whisking continuously until fully combined and creamy. Stir in chopped tarragon and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 6: Lightly toast the viennese buns and spread a generous amount of Béarnaise sauce inside each bun. Roll the blanched asparagus in the smoked duck powder and place in the center of each bun.
Step 7: Serve immediately and enjoy your asparagus hot dog!

recipes.name: Heart-Shaped Sandwich with Caprice des Dieux
ingredients: 1/2 round of Caprice des Dieux cheese, sliced
8 slices of bread, preferably white or whole wheat
1 green apple, thinly sliced with skin on
A handful of arugula or mixed greens
directions: 1. Preheat a skillet over medium heat. Grill the halved bacon slices for 2 to 3 minutes until crispy without adding any oil.
2. Using a large heart-shaped cookie cutter, cut out 8 hearts from the slices of bread and toast them until golden brown.
3. Slice the Caprice des Dieux cheese into 8 even slices. Wash and thinly slice the green apple, keeping the skin on for added texture.

4. Spread 1 teaspoon of mango chutney on 4 of the toasted bread hearts. Layer a few arugula leaves on top, followed by a slice of Caprice des Dieux, then a few slices of green apple, more arugula, and finish with another slice of Caprice des Dieux.
5. Place the remaining toasted hearts of bread on top to create a sandwich. Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipes.name: Stuffed Batbouts with Herbed Butter and Mozzarella
ingredients: 200 g fine semolina for batbouts, plus 50 g for dusting
1 large mozzarella ball (or 2 smaller ones), sliced
directions: 1. Mix the all-purpose flour, fine semolina, and dry yeast together in a mixing bowl. Begin kneading the mixture using a dough hook attached to a stand mixer, gradually adding lukewarm water until fully incorporated. Add the salt and continue mixing for about 15 minutes until the dough is smooth.

2. Form the dough into 12 equal balls and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and dusted with semolina, ensuring they are spaced apart. Flatten each ball gently with your palm to about 1 cm thick. Sprinkle additional semolina on top, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let rise in a warm area for 1 hour.

3. After the dough has risen, heat a heavy-bottomed skillet over low heat without adding oil. Carefully place the batbouts in the skillet (you may need a spatula to help). Monitor their cooking; they should become lightly golden but not burnt. When the first side has colored, flip them over and continue cooking until both sides are cooked through and the batbouts puff up slightly. Allow to cool at room temperature.
4. Just before serving, preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
5. In a bowl, combine the softened butter, dried garlic, and chopped parsley until well mixed. Slice the mozzarella into 12 rounds.
6. Cut each batbout in half horizontally, like a sandwich, and spread the herbed garlic butter generously inside. Place a slice of mozzarella in the center and close the batbout.
7. Finally, arrange the filled batbouts on a baking sheet lined with silicone or parchment paper and bake in the preheated oven for 8 minutes. Serve and enjoy!

Use a shallow depth of field to blur the background, focusing on the batbouts, evoking a sense of indulgence and comfort.

recipes.name: Homemade Emmental and Bacon Baguettes
ingredients: 1 teaspoon active dry yeast, dissolved in 10 grams lukewarm water
directions: 1. In a bowl, combine 10 grams of lukewarm water with the active dry yeast and stir well to dissolve.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 400 grams of flour and 5 grams of salt, mixing thoroughly.
3. Add the dissolved yeast mixture to the flour and stir with a wooden spoon.
4. Gradually pour in the remaining 250 grams of lukewarm water, mixing continuously with the wooden spoon until a dough forms.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more water; if too sticky, add more flour until the desired consistency is achieved.
6. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured work surface and knead for 5 to 10 minutes until it is smooth and elastic, and no longer sticks to your fingers.
7. Place the dough back in the mixing bowl, cover it with a kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm area for about 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
8. While the dough rises, cook the bacon lardons in a skillet over medium heat until they are not too greasy but cooked through. Drain excess fat on paper towels.
9. After the dough has risen, place it on a lightly floured surface, divide it into 2 or 4 equal pieces (for smaller baguettes), and gently punch down to release gases.
10. Flatten each piece slightly and place half the cooked lardons in the center of each piece of dough, fold it over to encase the filling, and shape it into a baguette.
11. Place the shaped baguettes onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Make incisions on the top of each baguette with a sharp knife.
12. Allow the baguettes to rise for an additional 20 minutes while preheating the oven to 200°C (392°F), placing a small dish of water at the bottom for steam.
13. Bake in the preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden brown and hollow-sounding when tapped.

recipes.name: Classic Bun Recipe for Mini Burgers
ingredients: 50 grams unsalted butter, at room temperature
directions: Step 1: In a large mixing bowl, dissolve the crumbled yeast in warm milk along with 50 milliliters of warm water and the sugar. Cover with a kitchen towel and let it rest for 10 minutes to activate the yeast.

Step 2: Add the flour to the yeast mixture and knead until the mixture is uniform. Incorporate the beaten egg, softened butter, and salt. Continue kneading until the dough is smooth and does not stick to your hands or the bowl.
Step 3: Cover the dough with a damp kitchen towel and allow it to rise at room temperature for 1 hour, or until it has doubled in size.

Step 4: Lightly flour your hands and work surface. Divide the dough into small balls weighing approximately 40 grams each (about the size of a large walnut or ping-pong ball). Place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, flattening them slightly.
Step 5: Allow the shaped buns to rise at room temperature for another 20 minutes without opening the oven. Preheat your oven to 190°C (375°F) while the dough is rising.
Step 6: Bake the buns in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving. Fill them with your favorite fillings.

recipes.name: Goat Cheese Crunchy Wraps
ingredients: 1 small head of iceberg lettuce, washed and leaves separated
directions: Step 1: Prepare the sauce by crushing one mini goat cheese round and mixing it with the sour cream until smooth, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 2: Lay the whole wheat wraps flat; in the center along their length, arrange several lettuce leaves and tomato slices, then drizzle with the goat cheese sauce.
Step 3: In two shallow plates, place the beaten egg in one and breadcrumbs in the other. Dip the mini goat cheese rounds first in the egg and then coat evenly in the breadcrumbs.
Step 4: In a frying pan heated with olive oil, sauté the chopped onion until golden brown. Add the breaded mini goat cheese rounds and cook for one minute on each side over medium heat until crisp.
Step 5: Add the sautéed onion and 3 breaded mini goat cheese rounds to each wrap and secure the ends with toothpicks.
Step 6: To finish, microwave the wraps on high for 30 seconds and serve immediately for best flavor.

recipes.name: Puccia Leccese (Apulian Flatbread)
directions: Step 1: Dissolve the yeast in the warm water (heat the water in the microwave for approximately 15 seconds at 900W). Pour the water and yeast mixture into the flour and knead to combine.
Step 2: Add the olive oil and salt to the dough and knead again until a homogeneous dough forms.
Step 3: Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rise for about 2 hours in a dry, draft-free area.

Step 4: Once the dough has risen, knead it again for 2 minutes then divide the dough into two equal portions, each weighing approximately 200 grams. Cover and let them rise for an additional 30 minutes.
Step 5: Roll out each portion of dough into flat rounds approximately 20 cm in diameter; flatten the dough gently since the puccia should have minimal crumb.
Step 6: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F) and bake the puccia for about 15 minutes until golden. Allow it to cool, then slice in half horizontally and fill with your desired toppings.

recipes.name: Rocket Bread Rolls
ingredients: 1 tablespoon mixed seeds (such as flaxseed, sunflower seeds, poppy seeds, millet)
directions: 1. In a blender, puree the arugula with 300 milliliters of water until smooth with minimal chunks. Measure out 100 milliliters of this puree, add the yeast and sugar, and let it rest for 10 minutes.

2. In the bowl of a stand mixer or a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, black pepper, and mixed seeds (reserve pumpkin seeds for later). Create a well in the center and pour in the olive oil, the activated yeast mixture, and the remaining arugula puree. Mix until the dough starts to form a ball.
3. Knead the dough for about 10 minutes until it is smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and allow the dough to rise in a warm place for approximately 45 minutes, or until doubled in size.

5. Meanwhile, prepare two small plates: one with two dampened and folded paper towels, and the other with the reserved pumpkin seeds. Divide the dough into 8 equal portions, shaping each portion into a smooth ball. Lightly moisten the surface by rolling them on the damp paper, and then press a few pumpkin seeds onto the surface to adhere. Place the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat, cover with a kitchen towel, and let rise again for 45 minutes.

6. Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius (410 degrees Fahrenheit). Once preheated, place a small oven-safe dish with 500 milliliters of boiling water on the bottom rack to create steam, and then bake the rolls for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown. Remove and cool on a wire rack.

Use natural light from a side window to highlight the vibrant green of the arugula and the glistening olive oil. Style the rolls on a rustic wooden board, surrounded by a scattering of pumpkin and mixed seeds for added visual interest. Incorporate a soft, blurred background with a light linen cloth to enhance the warm, inviting mood. Aim for a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the rolls while softly fading the background.

recipes.name: Faux Breton Sandwich
ingredients: 1 hamburger bun or other type of bread
100 grams sliced Andouille de Guéméné sausage, cooked
1 teaspoon spice bread and honey mustard (Maille brand recommended)
A handful of chopped walnut halves
1 drizzle of neutral oil for cooking
directions: Step 1: Spread a mixture of Calvados mustard, spice bread and honey mustard, and mayonnaise or crème fraîche evenly on both halves of the hamburger bun.
Step 2: Heat a drizzle of neutral oil in a pan, then sauté the sliced Andouille de Guéméné sausage until caramelized.
Step 3: On one half of the bun, sprinkle the finely chopped walnut halves evenly.
Step 4: Layer the caramelized Andouille slices on top of the walnut halves, then add a generous slice of Timanoix cheese on top.
Step 5: Place the other half of the bun on top and transfer the sandwich to the oven. Bake for a few minutes until the cheese is completely melted. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Ham and Butter Mille-Feuille Sandwich
ingredients: 1 baguette Rétrodor, sliced into thin rounds
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F).
Step 2: Cut the baguette Rétrodor into thin rounds and place them on a baking sheet.
Step 3: Drizzle the rounds with olive oil and sprinkle with chopped chives.
Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until golden and crispy.
Step 5: In a small bowl, combine the softened butter with salt, piment d'Espelette, and Dijon mustard; mix well.
Step 6: Once the baguette rounds are baked, spread a generous layer of the butter mixture on one side of each round.
Step 7: Layer the slices of cornichons and Bayonne ham on top of the buttered side of half of the rounds.
Step 8: Top with the remaining baguette rounds to create a mille-feuille assembly.
Step 9: Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious sandwich!

recipes.name: Macaron-Style Sandwiches
ingredients: 400 ml crème entière de Normandie Elle & Vire, chilled
25 g Le Beurre Tendre Elle & Vire, for cooking
20 slices whole wheat bread, cut into circles
20 slices white bread, cut into circles
directions: 1. Chill the crème entière de Normandie Elle & Vire for a few hours. Whip 100 ml of the chilled cream with the brousse cheese until thickened.
2. Peel and dice the carrots, beet, and cucumber. Season with salt and pepper. Mix with the mustard and the whipped cream and brousse mixture. Set aside.

3. Whip 200 ml of crème entière de Normandie Elle & Vire until very firm. Drain the sardines and blend with the tomato paste. Stir in the ground cumin and mix gently with half of the whipped cream. Set aside.
4. Chop the shrimp and combine with lemon zest and ground coriander. Season with salt and pepper, then mix with the remaining whipped cream. Set aside.
5. Whip the remaining 100 ml of crème entière de Normandie Elle & Vire with fresh goat cheese until thickened. Fold in the chopped chives, and season to taste. Set aside.
6. Using a round cookie cutter, cut out circles from each slice of bread. Heat a skillet with Le Beurre Tendre Elle & Vire and toast the bread rounds on both sides until golden brown.

7. Layer each type of cream on the toasted bread rounds, then top with another piece of bread to form a sandwich. Gently press down to form a macaron shape. Place on a platter and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Use soft, natural light to accentuate the textures of the whole wheat and white bread layers, and the colorful fillings of diced carrots, bicolored beet, cucumber, shrimp, and brousse cheese. Incorporate fresh chives as a garnish. Include a delicate linen napkin and elegant vintage cutlery to enhance the composition. Aim for a shallow depth of field to blur the background slightly, drawing focus to the sandwiches while creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Gazpacho Alvalle with Mini Burgers
ingredients: 1 liter Gazpacho Alvalle, ready to serve
10 mini burger buns, homemade or store-bought
5 slices smoked pork with rosemary, sliced
1 roasted bell pepper, skin removed and diced
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F).
Step 2: Prepare the burger salsa by finely chopping the red onion, roasted bell pepper, and savory in a bowl.
Step 3: Add the olive oil to the chopped ingredients and mix thoroughly.
Step 4: Cut each mini bun in half and arrange them on a baking tray.
Step 5: On the bottom half of each bun, spread a bit of salsa, then add a slice of smoked pork and a slice of scarmoza cheese.
Step 6: Place the baking tray in the oven and bake for 5 minutes until the cheese is melted.
Step 7: Serve the mini burgers, optionally skewered with a toothpick, alongside a glass of Gazpacho Alvalle.

recipes.name: Top Chef Style Hot Salmon and Fennel Sandwich
ingredients: 1 faluche or 1 PAUL bread of your choice
A few sprigs of chives, chopped
A few sprigs of dill, chopped
directions: 1. To prepare the fennel compote: In a skillet over low heat, add the sliced fennel and cook, stirring gently, until softened and compote-like in texture. Deglaze the pan with a splash of lemon juice. Stir in a dollop of crème fraîche to combine. Season with salt and pepper, and fold in the chopped chives.

2. Spread the fennel compote on one half of the bread that has been sliced in half. On the other half, layer the tomato slices. Place both halves in an oven preheated to 180°C (350°F) and heat for about 5 minutes until warm.

3. Once heated, top the fennel side with the smoked salmon, drizzling with a bit of lemon juice and sprinkling with dill. Add a generous layer of shredded Chinese cabbage and finish with a splash of balsamic vinegar.
4. Close the sandwich and serve warm, enjoying the delightful combination of flavors.

Use natural light to accentuate the vibrant colors of the sliced tomato and the fresh greens. Surround the sandwich with scattered fennel fronds and a few dollops of crème fraîche. Incorporate a soft-focus background of blurred herbs and a lemon half for depth. Use a shallow depth of field to draw focus to the sandwich, creating a fresh, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Mini Club Sandwiches with Caramelized Pineapple
ingredients: 4 leaves of romaine lettuce, washed and torn
Nutrition facts (calories, fat, carbs, protein) as per serving size
directions: Step 1: Begin by reheating the Croque Monsieur sandwiches according to package instructions or in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) until warm.
Step 2: In a skillet, melt 1 tablespoon of unsalted butter over medium heat.
Step 3: Add the pineapple slices to the skillet and cook them for 3-5 minutes, flipping occasionally, until they are caramelized and golden brown.
Step 4: While the pineapple is cooking, wash the cherry tomatoes and slice them in half.
Step 5: Once the Croque Monsieur sandwiches are warm, cut each sandwich into four smaller pieces to create mini sandwiches.
Step 6: Assemble the mini club sandwiches by layering pieces of Croque Monsieur with torn lettuce, halved cherry tomatoes, and caramelized pineapple slices, securing each with a toothpick.
Step 7: In a mixing bowl, combine the remaining lettuce, halved tomatoes, and diced caramelized pineapple for a refreshing salad.
Step 8: Serve the mini club sandwiches accompanied by the fresh pineapple salad.

recipes.name: Onion Hamburger Recipe
directions: 1: Cook the sliced onions in olive oil and water over medium heat until they are soft and tender, about 15 minutes.
2: Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut out 2 circles using a cookie cutter for the top of the hamburgers.
3: In a mixing bowl, combine the beaten egg, grated Gruyère cheese, and crème fraîche until well mixed.
4: Place one pastry circle on a baking sheet, spread a thin layer of mustard on the bottom, layer with the cooked onions, diced ham, and the cheese mixture from step 3.
5: Top with another pastry circle, sprinkle a little extra Gruyère cheese on top, and bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for about 30 minutes or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Grilled Vegetable and Cottage Cheese Wrap
ingredients: 1/2 medium zucchini, sliced lengthwise (or 1 small zucchini)
1 teaspoon fleur de sel (or sea salt), to taste
2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
1 teaspoon mild or strong mustard, to preference
directions: Step 1: Preheat your grill or broiler. Slice the eggplant, zucchini, red onion, and red bell pepper into thin pieces. Arrange the vegetables on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush the vegetables with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, and sprinkle with fleur de sel and breadcrumbs. Grill for about 10 minutes, watching closely to avoid burning, and remove when tender and slightly charred.
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the cottage cheese, mustard, honey, and a drizzle of the remaining olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Step 3: Take one tortilla and spread half of the cottage cheese mixture in the center, leaving a 2-3 cm border. Layer the grilled vegetables over the cottage cheese, alternating types if desired. Be careful not to overstuff, leaving about 4 cm of space on both the left and right sides for folding.

Step 4: Fold the top and bottom edges of the tortilla over the filling, then fold the left and right sides inward, securing the wrap tightly. Place the wrap seam-side down on a plate. Repeat this with the second tortilla. Wrap each tortilla in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least one hour to set.
Step 5: When ready to serve, slice each wrap in half to reveal the colorful filling inside.

Position the wrap diagonally, showcasing the colorful layers of grilled eggplant, zucchini, red bell pepper, and onion, drizzled with olive oil. Use natural light to illuminate the textures, creating soft shadows. Incorporate a small dish of mustard and a sprinkle of fleur de sel beside the wrap. Employ a shallow depth of field to blur the background, focusing on the wrap's details, evoking a warm, inviting atmosphere.

ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the egg yolk, Dijon mustard, white truffle oil, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper to create a smooth mayonnaise.
Step 2: Spread a generous layer of the truffle mayonnaise over each wrap.
Step 3: Evenly distribute the fresh arugula over the mayonnaise-covered wraps.
Step 4: Place 3 slices of Parma ham on top of the arugula on each wrap.
Step 5: Carefully roll up each wrap tightly and wrap them in plastic film, then refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Step 6: After chilling, cut the wraps into bite-sized pieces and secure each piece with a toothpick for easy serving.
