recipes.name: Flatbread with Caramelized Onions
ingredients: 15 cl warm water for the dough
375 g all-purpose flour for the dough
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the warm water, 150 g of flour, and active dry yeast. Cover with a cloth and let it rest at room temperature for 2 hours, stirring once after 1 hour.

Step 2: For the dough, add 15 cl of warm water and olive oil to the ferment mixture, whisking until combined. Gradually mix in 375 g of flour and salt until a slightly lumpy and sticky dough forms. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.

Step 3: Drizzle some olive oil over the dough and place it on an oiled work surface. Work the dough by stretching and folding it every 10 minutes for 30 minutes. Then, continue to fold every 40 minutes for 2 hours.
Step 4: Once the dough has been worked, lightly flour the work surface and roll out the dough into an oval shape.

Step 5: For the caramelized onion filling, peel and thinly slice the onions. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a bit of olive oil. Cook the onions until golden brown, then add the sugar and cook on low heat for 5 to 10 minutes. Finally, stir in the balsamic vinegar and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated.

Step 6: Spread the caramelized onion mixture over the dough. Season with salt, pepper, and sprinkle with thyme. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 25 to 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the edges are crispy. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Arrange the caramelized onions artfully on top, their deep brown hue contrasting beautifully. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the textures, casting gentle shadows. Surround the flatbread with scattered fresh herbs and a small bowl of balsamic vinegar for color. Create a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the flatbread while softly blurring the background, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: New York Raclette Bagel Recipe
ingredients: 8 slices of Raclette cheese (classic or rindless)
directions: Step 1: Peel the red onion and slice it into thin rings. Rinse and dry the spinach leaves. In a small bowl, combine the Dijon mustard and honey and mix well.
Step 2: Split each bagel in half lengthwise. Spread the honey mustard mixture on the bottom halves of each bagel.
Step 3: On each bagel base, add 2 slices of Raclette cheese and 1 slice of pastrami. Place the bagel tops on and broil in the oven for about 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted.
Step 4: After removing from the oven, top each bagel with a few rings of red onion. Sprinkle with spinach leaves, then season with salt and pepper.

Step 5: Close each bagel with its top half and serve immediately while hot. Tip: For a twist, substitute the spinach with arugula or lamb's lettuce for added crunch, and use roast pork or braised chicken instead of pastrami.

Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase layers, with a shallow depth of field to blur the background, creating an inviting, warm mood. Add a sprinkle of salt and a dash of pepper for a finishing touch.

recipes.name: Reverse Sandwich with Bacon, Cheese, Tomato, and Basil
directions: 1. Wash the green tomatoes and slice them into 10 rounds.
2. On the first slice of white bread, place a slice of melted mozzarella cheese.
3. Add 2 rounds of sliced tomatoes on top of the cheese, then sprinkle a bit of cheddar cheese (optional) over the tomatoes.
4. Top with a second slice of white bread on which a slice of melted Salakis cheese is placed.
5. On a cutting board, lay down one slice of smoked bacon, then add the smoked ham on top, followed by a second slice of bacon. Place the sandwich on top and roll it up tightly.
6. Lay three slices of bacon on the cutting board and roll the sandwich in the opposite direction so that it is completely covered with bacon. Sprinkle dried basil on top.
7. In a non-stick skillet, cook the sandwiches for 3 minutes on each side over low heat, allowing the cheese to melt without burning.
8. Let the sandwiches rest for 2 minutes before serving. Accompany with a small salad, if desired.

recipes.name: Smoked Haddock Wraps
ingredients: 1 small green onion, sliced into 5 cm pieces and then cut into fine strips
1 small carrot, julienned into 5 cm long matchsticks
1 small zucchini, julienned into 5 cm long matchsticks
1 wheat crepe, cut into four equal parts
directions: Step 1: Slice the green onion into 5 cm pieces and then cut it into fine strips.
Step 2: Julienne the carrot and zucchini into 5 cm long matchsticks.
Step 3: Cut the wheat crepe into four equal parts.
Step 4: Place a small amount of the vegetable mixture and some smoked haddock in the center of one quarter of the crepe and fold it to form a small cone. Secure it with a toothpick.
Step 5: Drizzle the filled crepe with a few drops of lemon juice and olive oil.
Step 6: Repeat the process with the remaining ingredients to create additional wraps.

recipes.name: Meatball Sandwich with Tomato Sauce
ingredients: 500 grams ground pork and beef, combined
1 large or 2 small slices bread, soaked in 4 tablespoons of milk
3 meatballs with tomato sauce per sandwich
directions: Step 1: Begin by preparing the meatballs. Soak the bread in milk. In a large bowl, combine the ground meat, chopped parsley, cumin, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of pepper, and the soaked bread. Mix well by hand until combined, forming about 25 small meatballs the size of cherry tomatoes.
Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook the meatballs until browned on all sides, then set aside and keep warm.
Step 3: In the same skillet, add more olive oil if necessary and sauté the crushed garlic until fragrant. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent.

Step 4: Pour in the canned tomato puree and mix well. Add 300 milliliters of water, along with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes, then add the meatballs to the sauce and stir. Allow to simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Step 5: Preheat your oven to 230°C (450°F). Slice the bread rolls in half and fill each with meatballs. Top with 1 to 2 tablespoons of tomato sauce.
Step 6: Add fresh basil leaves on top of the meatballs. Sprinkle with your choice of mixed cheese or place two slices of mozzarella on each sandwich.
Step 7: Optionally, place the sandwiches in the oven for a few minutes to melt the cheese before serving.

Use natural light to enhance the rich red of the sauce and the golden crust of the bread, creating a warm, inviting mood. recipes.name: Homemade Vegetarian Burger Recipe
ingredients: 200 grams cooked white beans or canned
200 grams cooked red beans or canned
directions: 1. Prepare the burger buns: In a saucepan, heat the milk, water, and melted butter until fully combined and allow to cool for 5 minutes. In a mixing bowl or food processor, combine 250 grams of flour, yeast, and sugar. Add the cooled liquid mixture, beaten eggs, and olive oil. Mix for 8 minutes, gradually incorporating the remaining flour, two tablespoons at a time, until the dough is elastic.

2. Grease a bowl and place the dough inside. Cover and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour until doubled in size. On a floured surface, divide the dough into eight equal pieces, shape them into balls, and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Allow to proof for an additional 30 minutes.

3. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Whisk the egg yolk with a tablespoon of milk and brush the mixture over the buns. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top. Bake for 15 minutes, then reduce the temperature to 180°C (350°F) and bake for another 10 minutes. Once baked, allow to cool before slicing in half.

4. Prepare the vegetarian patties: In a food processor, pulse the white and red beans for 30 seconds until roughly blended. In a pan with a little butter, sauté garlic, onion, and olive oil, adding in the diced vegetables. Cook for about 10 minutes until softened.

5. Combine the sautéed vegetables with the blended beans, oats, crushed crackers, eggs, parsley, paprika, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl. Form the mixture into patties about the size of a hamburger.
6. In a buttered skillet, cook the patties over medium heat for 3 minutes per side until golden brown. Any leftover mixture can be stored in a freezer bag for future use.

7. Prepare the parmesan white sauce: Melt 50 grams of butter in a saucepan, then whisk in 50 grams of flour until smooth. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly until the sauce thickens. Stir in the grated parmesan and season with salt.

8. Assemble the burgers: Spread mustard on the bottom half of each bun. Layer on a leaf of bok choy, a veggie patty, parmesan sauce, cheddar cheese, onion rings, and slices of tomato. Optionally, add pickles. Spread ketchup on the top half of the bun and microwave the assembled burger for 30 seconds to 1 minute until heated through. Enjoy!

Style the scene with rustic wooden boards and a simple white plate, garnished with fresh greens and ripe tomatoes. Incorporate a blurred background of soft pastel hues to create depth, focusing on the burger as the star, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Focaccia with Olives, Rosemary, and Oregano
ingredients: 80 grams mixed green and black olives, pitted and sliced
7 grams active dry yeast (about 1/2 a standard packet)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the mashed potatoes and set aside.
Step 2: In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, sea salt, and active dry yeast. Mix well.
Step 3: Add the mashed potatoes and 1 tablespoon of olive oil to the flour mixture. Stir until combined.
Step 4: Gradually pour in the warm water while mixing until a dough forms. Knead the dough for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth.
Step 5: Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Step 6: After the dough has risen, incorporate the sliced olives into the dough by kneading for another 5 minutes.
Step 7: In a small saucepan, gently heat 30 milliliters of olive oil with the dried oregano and rosemary to infuse the flavors.
Step 8: Grease a baking dish or line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Roll out the dough into a rectangle approximately 2 centimeters thick and place it in the prepared dish.
Step 9: Using your fingertips, create dimples across the surface of the dough. Brush the infused olive oil evenly over the top.
Step 10: Cover the dough again and let it rest for another 30-60 minutes.
Step 11: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F).
Step 12: Bake the focaccia in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown on top. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Incorporate a small bowl of olives and a sprig of rosemary as props. recipes.name: Seafood Sushi Wraps
ingredients: 1 corn wrap (Nature Pains Wraps from La Boulangère)
directions: 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the fresh cheese with a generous pinch of curry powder. This mixture will serve as the adhesive. Spread it evenly over the entire surface of the corn wrap.
2: Arrange the slices of smoked salmon over the wrap, ensuring even coverage.

3: Prepare the homemade guacamole by blending the avocado with the lemon juice and zest until smooth. Season with salt, pepper, Espelette pepper, and Tabasco sauce to taste. Spread this guacamole mixture onto the wrap.
4: Add several arugula leaves and a handful of previously toasted pine nuts to the wrap for added texture and flavor.
5: Carefully roll the wrap tightly on itself, ensuring all fillings are contained.
6: Slice the rolled wrap into pieces measuring 2 to 3 cm thick. Insert a decorative toothpick into each sushi wrap for easy handling. Serve immediately and enjoy!

ingredients: 1 French country bread baguette (ficelle), sliced lengthwise
1 lightly smoked haddock fillet, cut into strips
directions: Step 1: Open the French country bread baguette (ficelle) along its entire length.
Step 2: Thinly slice the firm chorizo in a decorative, swooping fashion.
Step 3: Cut the lightly smoked haddock fillet into small strips.

Step 5: Wash and dry the salad sprouts. Prepare the yogurt dressing by mixing it with mustard, apple cider vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Step 6: Assemble the sandwich starting with a layer of chorizo, followed by haddock strips, cucumber slices, salad sprouts, and yogurt dressing, then top with another layer of thin chorizo slices.

recipes.name: Gruyère Bagels with Crunchy Vegetable Sticks
ingredients: 200 g Gruyère cheese, cut into small triangles
130 ml cream, whipped to soft peaks
1 red bell pepper, sliced into thin sticks
1 green bell pepper, sliced into thin sticks
1 yellow bell pepper, sliced into thin sticks
4 celery stalks, cleaned and cut into sticks
4 young carrots, peeled and soaked in water
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: 1. Prepare the vegetables: Wash the bell peppers, cut them in half, remove the seeds, and slice into thin sticks. Peel the young carrots and soak them in water. Clean the celery sticks and drain the mini corn.
2. In a mixing bowl, whisk the cream until soft peaks form. Season with fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
3. Assemble the bagels: Cut each bagel in half and generously spread the whipped cream on the cut sides. Arrange the triangles of Gruyère cheese on top.
4. Serve: Place the assembled bagels on serving plates and fill the center hole of each bagel with an assortment of the prepared crunchy vegetable sticks.

Arrange the bagels, golden and toasted, artfully topped with small triangles of melted Gruyère cheese. Surround with colorful, neatly arranged vegetable sticks—red, green, and yellow bell peppers, celery, mini corn, and young carrots. Use natural light to enhance the textures and colors, creating soft shadows. Incorporate a light linen napkin and a small bowl of fine sea salt for an elegant touch. Aim for a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the bagels while softly blurring the background, evoking a fresh and inviting mood.

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur or Sgranocchia Signore
ingredients: 4 slices of white ham, cut with a cookie cutter
4 slices of cured ham, cut with a cookie cutter
directions: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 160°C (320°F). Cut the mozzarella into 4 slices, then use a cookie cutter to create 4 circles. Cut out 4 additional circles from the slices of white and cured ham.

Step 2: In a saucepan, heat the whole milk over medium-high heat until boiling. Gradually add the polenta while whisking continuously. Continue to cook gently for about 10 minutes while stirring, then slowly add the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Step 3: Spread the polenta mixture onto a large baking sheet lined with parchment paper to a thickness of about 1 cm. Bake for 15 minutes, then place under the broiler for an additional 2-3 minutes until lightly golden.
Step 4: Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let cool slightly. Use a cookie cutter to cut out 12 circles of polenta.

Step 5: Prepare another baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Place 4 circles of polenta on it. Top each circle with cheese (2 with Gruyère and 2 with mozzarella), then layer with the corresponding ham (white ham with Gruyère and cured ham with mozzarella). Add another circle of polenta on top, followed by more cheese and ham. Finally, place a last circle of polenta on top. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and place a knob of butter on each "croque".
Step 6: Bake for 15 minutes, then switch to the broiler for an additional 1 minute to ensure they are nicely browned. Serve immediately with a fresh green salad.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a golden-brown Croque Monsieur, showcasing the melted Gruyère and mozzarella, with cookie-cutter shapes of white and cured ham peeking through. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the creamy textures and rich colors, while a dark wooden surface provides contrast. Style with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan on top and a side of fresh herbs for garnish. Opt for a shallow depth of field, drawing focus on the dish's layers, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Croque-Monsieur with Pont L’Evêque
ingredients: 8 slices of soft bread (pain de mie)
150 grams of Pont L’Evêque cheese, sliced
directions: 1. Remove the rind from the Pont L’Evêque cheese and slice it.
2. Spread butter on both sides of each slice of bread.
3. On four slices of bread, layer the sliced Pont L’Evêque cheese.
4. Add a thick slice of braised ham on top of the cheese on each of the four slices.
5. Place the remaining cheese slices on top of the ham, then cover with the remaining four slices of bread to form sandwiches.
6. Heat a non-stick skillet or a croque-monsieur maker over low heat.
7. Place the assembled sandwiches in the skillet and cook for about 4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and heated through.
8. Serve hot with a side of green salad.

recipes.name: Mini Ham and Cream Cheese Wraps
ingredients: 130 grams garlic and herb cream cheese
directions: 1: Spread approximately 30 grams of garlic and herb cream cheese evenly over each whole wheat tortilla.
2: Place one slice of cooked ham on top of the cream cheese on each tortilla.
3: Roll each tortilla tightly, applying gentle pressure with your fingers to secure the contents.
4: Cut each rolled tortilla into small slices, discarding the ends.

recipes.name: Haddock Bagels with Salad and Fresh Cheese
ingredients: 50 g mesclun salad mixture, washed and dried
100 g fresh cheese (cow's cheese or other soft cheese)
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven if toasting the bagels. Cut the bagels in half horizontally, and toast them if desired.

Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the fresh cheese, honey, a pinch of Espelette pepper puree, toasted sesame seeds, and salt. Mix well and adjust seasoning with more pepper if needed. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator until ready to assemble the bagels.
Step 3: Spread the cheese mixture generously on the cut sides of each bagel half.
Step 4: Layer the mesclun salad and sprouts on top of the cheese mixture, followed by the sliced haddock.
Step 5: Place the top halves of the bagels back on and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Spring Club Sandwich with Fresh Cheese and Trout
ingredients: 8 slices of bread (white or whole wheat)
150 grams of cream cheese (plain or flavored)
1 package of fresh spinach leaves (about 100 grams)
directions: Step 1: Remove the crusts from the bread slices and lightly toast them until golden brown.
Step 2: Thinly slice the smoked trout.
Step 3: Spread a generous layer of cream cheese on one side of each slice of toasted bread.
Step 4: In a non-stick skillet, sear the trout fillet over medium heat for about 30 seconds on each side until it's just cooked through.
Step 5: Season the trout with fleur de sel and freshly ground black pepper.
Step 6: Assemble the club sandwiches by layering smoked trout, the lightly cooked trout fillet, and fresh spinach between two slices of bread.
Step 7: Cut the sandwiches in half diagonally and serve them with lime wedges alongside.

recipes.name: Mini Bread Rolls with Candied Peppers
ingredients: 3 bell peppers, cleaned and sliced into thin strips
directions: 1. Prepare the bread dough: In a large glass, dissolve the dry yeast in lukewarm water. In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt, then gradually incorporate the yeast-water mixture until fully combined.
2. Knead the dough for a few minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. Cover the bowl with a kitchen towel and let the dough rise for 1 hour in a warm place.

3. While the dough is rising, prepare the filling: Peel and slice the bell peppers into thin strips. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over high heat, then add the sliced peppers and sauté for 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
4. Sprinkle the sugar over the peppers and reduce the heat. Allow to simmer for 35 minutes until the peppers are soft and caramelized.
5. Preheat your oven to 240°C (464°F). Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
6. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and divide it into small balls. Take each dough ball and press in a small amount of the prepared candied peppers before placing it on the baking tray.
7. Repeat the process until all dough and filling are used. Bake the rolls in the preheated oven for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
8. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly before serving.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich with Camembert Cheese from Normandy
ingredients: 8 slices of organic whole grain bread
16 slices of thinly sliced Andouille de Vire sausage
2 small Reine des Reinettes apples, peeled and sliced
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the fromage blanc, whole grain mustard, and apple cider vinegar. Season lightly with freshly ground black pepper.
Step 2: Slice the Camembert cheese into thin pieces. Peel and core the Reine des Reinettes apples, and cut them into thin slices. Rinse and drain the mesclun greens.
Step 3: Toast the slices of whole grain bread until golden brown.
Step 4: Spread the prepared sauce on each slice of toasted bread. Layer the Camembert cheese, Andouille de Vire slices, and apple slices on half of the bread slices.
Step 5: Top with a handful of mesclun greens before placing the remaining bread slices on top to close the sandwiches.
Step 6: Cut each sandwich in half, secure with wooden toothpicks, and serve garnished with sprouts.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a club sandwich with Camembert cheese from Normandy, styled with 8 slices of organic whole grain bread stacked high. Use natural light to accentuate the creamy Camembert and vibrant apple slices, creating soft shadows that enhance textures. Arrange fresh mesclun greens and soy sprouts artfully around the sandwich. Choose a rustic wooden background for warmth, and shoot from a 45-degree angle to emphasize layers. Use a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the sandwich, evoking a fresh, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Bresse Bleu Bagel Recipe
ingredients: 4 tablespoons onion confit, from a jar
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven grill. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook the chicken for 5 minutes on each side. Wrap the cooked chicken in aluminum foil and let it rest for 10 minutes.
Step 2: Meanwhile, cut the bagels in half and toast them under the oven grill until golden.
Step 3: Spread 1 tablespoon of onion confit on each bagel half. Top with a handful of mixed salad greens.
Step 4: Slice the rested chicken breasts and layer them over the salad greens. Cut the Bresse Bleu into slices, then halve each slice and lay them over the chicken.
Step 5: Place the assembled bagels under the grill for an additional 2 to 3 minutes until the cheese melts slightly. Cover with the bagel tops and enjoy immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning close-up of a Bresse Bleu bagel, showcasing the creamy, rich texture of the cheese melting over the warm, toasted sesame bagel halves. Arrange the bagels on a rustic wooden board, with a handful of vibrant mixed salad greens artfully placed beside them. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the colors and textures, highlighting the golden-brown bagels and the deep blue of the cheese. Incorporate a delicate drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of black pepper for added detail, while maintaining a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the dish. Aim for a warm, inviting mood that evokes a sense of indulgence.

recipes.name: Bresse Bleu Quesadillas
directions: Step 1: In a small saucepan, combine the beaten eggs with the butter.
Step 2: Heat over medium heat, stirring continuously with a wooden spatula until the eggs are soft and scrambled.
Step 3: Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in the cream. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 4: Preheat a grill pan over high heat.
Step 5: Brush one side of a tortilla with sunflower oil and place it in the hot grill pan, oiled side down.
Step 6: Spread the scrambled eggs evenly over the tortilla, then add the slices of Bresse Bleu and the chopped bacon. Top with the second tortilla, pressing down lightly with a spatula.
Step 7: After 2 minutes, carefully flip the quesadilla onto a plate, then slide it back into the grill pan to cook the other side for about 2 minutes on medium heat.
Step 8: Once both sides are golden and crispy, transfer the quesadilla to a cutting board and cut into 4 equal wedges. Serve immediately while the cheese is still melty.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of Bresse Bleu Quesadillas, showcasing the melty cheese oozing from the crispy, golden-brown tortillas. Use natural light to enhance the rich blue veins of the cheese and the vibrant yellows of the eggs. Style the dish on a rustic wooden board, garnished with fresh herbs and a small bowl of thick cream. Opt for a shallow depth of field to blur the background slightly, focusing on the quesadilla’s textures while creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur with Goat Cheese and Dried Duck Breasts
ingredients: 140 grams of dried duck breast, sliced
100 grams of goat cheese log, thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200°C (about 400°F).
Step 2: Spread the fresh cream evenly on one side of each slice of sandwich bread. Sprinkle a light layer of Espelette pepper over the cream.
Step 3: On four slices of bread, evenly distribute the sliced dried duck breast, ensuring the skin is removed.
Step 4: Place four slices of goat cheese on top of the duck breast on each of the four slices.
Step 5: Close the sandwiches with the remaining four slices of bread, cream side down.
Step 6: Place the sandwiches on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Step 7: Serve hot.

15 g fresh arugula (rocket), washed and dried
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven and toast the cut sides of the country bread until golden brown.
Step 2: Drizzle the balsamic vinaigrette evenly over one cut side of the bread.
Step 3: Evenly distribute the arugula across the length of the bread on top of the vinaigrette.
Step 4: Lay the slices of dried duck breast over the arugula.
Step 5: Scatter the chopped sun-dried tomatoes over the duck.
Step 6: Finish by sprinkling the toasted pine nuts over the entire sandwich.

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Croque Monsieur
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the grated Comté cheese until combined.
Step 2: Spread softened butter generously on one side of each slice of bread. On the non-buttered side of six slices, evenly distribute the egg and cheese mixture.
Step 3: Layer each of the six prepared slices with one slice of smoked salmon, then top with the remaining six slices of bread, buttered side up.
Step 4: In a frying pan, heat the olive oil and remaining butter over medium heat. Once melted and hot, add the assembled sandwiches to the pan.
Step 5: Cook the sandwiches for about 5 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy. Flip carefully to avoid spilling the filling.
Step 6: Once cooked, remove from heat, cut in half, and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 medium bell pepper (red, yellow, or green), diced
1 small can (approximately 150 g) of canned corn, drained
1 can (approximately 400 g) of tomato puree or crushed tomatoes
directions: 1. Peel the garlic and onions, remove the germ, and finely chop them.
2. In a skillet, heat the vegetable oil over low heat and sauté the garlic and onions for 5 minutes, without allowing them to color.

3. While the onions are cooking, peel the bell pepper (using a vegetable peeler makes this very easy), remove the seeds, and chop it into small cubes. Peel the avocados, remove the pit, and dice them.
4. Add the diced bell pepper and avocados to the skillet and cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
5. Rinse and drain the canned corn, then add it to the other vegetables in the skillet.
6. Pour in the tomato puree, season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper to taste, and continue to cook for another 10 minutes. Allow the mixture to cool.

7. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Spread a portion of the vegetable mixture in the center of each tortilla. Sprinkle a little shredded cheese on top and roll up the tortillas. Place them seam-side down in a baking dish.

8. Finally, top the rolled tortillas with the remaining vegetable mixture and any leftover cheese. Bake in the oven for 5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and slightly browned. Serve hot with a side salad.

Use natural light to accentuate the rich colors of the bell peppers and avocados, creating a warm, inviting atmosphere. Style with a textured linen napkin and a small bowl of salsa on the side. Opt for a slightly overhead angle to showcase the layers and filling, maintaining a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the enchiladas while softly blurring the background.

scenes.voice_over: Now, pour in 400 grams of tomato puree, season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne to taste, and cook for 10 minutes.

scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 180°C, spread the vegetable mix on each tortilla, sprinkle with cheese, and roll them up.

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur Inspired Flamichés
directions: Step 1: In a non-stick skillet, sauté the smoked bacon lardons over medium heat for a few minutes until crispy. Drain on paper towels and discard excess fat from the skillet.
Step 2: In the same skillet, add the finely chopped onion and cook over low heat until soft and translucent, ensuring it does not color.
Step 3: In a mixing bowl, combine the light crème fraîche, egg yolks, grated Gruyère cheese, crispy lardons, and cooked onions. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.

Step 4: Slice the goat cheese into rounds. Butter one side of each of 4 slices of bread and place them butter-side down on a plate. Top each slice with a piece of goat cheese, then spread the creamy mixture generously over the top.
Step 5: Butter the remaining 4 slices of bread on one side and place them on top of the assembled sandwiches, butter-side up.
Step 6: Cook the prepared croques in the skillet over medium-low heat for approximately 3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Alternatively, use a sandwich press for about 3 minutes total.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning overhead shot of Croque Monsieur Inspired Flamichés arranged on a rustic wooden board, with a soft, diffused light illuminating the dish to enhance the creamy textures of the goat cheese and the golden-brown toast. Use a delicate white linen napkin and a vintage knife as props to add warmth. Incorporate fresh herbs like thyme as garnishes around the edges. Maintain a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, keeping the focus sharp on the layered ingredients and vibrant colors, evoking a cozy yet sophisticated mood.

recipes.name: Light Gingerbread Sandwiches with Soft Apples
ingredients: 2 Melrose apples, peeled and thinly sliced
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 160°C (320°F). In a saucepan, melt the honey, softened butter, spices, sugar, milk, and lemon zest over low heat until combined. Remove from heat and discard the cardamom capsule.
2. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, rye flour, and baking powder. Gradually add the warm mixture to the dry ingredients, whisking until smooth.
3. Line a small loaf pan with parchment paper and pour in the batter. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow the gingerbread to cool on a wire rack.
4. In a skillet over low heat, cook the apple slices with the honey until they are soft and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.

5. Once the gingerbread is completely cooled, slice it into even pieces and remove the crusts. Spread a layer of cream cheese on each piece, place the warm apple slices on top, and sandwich with another slice.

recipes.name: Salmon and Dill Bagel with Vegetables
ingredients: 1 whole bagel, sliced in half and toasted
2 leaves of iceberg lettuce, rinsed and patted dry
1 slice of smoked salmon with dill and lemon seasoning
2 tablespoons plain cream cheese (Philadelphia or similar)
directions: Step 1: Prepare homemade bagels or purchase pre-made bagels if preferred.
Step 2: Slice the bagel in half and toast it using the bagel setting to toast only the inner side.
Step 3: Spread 1 tablespoon of plain cream cheese evenly on each half of the toasted bagel.
Step 4: Assemble the sandwich by arranging the iceberg lettuce, avocado slices, cucumber slices, and the seasoned salmon on one half of the bagel.
Step 5: Top with the other half of the bagel, slice it in half vertically, and if desired, secure with toothpicks for easy handling.

ingredients: 6 to 7 slices of roasted yellow and red bell peppers
directions: Step 1: Lay the whole wheat burrito wrap flat on a clean surface.
Step 2: Place the slice of turkey breast in the center of the wrap.
Step 3: Top the turkey with the roasted bell pepper slices.
Step 4: Drizzle 1 tablespoon of the pepper's juice over the top.
Step 5: Add a handful of mixed salad greens on top of the peppers.
Step 6: Fold the sides of the wrap towards the center and roll it tightly to enclose the filling.
Step 7: Optionally, wrap the burrito in foil for portability, or serve immediately on a plate with extra salad greens on the side.

recipes.name: Cucumber Sandwiches with Cream and Mint
ingredients: 100 grams brousse de brebis (sheep's milk cheese)
directions: Step 1: The day before, thinly slice the cucumber using a knife or mandoline. Place the slices in a colander set over a bowl and sprinkle them with coarse salt. Allow the cucumbers to drain overnight.
Step 2: The next day, rinse the cucumber slices under cold water and gently pat them dry with paper towels.
Step 3: In a mixing bowl, combine the yogurt with the finely chopped mint. Season with salt and pepper to taste and mix well.
Step 4: Gently add the cucumber slices to the mint yogurt mixture and toss to coat evenly.

Step 5: Assemble the sandwiches by spreading a layer of cucumber with mint cream on the bottom half of the ciabatta roll. Add a slice of smoked salmon and a layer of brousse de brebis. Place the top half of the ciabatta roll on and serve immediately or chill before serving.

Add a few scattered mint leaves and a sprinkle of black pepper for visual interest.

recipes.name: Portuguese Pregos Sandwich
ingredients: 5 to 6 tablespoons of beef stock or equivalent seasoning (to taste)
10 small bread rolls or 2 baguettes, cut in half
Mayonnaise or sauce of your choice
directions: Step 1: Peel and slice the onions. In a skillet, heat the olive oil and butter until melted, then add the onions. Cook until they turn golden brown, seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 2: Peel and mince the garlic. Wash and slice the tomatoes into 5 mm thick rounds.
Step 3: In another skillet, melt a bit of butter and quickly sear the beef carpaccio for 1 minute on each side. Salt on one side only.

Step 4: Remove the beef from the skillet and deglaze the pan with the lime juice, cold water, beef stock or seasoning, and the minced garlic. Cook for a few moments until combined, then remove from heat.

Step 5: Cut the bread rolls in half or cut each baguette into 5 pieces, then slice each piece in half. Lightly dip the bottom half of the bread into the stock-garlic mixture, being careful not to soak it too much.
Step 6: Place 2 slices of seared beef onto the bread, followed by the sautéed onions.
Step 7: Finally, add mayonnaise or your sauce of choice on the top half of the bread, topped with 1 to 2 slices of tomato.

Use natural light to enhance the glistening textures of the meat and the glossy sheen of the lime juice. Arrange the sandwich on a textured linen napkin, with a small bowl of beef stock and a few lime wedges nearby. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to emphasize depth, keeping the background softly blurred to maintain focus on the sandwich, creating a warm and inviting mood.

Step 2: Lay a wrap flat on a clean surface and spread an even layer of the cheese mixture over the entire surface.
Step 3: Top the cheese mixture with slices of Fol Epi cheese, followed by the smoked trout and shredded iceberg lettuce.
Step 4: Carefully roll the wrap tightly from one end to the other to enclose the filling. Cut in half if desired and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chocolate Sandwich Recipe
directions: Step 1: To make the génoise, preheat your oven to 170°C (340°F). Line two 20x30 cm baking trays with parchment paper. In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the butter and dark chocolate together. Once melted, stir in the granulated sugar, water, sifted flour, and egg yolks until combined. Pour the batter evenly into the prepared baking trays and bake for 25 minutes. Allow to cool in the trays before using a cookie cutter to cut 15 pieces from each génoise layer.

Step 2: Prepare the ganache by placing the chopped dark chocolate in a microwave-safe bowl with a splash of water. Heat in the microwave until partially melted, then mix in the semi-whipped cream until smooth. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator until it thickens slightly, ensuring it does not become too hard.

Step 3: To prepare the dough, melt the butter in the microwave until soft. In a mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, brown sugar, and eggs, mixing until well blended. Gradually add the sifted all-purpose flour and cocoa powder, mixing until a smooth dough forms. Divide the dough into two balls, then roll each ball out on a floured surface to about 5 mm thick. Preheat your oven to 180°C (356°F) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Using the same cutter from the génoise, cut 30 pieces from each rolled-out dough and place them on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes, allowing several batches if needed. Let cool completely.
Step 4: To assemble the sandwiches, spread a layer of ganache on the bottom of each cookie circle. Stack them together with a piece of génoise in between to create a sandwich.

recipes.name: Tomato-Mozzarella Croque Monsieur
ingredients: 3 slices of herb-infused white ham, cut into quarters
2 balls of mozzarella cheese, sliced thickly
Freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Spread Neapolitan tomato sauce evenly on one side of each slice of bread.
Step 2: Place the ham on half of the slices of bread, tomato sauce side up, and add the slices of mozzarella cheese on top. Season with freshly ground black pepper.
Step 3: Top with the remaining slices of bread, ensuring the tomato sauce side is facing inwards.
Step 4: Lightly brush the exterior of the sandwiches with olive oil.
Step 5: Preheat your sandwich press or grill and cook the sandwiches until golden brown and the cheese has melted, approximately 3-5 minutes.

recipes.name: Shrimp and Avocado Wraps
ingredients: 200 grams cooked and peeled pink shrimp
2 ripe avocados, peeled, pitted, and sliced
1 cup washed and dried lettuce leaves
directions: Step 1: Peel and rinse the cooked shrimp under cold water; set aside. Peel the avocados, remove the pits, slice them, and set aside.
Step 2: Rinse the cherry tomatoes, halve them, and set aside. Rinse the lettuce leaves, spin them dry, and set aside. Prepare the homemade mayonnaise if not already done.
Step 3: Take one wrap and spread the homemade mayonnaise evenly over half of its surface. Layer the wrap with lettuce, halved cherry tomatoes, shrimp, and avocado slices.
Step 4: Roll the wrap tightly from the side with the ingredients towards the clean side, ensuring it is compact.
Step 5: Cut the wrap in half and secure with a toothpick or skewer if desired. Repeat this process for the remaining wraps.

recipes.name: Mini Turkey Thigh Sandwich Assortment
ingredients: 12 mini rolls (4 sesame, 4 poppy seed, 4 plain)
120 grams cream cheese or herb cheese, spreadable
directions: Step 1: Slice the roasted turkey thigh into thin slices. Chop the sun-dried tomatoes into small pieces. Cut the mini rolls in half and spread cream cheese on one side of each roll.
Step 2: For the poppy seed rolls, layer the chopped sun-dried tomatoes, followed by the turkey slices, and top with a few arugula leaves before closing the sandwiches.
Step 3: For the sesame rolls, place a layer of cucumber slices, followed by turkey slices, and finish with mixed baby greens before closing the sandwiches.
Step 4: For the plain rolls, distribute the coleslaw evenly, add the turkey slices, top with arugula, and close the sandwiches.
Step 5: Serve the sandwiches promptly to enjoy while fresh.

recipes.name: Classic Bagels
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the instant dried yeast, sugar, and warm water. Stir to mix and let sit for 10 minutes until bubbly.
Step 2: In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, egg yolk, and salt. Gradually add in the yeast mixture, and mix until a dough forms.
Step 3: Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
Step 4: Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let rise for 30-40 minutes or until nearly doubled in size.
Step 5: Punch down the dough and divide it into 6 equal portions. Shape each piece into a rough ball and let rest for 10 minutes.
Step 6: Using your finger, poke a hole in the center of each ball and gently expand the hole to form a bagel shape. Cover and let rise for an additional 15-20 minutes.
Step 7: In a large pot, bring water to a simmer and stir in the baking soda. Preheat your oven to 170°C (340°F).
Step 8: Boil the bagels in batches, cooking them for 1-2 minutes on each side. Remove and place on a clean paper towel to drain.
Step 9: Brush each bagel with the beaten whole egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds (if desired).
Step 10: Bake the bagels for 30 minutes or until they are golden brown.
Step 11: Allow the bagels to cool slightly before slicing. For the best taste, enjoy them toasted the next day.

Use natural light to emphasize the bagel's texture and the subtle sheen of the sesame seeds. Style the scene with a rustic wooden board as the base, complemented by a soft linen napkin. Incorporate a small dish of cream cheese and a sprig of fresh chives for garnish. recipes.name: Mini Sandwiches with Adour Kiwi, Smoked Salmon, and Cream Cheese
ingredients: 4 Adour kiwis, peeled and sliced thinly
12 slices of crustless white sandwich bread
directions: 1. Dice the carrot and zucchini into small cubes. Blanch in boiling salted water for 2 minutes, then transfer to cold water to stop cooking. Drain in a colander.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the blanched vegetables with the cream cheese until well mixed. Set aside.
3. Assemble the sandwiches by layering bread, the vegetable and cheese mixture, smoked salmon, and kiwi slices in three tiers, ending with a slice of bread on top.
4. Cut each assembled sandwich into four pieces. Garnish the top with a dollop of cream cheese and a slice of kiwi. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving chilled.

recipes.name: Mini Croque Monsieur
ingredients: 8 slices of sandwich bread, crusts removed
120 grams of Comté cheese, thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Step 2: Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Step 3: Remove the crusts from the sandwich bread. Cut the Comté cheese into thin slices and divide the ham slices in half.

Step 4: In a small saucepan, melt the butter over low heat, skimming off any foam that forms on the surface. Using a pastry brush, generously coat both sides of each slice of sandwich bread with the clarified butter and lay them on the prepared baking tray.

Step 5: To assemble the croque monsieurs, place one slice of bread on the tray, add a few slices of Comté cheese, top with a slice of ham, followed by another layer of Comté, and finish with a second slice of bread. Press down lightly to secure the layers.

Step 6: Grill the assembled croque monsieurs in the preheated oven for about 7 minutes, or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cut each sandwich into quarters. Insert wooden picks to hold them together, and serve immediately while hot.

Add a sprig of fresh thyme for garnish and a small bowl of Dijon mustard on the side. recipes.name: Classic Reuben Sandwich
ingredients: For quick Thousand Island dressing: 1 tablespoon mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon ketchup, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper to taste, 1 finely chopped pickle (optional)
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and optional finely chopped pickle to prepare the Thousand Island dressing.
Step 2: Spread Thousand Island dressing on one side of each slice of bread and softened butter on the opposite side.
Step 3: On the bread slice with dressing, layer a slice of Swiss cheese with the buttered side facing out.
Step 4: Top the cheese with turkey pastrami slices.
Step 5: Add drained sauerkraut over the pastrami.
Step 6: Place another slice of Swiss cheese on top of the sauerkraut and cover with the second slice of bread, dressing side down and buttered side up.
Step 7: Grill the sandwich in a skillet over medium heat, flipping with a spatula until both sides are golden brown and crispy, and the cheese is melted.
Step 8: Serve immediately with pickles and remaining Thousand Island dressing on the side.

scenes.image_prompt: A small bowl with mayonnaise, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper, with a spoon mixing them together.
scenes.text: Let's make the Thousand Island dressing.
scenes.voice_over: In a small bowl, combine 1 tablespoon of mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon of ketchup, a dash of Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and an optional finely chopped pickle.

scenes.image_prompt: Two slices of rye bread, one spread with dressing, the other with butter, on a cutting board.
scenes.text: Spread dressing on one side, butter on the other.
scenes.voice_over: Spread Thousand Island dressing on one side of each slice of bread and softened butter on the opposite side.

scenes.image_prompt: A slice of Swiss cheese placed on the dressing side of the bread, with the buttered side facing out.
scenes.text: Layer Swiss cheese on the dressing side.
scenes.voice_over: On the slice with the dressing, layer a slice of Swiss cheese, butter side facing out.

scenes.image_prompt: Layers of turkey pastrami and drained sauerkraut being added on top of the Swiss cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Another slice of Swiss cheese placed on top of the kraut, and the second slice of bread positioned above.
scenes.text: Complete the sandwich and prepare to grill.
scenes.voice_over: Place another slice of Swiss cheese on top of the sauerkraut, then cover with the second slice of bread, dressing side down and buttered side up.

scenes.image_prompt: A skillet on the stove with the assembled sandwich being grilled, golden brown on one side.
scenes.voice_over: Grill the sandwich in a skillet over medium heat for about 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy, and the cheese has melted.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished Reuben sandwich on a plate, sliced in half, served with pickles and a small bowl of dressing.

recipes.name: Ham, Lettuce, and Cream Cheese Wraps
directions: 1: Place the tortillas on a clean, flat surface.
2: Spread approximately 25 grams of cream cheese evenly over each tortilla.
3: Lay a slice of ham on top of the cream cheese on each tortilla.
4: Sprinkle shredded iceberg lettuce and chopped chives over the ham, ensuring to keep a border for easier rolling.
5: Sprinkle piment d'Espelette over the filling according to taste.
6: Starting from the side with the fillings, carefully roll the tortilla tightly into a wrap.
7: Slice the wraps in half and serve immediately, or refrigerate until serving.

recipes.name: Homemade Hamburger Buns
directions: Step 1: Activate the yeast according to package instructions. In a large mixing bowl, combine half of the flour, salt, sugar, and activated yeast. Make a well in the center and add the warmed milk, warmed water, softened butter, and egg. Mix for 5 minutes.
Step 2: Gradually add the remaining flour and knead the dough until it reaches a smooth and slightly elastic consistency. If the dough is sticky, incorporate a little more flour.
Step 3: Shape the dough into a ball and place it in a greased bowl. Cover with a kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm area for 2 hours.
Step 4: After the dough has risen, divide it into 100-gram pieces. Place the portions on a floured surface and let them rest for 10 minutes.

Step 5: Shape each portion into a ball, then gently flatten them with your palm. Lightly moisten the tops and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Arrange the shaped buns on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and let them rise for an additional hour.
Step 6: Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F). Place a bowl of ice cubes in the oven to create steam. Bake the buns for 15 minutes until golden brown. Let them cool on a wire rack.
Step 7: Assemble your hamburgers with your favorite toppings, such as cooked beef patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning overhead shot of homemade hamburger buns, golden brown and slightly glossy, arranged in a rustic wooden basket. Use soft, diffused natural light to accentuate the buns' textures and the sprinkled sesame seeds. Surround them with a few scattered flour dust and a cracked egg shell for authenticity. Incorporate a neutral linen cloth beneath for softness and warmth. Set the scene against a textured, light-colored background, creating a shallow depth of field that keeps the buns in sharp focus while softly blurring the surroundings for a cozy, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Homemade Hamburger Buns Recipe Tutorial

scenes.text: Welcome to our Hamburger Buns Tutorial!
scenes.voice_over: Today, we're making delicious homemade hamburger buns that are soft, fluffy, and sure to impress!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of all the raw ingredients on a kitchen countertop, organized and labeled, including yeast, milk, flour, and sesame seeds.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you will need active dry yeast, all-purpose flour, salt, sugar, warm milk, warm water, an egg, softened butter, and sesame seeds.

scenes.image_prompt: Action shot of a mixing bowl with flour and yeast being combined, highlighting an active yeast process.
scenes.voice_over: First, activate the yeast according to package instructions. In a mixing bowl, combine half the flour, salt, sugar, and the activated yeast. Make a well in the center and add warmed milk, water, butter, and one egg. Mix for 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A person kneading dough on a floured surface, showing the process of mixing and adding flour.
scenes.voice_over: Gradually add the remaining flour and knead the dough until smooth and slightly elastic. If it's sticky, add more flour as needed.

scenes.image_prompt: Dough ball placed in a greased bowl, covered with a kitchen towel, resting in a warm area.
scenes.voice_over: Shape the dough into a ball, place it in a greased bowl, cover with a towel, and let it rise in a warm area for about 2 hours.

scenes.image_prompt: The risen dough being divided into equal pieces on a floured countertop.
scenes.voice_over: After rising, divide the dough into 100-gram pieces and let them rest on a floured surface for 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Shaping dough into balls and flattening them slightly, with sesame seeds ready to sprinkle on top.
scenes.voice_over: Shape each piece into a ball, flatten slightly, moisten the tops, and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Arrange on a baking sheet and let rise for another hour.

scenes.image_prompt: An oven preheating with steam being created from a bowl of ice cubes placed in.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 200°C (392°F). Add a bowl of ice cubes to create steam, and bake the buns for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: The baked buns cooling on a wire rack, golden and fluffy.
scenes.voice_over: Once baked, let the buns cool on a wire rack to ensure they stay fluffy.

scenes.image_prompt: A final display of assembled hamburgers with freshly made buns, showcasing toppings like cheese, lettuce, tomato, and sauces.
scenes.voice_over: Now, it's time to assemble your hamburgers! Use your favorite toppings like beef patties, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and mayonnaise.

scenes.image_prompt: A joyful group of friends enjoying freshly made hamburgers around a table, with laughter and smiles.
scenes.voice_over: Enjoy your homemade hamburger buns with family and friends. Happy cooking!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use whole milk instead of water.
Ensure the butter is at room temperature for easier incorporation into the dough.

recipes.name: Homemade McDonald's Style Cheeseburger
ingredients: 2 homemade or store-bought sesame burger buns
2 tablespoons sweet relish or sweet pickle (refer to the relish recipe on my blog)
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Cut the sesame burger buns in half and spread mustard on the cut side of each bun.
Step 2: Grill the beef patties until cooked to your desired doneness.
Step 3: Place the cooked patties on the mustard-coated side of the buns, and top each patty with a slice of cheddar cheese.
Step 4: Spread 1 tablespoon of ketchup or tomato sauce on the other side of the buns.
Step 5: Add a teaspoon of sweet relish on top of the cheese, and sprinkle the finely diced onions over the relish.
Step 6: Close the burgers and place them in the preheated oven for 5 minutes to melt the cheese.
Step 7: Serve the cheeseburgers with a side of French fries or potato wedges.

Opt for a shallow depth of field, focusing on the burger while blurring the background to enhance the inviting, indulgent mood.

recipes.name: Double Chocolate Raspberry Sandwiches
directions: Step 1: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). In a saucepan, melt the unsalted butter and white chocolate together over low heat. Once melted, allow to cool slightly.

Step 2: In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs and brown sugar together until well combined. Gradually add the self-raising flour, mixing until smooth. Fold in the melted butter and white chocolate mixture, then gently mix in the dark chocolate chips.

Step 3: Pour the batter into a silicone loaf pan (or a greased and floured traditional pan), then bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow to cool for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Step 4: Prepare the raspberry puree. In a bowl, combine the raspberries and brown sugar. Use a fork to mash the mixture, creating a chunky puree. Fold in the plain cottage cheese until evenly mixed, then refrigerate until ready to serve.

Step 5: Assemble the sandwiches. Slice the cooled cake into 1 cm thick slices. Cut each slice in half diagonally to create triangles. Spread a dollop of the raspberry mixture on one triangle, then top with another triangle to form a sandwich. Secure each sandwich with a wooden skewer. Repeat the process with the remaining slices.
Step 6: Serve these delightful sandwiches as an afternoon snack, perfect for satisfying your sweet tooth!

recipes.name: Mini Croque Sandwiches with Tomacouli®, Goat Cheese, and Chorizo
directions: Step 1: Spread a generous layer of Tomacouli on each slice of sandwich bread, then add a thick layer of fresh goat cheese. Lightly season with salt.
Step 2: Place slices of chorizo on 8 of the bread slices and cover them with the remaining slices to create sandwiches.
Step 3: In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Cook the sandwiches until they are golden brown, about 3 minutes on each side.
Step 4: Cut each sandwich into quarters.
Step 5: Keep the sandwiches warm until ready to serve.

recipes.name: Rustic Homemade Burger
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 150°C (302°F). Peel and finely dice the onion. Sauté the diced onion in a skillet over medium heat until golden but not browned.
Step 2: Mince the garlic and cut the pickles in half lengthwise.

Step 3: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, sautéed onions, minced garlic, and Herbes de Provence. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape each into a patty slightly larger than the hamburger buns.
Step 4: Separate the hamburger buns and place them on a baking sheet.
Step 5: Rinse and dry the spinach leaves. Wash the tomato and slice it into 8 thin rounds, arranging them neatly on a plate.
Step 6: Optional: Lightly toast the hamburger buns in the oven for a few minutes until crispy.

recipes.name: Chicken or Salmon Bagels with Mint Yogurt Sauce
ingredients: Poppy seeds, sesame seeds, and mustard seeds (for topping)
Cooked chicken, sliced (or 4 small cooked chicken breast fillets)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the bagel dough. In the bowl of a stand mixer, add the flour to one side, and crumbled yeast, salt, and sugar to the other. Pour in the olive oil and lukewarm water, and mix with the dough hook for 8 to 10 minutes until a smooth dough forms. Once mixed, flour a work surface and divide the dough into 6 equal portions. Shape each portion into a ball, cover with a cloth, and let them rest to prevent drying.

Step 2: Shape the bagels. Take each dough ball and use a floured finger to poke a hole in the center. Slowly stretch the dough to form a ring, ensuring the hole is 5-6 cm wide as the dough will shrink back. Allow the shaped bagels to rest for 2 hours.

Step 3: Cook the bagels. In a large pot, bring the 3 liters of water to a simmer. Add the brown sugar, cornstarch, and salt. Once simmering, gently lower the bagels into the water, cooking each for 1 minute on each side. Remove with a slotted spoon and place them on a cloth to drain.

Step 4: Bake the bagels. Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F). Brush the tops of the bagels with beaten egg yolk and sprinkle with the seeds. Place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper and bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Let them cool.

Step 5: Prepare the filling. Thinly slice the cooked chicken. Rinse and thinly slice the zucchini and cucumber. Peel and slice the red onion. In a bowl, combine the yogurt, minced garlic, sliced onion, chopped mint, olive oil, and vanilla pepper vinegar. Season with salt and pepper, then fold in the sliced cucumber and zucchini.

Step 6: Assemble the bagels. Once the bagels are cooled, slice them in half. Spread a layer of the yogurt mixture on the bottom half, add slices of chicken, and then top with more yogurt mixture before placing the top half of the bagel back on.

video_script.title: Chicken or Salmon Bagels with Mint Yogurt Sauce

scenes.voice_over: In a stand mixer, combine flour on one side and yeast, salt, and sugar on the other. Add olive oil and lukewarm water, and mix for 8 to 10 minutes until smooth.

scenes.voice_over: In a pot of simmering water, add brown sugar, cornstarch, and salt. Simmer each bagel for 1 minute on each side.

scenes.image_prompt: Bagels arranged on a baking tray, being brushed with egg yolk and sprinkled with seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F). Brush with egg yolk, sprinkle seeds, and bake for 15-20 minutes until golden.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl mixing together yogurt, minced garlic, red onions, cucumber, zucchini, and mint.

scenes.voice_over: Slice the cooled bagels, spread yogurt sauce, layer with chicken, and top with more sauce before closing.

scenes.image_prompt: A final shot of finished Chicken or Salmon Bagels served on a plate, garnished with extra cucumber and mint.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your Chicken or Salmon Bagels with a side of fresh cucumbers. Enjoy your delicious creation!

recipes.name: Crispy Pollock Sandwich with Creamy Sauce
directions: 1. Coat the fillets of pollock with the quick-cooking polenta, ensuring an even layer for a crispy coating.
2. Heat cooking oil in a skillet over medium heat. Once hot, add the coated pollock fillets and fry until golden brown on both sides.

3. While the fish is cooking, prepare the sauce by combining the cream cheese, white balsamic vinegar, massalé spice blend, and parsley-garlic mixture in a bowl. Mix well and season with salt to taste.
4. Slice the rustic baguettes lengthwise. Spread a generous amount of the creamy sauce on the inside of each baguette.
5. Place the cooked pollock fillet into each baguette, top with halved cherry tomatoes, and enjoy immediately.

Use natural light to accentuate the golden crust of the pollock and the creamy sauce oozing from the baguette. Style with fresh parsley sprigs and a sprinkle of massalé spice for color contrast. Incorporate a soft-focus background with blurred polenta in a bowl to enhance depth. Frame the shot at a 45-degree angle to emphasize layers and textures, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Subway-Style Sandwich
ingredients: 2 Italian Subway® breads, sliced in half
5-6 black or green pitted olives, sliced
1-2 leaves of lettuce or iceberg, shredded
directions: Step 1: Prepare all ingredients by rinsing the vegetables. Slice the lettuce, olives, and tomatoes. Cut the cucumber into half-moons and the Comté cheese into thin slices.
Step 2: Cut the Italian bread in half and spread mayonnaise on one side and mustard on the other.
Step 3: On the mustard side, layer the shredded lettuce and tomato slices. Add a few slices of cucumber, Comté cheese, and sprinkle with sliced olives.
Step 4: If needed, fold the mortadella slices in half and place them on top of the turkey slices.
Step 5: Close the sandwich with the mayonnaise side facing down. Optionally, cut the sandwich in half for easier sharing.

recipes.name: Vietnamese Banh Mi Sandwich
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sugar (for pickling carrots and daikon)
1 teaspoon salt (for pickling carrots and daikon)
6 tablespoons white vinegar (for pickling carrots and daikon)
250 ml hot water (for pickling carrots and daikon)
2 carrots, shredded or cut into thin strips (for pickling)
1 pork tenderloin, approximately 500g (for marinating and roasting)
1 packet Chinese sweet sauce mix for pork (for marinating)
1.5 baguettes or 6 rustic rolls (for sandwich base)
Cha lua (Vietnamese pork sausage, for sandwich filling)
Maggi seasoning sauce (spicy, for finishing touches)
1 red chili pepper, thinly sliced (optional, for garnish)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the pickled carrots and daikon the night before by shredding or cutting the carrots into thin strips. In a jar, combine the vinegar, sugar, and salt. Stir to dissolve, then add the hot water. Add the carrots and mix well. Let the mixture marinate in the refrigerator overnight.

Step 2: Prepare the pork marinade the night before. In a suitable container for the pork, combine the tenderloin, soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, sweet sauce mix, and cornstarch. Mix thoroughly ensuring the pork is well-coated with the marinade. Refrigerate for at least 12 hours, preferably overnight.

Step 3: On the day of preparation, preheat the oven to 210°C (410°F). Place the marinated pork tenderloin on a wire rack and roast for 30-40 minutes, regularly basting with the marinade to enhance flavor and tenderness.
Step 4: Meanwhile, wash the cilantro and slice the cucumber lengthwise. Slice the cha lua into 3-4 pieces per serving.
Step 5: Once the pork is cooked, remove it from the oven and allow it to cool for about 10 minutes before slicing it thinly.

Step 6: Slice the baguettes or rustic rolls in half and spread mayonnaise on both sides. Layer the sliced pork, cucumber, cilantro, cha lua, and optional chili pepper, followed by the pickled carrots. Ensure to pack the ingredients well.
Step 7: Before serving, drizzle a few drops of Maggi seasoning sauce over the top.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Vietnamese Banh Mi Sandwich arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to enhance the glossy textures of the marinated pork and the vibrant colors of pickled carrots and daikon. Incorporate fresh cilantro and sliced chili as garnishes. Use a shallow depth of field to focus on the sandwich while softly blurring the background, which should feature a simple, warm-toned tablecloth. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the layers and fillings, creating an inviting, appetizing mood.

recipes.name: Mini Burgers with Tapenade and Anchovy Butter
ingredients: 100 grams green olive tapenade or tomato olive tapenade
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Rinse the basil leaves and set aside.
Step 2: Place the mini burger buns in the oven and heat for 5 minutes until warm.
Step 3: Once warmed, remove the buns from the oven and cut each bun in half.
Step 4: Spread anchovy butter generously on both halves of each bun.
Step 5: On one half of each bun, spread a layer of tapenade.
Step 6: Add one fresh basil leaf on top of the tapenade and close the burger with the other half of the bun.

directions: Step 1: Finely chop the onion and lettuce.
Step 2: Slice the carrot, zucchini, and bell peppers into thin strips.
Step 3: Cook the sliced zucchini in a pan over medium heat until tender, approximately 3-4 minutes.
Step 4: In a separate skillet, sauté the onions and bell peppers with a dash of oil until softened and lightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 5: Layer the cooked veggies and raw ingredients onto the whole wheat bread as desired.
Step 6: Optionally, add assorted fruits, fresh herbs, and nuts for extra flavor and crunch.

recipes.name: Ground Beef Quesadillas
ingredients: 100 grams shredded cheese (such as cheddar or Monterey Jack)
directions: 1. In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
2. Add the ground beef to the skillet, season with salt, sweet paprika, cayenne pepper, and cumin. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the beef is fully browned and cooked through.
3. Remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool slightly, then stir in the chopped cilantro.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the diced roasted red and green bell peppers with the beef mixture.

5. Place one tortilla in a clean skillet over medium-low heat. Spread half of the beef and pepper mixture evenly over the tortilla and sprinkle with half of the shredded cheese. Top with a second tortilla.
6. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the tortillas are golden and the cheese has melted.
7. Remove from skillet and slice into quarters. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling.
8. Serve warm with your choice of toppings such as salsa, guacamole, or sour cream.

recipes.name: Lemon Herb Chicken Burger
directions: 1. Prepare the marinade: In a bowl, mix the juice of 1 lemon, 5 tablespoons of olive oil, 2 tablespoons of honey, and 1 teaspoon of thyme. Coat the chicken fillets with this mixture and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
2. In the meantime, heat a little olive oil in a pan over medium heat, then add the sliced bell peppers and sauté until softened.
3. Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F). Warm the hamburger buns in the oven for 3 minutes.
4. Assemble each burger: On the bottom half of each bun, place a lettuce leaf, followed by a cooked chicken fillet, sautéed bell peppers, and cubed feta cheese. Top with the other half of the bun.

recipes.name: Christmas Tree Bread with Smoked Salmon and Foie Gras
ingredients: Mixed seeds for decoration (e.g., flax seeds)
1 egg yolk mixed with a splash of water for brushing
directions: 1. In the bowl of a stand mixer or bread machine, add the ingredients in the order listed. If using a bread machine, mix and set the machine to 'dough'. If using a stand mixer, knead the mixture, then let it rise for about 1 hour, knead again, and let it rise once more.

2. Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Shape the dough into small balls of approximately 2.5 cm in diameter. Arrange them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, starting with one ball, then adding two more in a staggered formation, leaving space for them to rise and expand during baking. Repeat for a second tree, finishing with a rectangle to form the trunk.
3. Brush the balls with the egg yolk mixture and sprinkle with seeds. Allow to rise for an additional 30 minutes.
4. Bake the bread for 10 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool completely.
5. Using a serrated knife, cut each tree in half, starting from the outside and then slicing through the center.
6. For the filling: Spread one tree with butter or cream cheese and layer with slices of smoked salmon. Spread the other tree with fig onion chutney and layer with pieces of foie gras.
7. Finally, place the top halves back on each tree and decorate the base with a nice ribbon.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning Christmas Tree Bread adorned with layers of smoked salmon and foie gras, styled on a rustic wooden board. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the golden-brown crust and the vibrant pink of the salmon. Incorporate a dark green linen napkin for contrast and a sprig of rosemary for garnish. Shoot from a 45-degree angle, ensuring a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background while keeping the bread as the focal point, evoking a warm, festive mood.

recipes.name: Italian Mozzarella and Coppa Burger
directions: 1. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of cooking oil.
2. Cook the ground beef patties in the skillet for about 3 minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired level of doneness.
3. While the patties are cooking, slice the fresh mozzarella into thin rounds.
4. Toast the burger buns in a toaster until golden brown.
5. Spread a layer of tomato sauce on the bottom half of each toasted bun and top with a handful of arugula leaves.
6. Place a cooked beef patty on top of the arugula, followed by a slice of mozzarella; the heat from the patty will help melt the cheese slightly.
7. Add 2 slices of coppa on top of the melted mozzarella and garnish with fresh basil leaves.
8. Cap the burger with the top half of the bun and serve immediately.

Use natural light to enhance the vibrant colors of the fresh mozzarella and deep red tomato sauce, creating soft shadows to emphasize texture. Style the scene with a few scattered arugula leaves and basil garnishes around the burger. Shoot from a low angle to accentuate the layers, achieving a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background while keeping the burger as the focal point, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Ham and Vegetable Wrap with Mayonnaise
ingredients: 3 slices of cheese (your choice of type)
1/2 package of mixed raw vegetables (shredded beets and carrots, and white cabbage)
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the egg yolk, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Whisk together until smooth.
Step 2: Gradually add the vegetable oil while continuing to whisk until the mixture thickens into mayonnaise.
Step 3: Slice the ham and cheese into bite-sized pieces and the cherry tomatoes into thin rounds.
Step 4: Place the ham, cheese, and tomato slices in the center of a wrap. Sprinkle with the mixed raw vegetables and top with 2 teaspoons of mayonnaise.
Step 5: Add 2 or 3 additional pieces of ham and cheese. Top with another teaspoon of mayonnaise.
Step 6: To roll the wrap, fold in the sides of the tortilla towards the center, then roll from the bottom up tightly. Use a small dab of mayonnaise to seal the ends.
Step 7: Cut the wrap in half and secure with a wooden skewer if necessary to prevent unrolling. Repeat the process for the remaining wraps.
Step 8: Chill the wraps in the refrigerator for about 30 to 60 minutes before serving.
Step 9: Serve the wraps cold, accompanied by additional mayonnaise for dipping, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a stunning overhead shot of a Ham and Vegetable Wrap, elegantly sliced to reveal vibrant layers of ham, cheese, and colorful mixed vegetables. Use natural light to enhance the textures and colors, casting soft shadows. Style the scene with a rustic wooden board as the base, complemented by a small bowl of creamy mayonnaise on the side, garnished with fresh herbs. Incorporate a neutral linen napkin and a fork for a casual yet refined touch, ensuring a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background and focus on the wrap's vibrant details.

recipes.name: Fig, Goat Cheese, and Arugula Croque Sandwiches
ingredients: 1 cup fresh arugula, washed and dried
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Rinse the arugula and figs, and gently pat them dry. Slice the figs and the goat cheese into even slices.
Step 2: On two slices of bread, layer the goat cheese slices, followed by the sliced figs. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Top with the remaining slices of bread to form sandwiches.
Step 3: Cook the sandwiches in a sandwich press or under the grill until the cheese has melted and the bread is golden brown.
Step 4: Before serving, carefully open each sandwich and add a handful of arugula and a drizzle of balsamic cream, if using.

Incorporate a drizzle of balsamic cream and a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper for visual interest. recipes.name: Black Club Sandwich with Red Mullet and Feta
ingredients: Olive oil for cooking and drizzling
1 small piece of butter for cooking
directions: 1. Prepare the tapenade bread: In a small bowl, dissolve the fresh yeast and sugar in the warm milk. Let sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and add the yeast mixture, tapenade, and softened butter.
3. Knead the dough by hand for about 10 minutes or in a stand mixer for 7 minutes until smooth. Cover the dough and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour.
4. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Place a small oven-safe bowl filled with water in the oven to create steam.
5. Shape the dough and place it in a loaf pan. Bake for about 40 minutes or until golden brown. Remove and allow to cool.
6. Prepare the club sandwich filling: In a bowl, combine the crumbled feta cheese and chopped sundried tomatoes. Mix well.
7. Slice the cucumber into thin rounds. Cut 3 slices of the cooled tapenade bread.
8. Lightly toast the bread slices in a toaster or under a broiler until golden.
9. In a skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Sauté the chicory leaves for 1 minute until just wilted. Remove from the pan and set aside.

10. In the same skillet, add a small piece of butter and olive oil if necessary. Cook the red mullet fillets skin-side down for 1-2 minutes until crispy. Season with salt and pepper. Flip and cook for another minute before removing from heat.

11. Assemble the sandwich: Spread some of the feta mixture on one slice of toasted bread. Layer with cucumber slices, another slice of bread, chicory leaves, and 2 fillets of red mullet. Sprinkle with chopped chives.
12. Top with the final bread slice. Secure with toothpicks and cut the sandwich in half. Serve with chips or fries.

Use natural light to accentuate the textures, creating soft shadows. Style the scene with a rustic wooden board, garnished with fresh herbs and a side of sundried tomato salsa. Employ a shallow depth of field to keep the sandwich in sharp focus while softly blurring the background for a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Marinated Shrimp Sandwiches with Lemon
ingredients: 20 medium pink shrimp, peeled and deveined, tails left on
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Peel the shrimp, leaving the tail intact. Place the shrimp in a mixing bowl and drizzle with the juice of half a lemon. Add freshly ground black pepper and 1 teaspoon of chopped dill. Mix well and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Step 2: Toast the 10 slices of sandwich bread until golden brown, then allow them to cool completely.
Step 3: Remove the zest and white pith from two lemons and slice them into very thin rounds.

Step 4: Spread softened butter on one side of each slice of bread. On 5 of the slices, layer the lemon rounds, then top with the remaining slices of bread, buttered side down. Gently press down to form sandwiches. Cut each sandwich diagonally into 4 triangles.
Step 5: Arrange the marinated shrimp on a serving plate alongside the sandwiches. Garnish with additional lemon slices and sprigs of dill.

Style the sandwiches with fresh dill sprigs and lemon wedges alongside, enhancing freshness. Incorporate a soft-focus background with a pastel-colored tablecloth to evoke a summery feel. Opt for a low angle to emphasize the sandwich layers, ensuring the textures of the butter and shrimp are pronounced, creating an inviting, mouth-watering mood.

recipes.name: Syrian Three-Cheese Panini
ingredients: 100 grams cooked chicken breast, thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Place two slices of whole wheat bread on a clean surface.
Step 2: Evenly distribute the mozzarella, gorgonzola, and parmesan cheeses over the bread slices.
Step 3: Add the thinly sliced cooked chicken breast on top of the cheese layer.
Step 4: Top with the other two slices of bread to create sandwiches.
Step 5: Spread softened unsalted butter on the outer sides of each sandwich.
Step 6: Cook the sandwiches in a panini press or waffle iron for about 5 minutes until the bread is golden brown and the cheese has melted.
Step 7: Before serving, sprinkle za'atar seasoning over the top of the panini.
Step 8: Serve the paninis hot alongside a seasonal salad.

recipes.name: Light Cucumber Sandwich Recipe
ingredients: 1 medium cucumber, peeled and halved lengthwise, seeds scooped out
4 tablespoons herb cream cheese (e.g., Tartare or Boursin)
Optional: 6 bamboo skewers, cut in half for serving
directions: Step 1: Peel the cucumber and cut it in half lengthwise. Use a small spoon to scoop out the seeds from the center.
Step 2: Spread the herb cream cheese evenly inside the scooped-out halves of the cucumber.
Step 3: Roll the slices of ham and place them inside one half of the cucumber. Close it with the other half.
Step 4: To prepare a sandwich: Cut the stuffed cucumber in half to create two sandwiches.
Step 5: To make cucumber lollipops: Insert the skewer halves evenly into the filled cucumber, then cut between the skewers to create bite-sized pieces.
Step 6: Refrigerate the sandwiches/lollipops until ready to serve.

Use natural light from a window to enhance the fresh green hues of the cucumbers and the creamy texture of the herb cream cheese. Incorporate delicate garnishes like microgreens or fresh herbs for color. Shoot from a slight overhead angle to showcase the layers of ham and cheese, with a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background, creating a warm, inviting mood. Use bamboo skewers to add height and interest, ensuring the focus remains on the sandwich details.

recipes.name: Comforting Hot Sandwich
ingredients: 4 handfuls of grated cheese (cheddar or your choice)
4 portions of cream cheese (such as Kiri or St-Môret)
directions: 1. On 4 slices of brioche, distribute the smoked bacon evenly and sprinkle a handful of grated cheese on top.
2. On another 4 slices of brioche, spread each with 2 halved cherry tomatoes and top with sliced mushrooms.
3. On the remaining 4 slices of brioche, spread each with a portion of cream cheese and sprinkle crushed peanuts on top.
4. Arrange all the prepared slices on a baking sheet and grill in the oven for about 20 minutes at 180°C (350°F), or until desired crispiness, preferably preheated.
5. Finally, stack the hot sandwich starting with the bacon layer on the bottom, followed by the tomato layer and finishing with the peanut layer on top.

Use warm, natural lighting to enhance the rich golden hues of the brioche and the vibrant colors of the halved cherry tomatoes.
