recipes.name: Swedish Breads with Caramelized Onions, Goat Cheese, and Coppa
ingredients: 10 slices of coppa (or another cured ham)
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Peel and thinly slice the onions. In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat, add the onions, and cook until softened. Stir in the brown sugar and allow the onions to caramelize on low heat for 5 to 10 minutes, adjusting the time based on your preference for sweetness.
Step 2: While the onions are cooking, toast the halved Swedish breads in a toaster or under a broiler until lightly browned.
Step 3: Layer the toasted breads with slices of coppa, followed by goat cheese, and top with the caramelized onions. Season lightly with freshly ground black pepper.
Step 4: Drizzle with balsamic cream just before serving.
Step 5: Serve immediately or place under the broiler for a few minutes for a crispier texture and melted cheese.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a top-down view of three halved Swedish breads artfully arranged on a rustic wooden board, topped with glistening caramelized onions, creamy goat cheese slices, and delicate folds of coppa. Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the rich golden tones of the onions and the creamy white of the cheese, creating a warm, inviting mood. Drizzle balsamic cream artistically over the dish, and sprinkle freshly ground black pepper for contrast. Incorporate a blurred herb sprig in the foreground for depth, and select a soft, neutral background to accentuate the dish's vibrant colors.

recipes.name: Serrano Ham and Pesto Potato Croquettes
ingredients: 4 medium Blue Belle potatoes, peeled and grated
2 slices of Serrano ham (or white ham or leftover cold chicken)
directions: Step 1: Peel the Blue Belle potatoes and grate them finely, either using a food processor or a manual grater. Do not rinse the potatoes to retain the starch. Season with salt and pepper.

Step 2: In a 30 cm skillet, heat the olive oil and butter over medium heat. Spread half of the grated potatoes evenly in the skillet, pressing down with a flipped plate to ensure even cooking. Cook for 7 to 8 minutes until golden brown.
Step 3: Carefully flip the potato cake onto a plate, then cook the other side for an additional 7 to 8 minutes until golden brown. Remove and set aside.
Step 4: Repeat steps 2 and 3 with the remaining grated potatoes to make a second potato cake.
Step 5: Cut each potato cake into 6 squares. Spread pesto on 4 squares, top with another square, add a slice of Serrano ham, and finish with the last square.
Step 6: Transfer the completed croquettes to a preheated oven and bake for 5 minutes until heated through. Cut each croquette into triangles and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of golden-brown Serrano Ham and Pesto Potato Croquettes arranged artfully on a rustic wooden board. Use natural diffused lighting to emphasize the crispy texture and vibrant green of the pesto. Incorporate fresh basil leaves and a small dish of pesto as props to enhance the composition. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to highlight the croquettes' layered interior. Maintain a shallow depth of field, keeping the focus on the croquettes while softly blurring the background, evoking a warm and inviting mood.

scenes.text: Step 2: Cook the first potato cake

recipes.name: Master Croque: Avocado, Bacon, and Cheddar Sandwich
ingredients: 2 tablespoons HP Sauce or barbecue sauce
directions: Step 1: In a skillet over high heat, cook the smoked bacon for 30 seconds on each side until crisp, then remove and set aside.
Step 2: Carefully peel and slice the ripe avocado into thin strips.
Step 3: On a slice of bread, spread 1 tablespoon of HP sauce evenly.
Step 4: Layer 2 slices of bacon on the bread, followed by the avocado slices, another 2 slices of bacon, and lastly, top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Step 5: Place a second slice of bread on top to form a sandwich.
Step 6: Cook the sandwich in a sandwich press or wrap in aluminum foil and heat in a very hot skillet for approximately 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown.
Step 7: Serve immediately with a side salad.

Aim for a warm, inviting mood that highlights the dish's indulgent appeal.

recipes.name: Colorful Avocado and Crab Sandwich
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Juice of 1/4 lemon, to prevent avocado browning
directions: Step 1: Prepare the homemade mayonnaise in advance and set aside 1 teaspoon to mix with the cooked crab meat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 2: Spread a thin layer of butter on the slice of whole grain bread.
Step 3: Layer the fresh sprouts evenly over the buttered bread.

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur with Béchamel Sauce
ingredients: 2 slices of ham, trimmed to fit the bread
2 slices of cheese (such as Gruyère or Emmental)
30 g Grana Padano or other hard cheese, grated
directions: 1. Prepare the béchamel sauce: In a saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Once melted, add the flour and stir continuously with a wooden spoon until well blended.
2. Warm the milk in another saucepan, then gradually pour it into the roux while whisking vigorously to avoid lumps.
3. Season the sauce with salt, pepper, and the grated nutmeg. Stir in the grated Grana Padano cheese until melted and incorporated; set aside.

4. Assemble the croque monsieur: On one slice of bread, place one slice of cheese, then a slice of ham, and additional pieces of ham if desired. Top with another slice of cheese, and close with a second slice of bread.
5. Spread a generous layer of béchamel sauce over the top of the sandwich.
6. Sprinkle the grated Gruyère cheese on top of the béchamel.

7. Cook the sandwich either in a preheated oven at a low temperature until the cheese melts or in a frying pan over low heat with a lid, flipping the sandwich carefully to toast both sides until golden brown. Keep a close watch to prevent burning.
8. For a crispy finish, place the sandwich under a grill for a few minutes until golden and bubbling. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Bacon, Arugula, and Sun-Dried Tomato Wraps
ingredients: 15 slices of bacon, cooked and crispy
6 sun-dried tomatoes, sliced lengthwise into thirds
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Spread a layer of cream cheese evenly over the first tortilla.
Step 2: Season lightly with black pepper, then layer 5 slices of crispy bacon on top.
Step 3: Place 2 sliced sun-dried tomatoes evenly across the tortilla, ensuring each bite has some.
Step 4: Add a handful of arugula and drizzle with 1 teaspoon of olive oil, spreading it for an even distribution.
Step 5: Roll the tortilla tightly, then trim off the ends and cut it into 6 mini wraps.
Step 6: Repeat steps 1 through 5 for the remaining tortillas. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipes.name: Grilled Chicken Sandwich
directions: Step 1: Preheat the grill in the oven. In a medium bowl, combine lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper to create a marinade.
Step 2: Coat the chicken breast slices in the marinade and let it sit for 10 minutes.
Step 3: Drain the chicken and place on a baking tray. Grill for 3 minutes on each side until fully cooked.
Step 4: Lightly toast the whole wheat bread slices in a skillet while the chicken is grilling.

Step 5: Slice the grilled chicken into thin strips. On each plate, place 4 slices of toasted bread and layer the center with chicken, tomato sauce, avocado slices, shredded lettuce, and a dollop of yogurt.
Step 6: Top each sandwich with the remaining toasted bread slices, pressing gently to close.
Step 7: Optionally, garnish the top of the sandwiches with additional avocado slices if desired. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Summer Bagel with Roasted Peppers, Beet Greens, Goat Cheese, and Bresaola
ingredients: Freshly cracked three-pepper blend, to taste
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and toast the bagels until warmed through and slightly golden.
2. Spread pine nuts in a single layer on a baking sheet and toast in the oven for 5 to 7 minutes, or until golden brown.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine softened goat cheese with freshly cracked three-pepper blend; mix well.
4. Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, peel, and slice it into thin slices.
5. Spread the goat cheese mixture evenly on both halves of the toasted bagels. Drizzle honey over the cheese on the bottom half.
6. Layer beet greens, roasted peppers, and sliced avocado on top of the cheese.
7. Top with a slice of bresaola and sprinkle with toasted pine nuts. Cover with the top half of the bagel.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious summer bagel.

recipes.name: Zucchini Pickles
directions: Step 1: Wash the zucchinis thoroughly and slice them into thin rounds. You can use a mandoline for even slicing. Pack the slices tightly into a sterilized jar.
Step 2: In a saucepan, combine the brown sugar, colored vinegar, water, and both types of seeds. Heat over low flame, stirring until the sugar fully dissolves.

Step 4: Seal the jar tightly and let it cool to room temperature before refrigerating.

recipes.name: Semolina Bread Bagnat Style
ingredients: Sesame seeds or poppy seeds (for topping)
directions: Step 1: In a stand mixer or bread machine, add water, and sprinkle fresh yeast and sugar on top. Let it sit for about 5 minutes until frothy.
Step 2: Add the flour, semolina, olive oil, and salt in the order listed. Knead the dough for approximately 1 hour and 30 minutes, including rising time.
Step 3: Transfer the dough from the mixer or machine, and punch it down for about 5 minutes. Divide the dough into 2 to 4 pieces, depending on the desired bread size.
Step 4: If using a food processor, follow the same ingredient order and knead well. Let the dough rise in a greased bowl in a warm place until it doubles in size.
Step 5: For the hand kneading method, dissolve yeast in water with sugar. Mix flour and semolina in a bowl and make a well, gradually incorporating the water while mixing.
Step 6: Add olive oil and salt. Knead until the dough is elastic and no longer sticky, about 10 to 15 minutes, ensuring lightness and moisture in the bread.
Step 7: Allow the kneaded dough to rest under a cloth in a warm area until it doubles in size, then shape according to the recipe.

Step 8: Place shaped dough on a greased baking sheet and cover with a cloth to rise again until puffy (30 to 45 minutes depending on room temperature). Make incisions on the bread surface (a cross pattern), then brush with the egg wash mixed with a splash of water and sprinkle with seeds.
Step 9: Preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F) and bake the bread for approximately 20 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on a wire rack.
Step 10: In a bowl, mix the drained tuna with mayonnaise. Thinly slice the white onion and halved cherry tomatoes, and cut the cucumber into thin rounds.

Step 11: Peel and slice the hard-boiled eggs. Cut the bread in half, drizzle each side with olive oil, layer with tuna, shredded lettuce, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and egg slices. Close the sandwich and cut into quarters. Serve and enjoy.

recipes.name: Pesto Sorrel Sandwiches with Poached Eggs
ingredients: 200 grams fresh sorrel leaves, washed and stems removed
directions: 1. Prepare the sorrel pesto: Rinse the sorrel leaves under cold running water and remove the stems. In a dry skillet over low heat, toast the pine nuts for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. In a food processor, combine the grated parmesan, sorrel leaves, garlic, and salt. Blend until smooth, then gradually add the toasted pine nuts while blending. With the processor running, drizzle in the olive oil and lemon juice until the mixture is well combined. Transfer the pesto to a jar and store it in the refrigerator. It can also be frozen in ice cube trays for future use.

2. Poach the eggs: In a small saucepan, bring water to a gentle simmer and add the white vinegar. Crack one egg into a ramekin. Stir the water to create a gentle whirlpool and carefully slide the egg into the center. Use a spatula to gently nudge the egg off the bottom of the pan and allow it to cook for 3-4 minutes. Once cooked, remove the egg with a slotted spoon and transfer to a plate. Repeat with the remaining eggs.

3. If using pre-baked breads, follow package instructions to heat them. For fresh bread, slice the loaves in half, remove the interior, and grill them under the broiler until golden brown. Allow to cool slightly once done.

4. Assemble the sandwiches: Slice the beefsteak tomato thinly. In a small bowl, mix arugula with vinaigrette dressing. Spread a layer of sorrel pesto on the cut side of each bread half. Layer with arugula, tomato slices, and top each portion with a poached egg. Add a dollop of sorrel pesto on top of the eggs, and cap with the other half of the bread.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of Pesto Sorrel Sandwiches with Poached Eggs, arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to emphasize the rich green tones of the sorrel pesto and arugula, contrasting with the toasted square breads and the deep red of the beefsteak tomato. Garnish with toasted pine nuts and grated parmesan for added texture. Employ a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, directing focus on the glossy poached eggs, creating a fresh, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Provencal Olive Rillettes Pan Bagnat
ingredients: 250 grams assorted small vegetables (such as tomatoes, bell peppers, and zucchini), sliced
directions: Step 1: Slice the assorted vegetables into thin rounds and marinate them in olive oil for one hour.
Step 2: Cook the bulgur according to package instructions until tender, then fluff with a fork.
Step 3: Slice the olives and chop the preserved lemons.
Step 4: Split the pan bagnat bread in half horizontally. Spread pork rillettes evenly on both halves of the bread.
Step 5: Layer the marinated vegetables and cooked bulgur onto one half of the bread, followed by the sliced olives and chopped preserved lemons.
Step 6: Close the sandwich by placing the other half of the bread on top and press down gently.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich with Jules Destrooper Butter Wafers and Grilled Turkey
ingredients: 2 tomatoes, peeled and quartered, seeds removed
directions: Step 1: Peel the tomatoes and cut them into quarters. Remove the seeds and set them aside.

Step 2: Slice the turkey breast into thin pieces. Brush the slices with meat marinade and season with barbecue spices. Grill briefly over high heat, adding a handful of olive pits to the coals to infuse the meat with flavor.
Step 3: In a small bowl, mix the mayonnaise with the white balsamic vinegar and stir in the chopped basil.

Step 4: Assemble the club sandwich by placing one Butter Wafer on a plate, followed by a layer of arugula, a quarter of tomato, a dollop of the basil mayonnaise, and a slice of grilled turkey. Top with another Butter Wafer and repeat the process until the ingredients are used up.
Step 5: Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Turkey and Bacon Sandwich
directions: 1. Place a few layers of paper towels on a plate. Arrange several slices of bacon on top, then cover with another layer of paper towels. Continue layering the bacon and paper towels until all the bacon is on the plate. Microwave on high for about 4 minutes or until crispy.
2. Toast the sandwich bread slices and spread 2 tablespoons of mayonnaise on two of the slices. Top the mayonnaise with the julienned lettuce.
3. Heat the cooking oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the smoked turkey slices and sauté until warmed through. Layer the turkey on top of the prepared sandwich base.
4. Distribute the crispy bacon and melted low-fat cheese evenly atop the turkey. Finish by placing the remaining slices of bread on top to close the sandwiches.
5. Serve the sandwiches immediately while they are warm.

recipes.name: Smoked Haddock Bagel with Tangy Lemon-Balsamic Cream and Fol Epi
directions: 1. Slice the Fol Epi cheese into thin strips. In a bowl, combine 4 to 5 tablespoons of crème fraîche, the lemon juice, and the balsamic vinegar. Season the mixture with salt and pepper, adjusting to taste.
2. Cut each bagel in half horizontally. Spread a layer of the tangy cream mixture on both halves of the bagel.
3. On the bottom half of each bagel, place a few strips of Fol Epi cheese followed by a slice of smoked haddock. Top with the other half of the bagel.
4. For an extra touch, consider adding a handful of fresh salad greens to the bagel before closing it.
5. Note: You can substitute the smoked haddock with smoked salmon or smoked trout for a variation.

recipes.name: Curry Chicken Wraps with Bresse Bleu and Grilled Vegetables
ingredients: 200 grams Bresse Bleu cheese, cut into small pieces
4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips
directions: Step 1: Peel, clean, and finely chop the red and yellow bell peppers. Wash and slice the zucchini into half-moons.
Step 2: Cut the chicken breasts into strips. In a skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat, then add the chopped bell peppers and sauté for 6 to 8 minutes.
Step 3: Add the chicken strips and zucchini to the skillet, increase the heat slightly, and allow to cook for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring regularly until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 4: Stir in the curry powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for an additional 2 minutes over high heat, mixing well.
Step 5: Lay out the wrap tortillas on a clean surface. Distribute the hot filling evenly in the center of each tortilla, topping with pieces of Bresse Bleu.
Step 6: Immediately roll up the tortillas to create wraps. Serve hot, allowing the Bresse Bleu to melt gently upon contact with the filling.

Incorporate a side of dipping sauce in a small bowl, and use a blurred green background to evoke a fresh, summery mood. recipes.name: Beef Naans
ingredients: 1 teaspoon active dry yeast (dissolved in 5 cl of water)
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and baking powder to create the dry mixture.
Step 2: Add the plain yogurt and the dissolved yeast mixture to the dry ingredients. Mix until a sandy texture forms.
Step 3: Gradually add the warm water while kneading, until the dough becomes smooth and elastic, resembling pizza dough.
Step 4: Cover the dough with a kitchen towel and let it rise at room temperature for about 2 hours, or until it doubles in size.
Step 5: While the dough is rising, prepare the filling: brown the ground beef in a skillet over medium heat.
Step 6: Add the chopped shallot and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened. Moisten with water or broth to prevent sticking.
Step 7: Stir in the garam masala, curry powder, salt, pepper, and fresh herbs; set aside the filling to cool.
Step 8: Divide the risen dough into 4 to 8 pieces depending on desired naan size. Roll each piece on a floured surface into a disc about 2-3 mm thick.
Step 9: Place some filling in the center of one disc, and if desired, add cheese. Cover with another disc of dough.
Step 10: Seal the edges of the dough discs together and trim any excess dough.
Step 11: Place the prepared naans onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Preheat the oven to its highest setting (around 250°C or 482°F).
Step 12: Bake the naans for 5-8 minutes, observing closely as they puff and develop brown spots. Avoid overcooking to prevent bursting.
Step 13: Once baked, remove from the oven and serve warm.

Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the golden browns and rich reds of the spices. recipes.name: Salmon, Avocado, and Mango Spring Rolls
ingredients: 1/2 ripe mango, peeled and cut into matchsticks
2 salmon fillets, steamed, cooled, and roughly chopped
1 ripe avocado, peeled and cut into matchsticks
2 medium carrots, peeled and cut into matchsticks
150 grams rice vermicelli, cooked according to package instructions
3 large leaves of butter lettuce, torn into pieces
A handful of fresh cilantro leaves, washed and chopped
directions: 1. Steam the salmon fillets for 10 minutes until cooked through. Let them cool, then roughly chop with a knife.

2. Peel and wash the carrots, then use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons. Cut the ribbons into thin matchsticks. Peel the mango, slice it thinly, and cut into matchsticks. Peel the avocado and repeat the matchstick process, then drizzle with lemon juice to prevent browning. Wash the lettuce leaves and roughly chop them.
3. Place the rice vermicelli in a bowl and cover with boiling water. Let it sit covered for 4 minutes, then drain and rinse under cold water. Set aside.

4. Soak a rice paper wrapper in warm water until soft. Lay it flat on a clean, damp dish towel. In the center, place a tablespoon of chopped salmon, a few matchsticks of avocado, mango, and carrot, a small handful of rice vermicelli, and a few pieces of lettuce. Fold the top of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll tightly to form a spring roll. Repeat until all ingredients are used, and refrigerate before serving.
5. To prepare the sauce: Peel and mince the garlic, then combine it with all sauce ingredients in a bowl. Mix well and add cilantro at the end. Serve the spring rolls with the dipping sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of Salmon, Avocado, and Mango Spring Rolls artfully arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light to enhance the fresh colors of the ingredients, highlighting the glossy textures of the salmon and avocado. Incorporate a soft-focus background with a light linen cloth and a small bowl of lemon dipping sauce. Garnish with edible flowers and fresh herbs for a touch of elegance, ensuring the depth of field draws attention to the rolls while softly blurring the background.

scenes.voice_over: Next, peel and cut your carrots, mango, and avocado into thin matchsticks. Drizzle avocado with lemon juice to prevent browning.

scenes.voice_over: Place the rice vermicelli in a bowl of boiling water. Cover it and let it sit for 4 minutes, then drain and rinse with cold water.

scenes.voice_over: Soak a rice paper wrapper in warm water until soft. Place salmon, avocado, mango, carrots, vermicelli, and lettuce in the center. Fold and roll tightly.

scenes.voice_over: For the sauce, combine fish sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, cilantro, soy sauce, and water in a bowl. Mix well until combined.

scenes.voice_over: Refrigerate the spring rolls briefly, then serve with the dipping sauce. Enjoy these fresh and vibrant flavors!

cooking_tips: Ensure the rice paper wrappers are fully softened before using.
Feel free to customize the fillings with your favorite vegetables or proteins.

recipes.name: Fresh Knacki® Hot Dogs
ingredients: 2 medium red radishes, washed and sliced into rounds
1 medium Paris mushroom, cleaned and sliced thinly
½ Granny Smith apple, washed and cut into matchsticks
2/3 of a French baguette, sliced lengthwise
directions: 1. Preheat your oven to 200°C (th. 6/7).

2. Wash and slice the radishes into rounds, slice the Paris mushroom thinly, and cut the Granny Smith apple into matchsticks. Lightly lemon juice the apple sticks to prevent browning. Peel and finely chop the shallot, and chop the parsley.
3. In a small mixing bowl, combine the mascarpone, mustard, chopped shallot, parsley, and honey, and mix well.
4. Open the baguette slices lengthwise and place them in the oven for 5 minutes to warm.
5. Fill the warmed baguette with the prepared sauce and the Knacki® sausages, which have been heated in the microwave. Top with the sliced mushrooms, apple matchsticks, and radishes.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, high-quality image of Fresh Knacki® Hot Dogs, styled on a rustic wooden board. Arrange the two sausages artfully alongside thinly sliced radishes, delicate Paris mushrooms, and matchstick Granny Smith apple for color contrast. Drizzle with honey and mustard, and sprinkle chopped parsley for freshness. Use natural light to accentuate textures and create soft shadows. Shoot from a low angle to emphasize the layers, with a shallow depth of field focusing on the sausages, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Stuffed Mozzarella Beef Burger with Bell Pepper Sauce
ingredients: 1 large or 2 small red bell peppers, sliced
1 large or 2 small yellow bell peppers, sliced
1 medium red onion, diced (reserve some for toppings)
1 ball of fresh mozzarella cheese, sliced
Few drops of Tabasco sauce, to taste
directions: Step 1: Prepare the bell pepper sauce by slicing the red and yellow bell peppers. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, add the sliced peppers, and cook until softened. Stir in the diced tomatoes and let simmer. Season with basil, salt, and black pepper to taste. Blend the mixture if you prefer a smooth sauce. Set aside.

Step 2: In a bowl, combine the ground beef with the egg yolks, chopped basil, diced red onion, and grated Parmesan cheese. Mix well to incorporate all ingredients evenly. Season with salt and black pepper according to your preference.
Step 3: Form the beef mixture into balls weighing approximately 125 grams each. Flatten each ball into a patty shape.
Step 4: Place sliced mozzarella on top of half of the patties. Cover with the other half, sealing the edges to encase the cheese inside.
Step 5: Cook the patties in a skillet over medium heat until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side.
Step 6: For the burger assembly, slice the hamburger buns in half. Lightly toast the inside of the buns in a skillet with a little olive oil until golden.

Step 7: Spread a layer of the bell pepper sauce on the bottom half of each bun, add a beef patty, top with reserved diced red onions, and finish with more bell pepper sauce before placing the top half of the bun on.
Step 8: Optional: Bake the assembled burgers in an oven at 180°C (350°F) for 5 minutes to heat thoroughly. Serve with a side salad or fries.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Stuffed Mozzarella Beef Burger with Bell Pepper Sauce, styled on a rustic wooden table. Use a shallow depth of field to focus on the juicy burger, showcasing melted mozzarella and colorful bell pepper sauce draping over the sides. Surround with fresh basil leaves and diced tomatoes for added texture. Soft, natural light from a nearby window should accentuate the burger's glistening surface, while a subtle, blurred background enhances the dish's allure. Include a side of crispy fries for balance.

recipes.name: Shrimp and Zucchini Wasabi Sandwich
ingredients: 20 large pink shrimp, peeled and deveined
A few sprigs of fresh dill
directions: Step 1: Wash and peel the zucchinis. Slice them into thin rounds.
Step 2: Heat 1 teaspoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Grill the zucchini slices until tender and slightly charred, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Step 3: In the same skillet, add another teaspoon of olive oil and grill the shrimp until they are pink and opaque, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Step 4: In a mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and wasabi paste. Add finely chopped dill, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 5: Toast the slices of rye bread until golden brown.
Step 6: Spread the wasabi cream cheese mixture on each slice of toasted bread. Layer the grilled zucchini slices and shrimp on top of the mixture. Close the sandwiches.
Step 7: Optionally, grill the assembled sandwiches in a skillet for an additional 2-3 minutes on each side to heat through and create a crispy exterior.
Step 8: Serve warm and enjoy!

Use soft, natural lighting to highlight the creamy texture of the cream cheese and the freshness of the zucchini, while a shallow depth of field blurs the background, drawing attention to the dish. Garnish with dill sprigs, a small bowl of wasabi paste, and a sprinkle of salt and pepper for added visual interest. Aim for a slightly elevated angle to emphasize the layers and colors, creating an inviting, fresh mood.

recipes.name: Eggplant, Smoked Ham, Feta, and Brown Sauce Bagels
ingredients: 4 bagels with shallot flavor, sliced in half
1 red bell pepper, sliced into thin strips
1 eggplant (Rania variety), sliced into thin rounds
Several fresh mint leaves, for garnish
Black pepper, freshly ground, to taste
directions: Step 1: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add sliced shallots and sauté until they turn golden brown, approximately 5 minutes.
Step 2: Add the sliced eggplant to the skillet and continue to sauté until the eggplant is tender and slightly browned, about 8-10 minutes.
Step 3: Stir in the brown sauce and let it simmer covered on low heat for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Step 4: While the mixture is simmering, toast the bagel halves in a toaster until golden and crisp.

Step 5: Assemble the bagels by lightly drizzling olive oil on the cut sides, layering a slice of smoked ham, followed by a generous scoop of the eggplant and shallot mixture, crumbled feta cheese, and strips of red bell pepper.
Step 6: Top each bagel with fresh mint leaves and a sprinkle of freshly ground black pepper before serving.

Use natural light to emphasize the rich textures of the crumbled feta and smoky ham, while the glossy olive oil and brown sauce add depth. Incorporate scattered fresh mint leaves and thin strips of red bell pepper for pops of color. Select a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, creating a warm, inviting mood that draws attention to the dish's details.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich with Bacon, Ham, and Egg
ingredients: 3 slices of slightly toasted sandwich bread
2 leaves of lettuce, washed and dried
2 slices of quality Italian ham (preferably Grand Biscotto chorizo)
directions: Step 1: Cut the boiled egg into 6 slices and dice the tomato after removing the seeds.
Step 2: Shred the lettuce and mix it with mayonnaise. Divide all ingredients into two equal parts.

Step 3: Place half of the lettuce-mayonnaise mixture on the first slice of bread. Add the slices of ham, followed by the diced tomatoes. Season the tomatoes with salt and pepper, then add the egg slices.
Step 4: Top with another slice of toasted bread and repeat the layering for the second level. Finish with the final slice of bread and remove crusts if desired.
Step 5: Optionally, crisp the bacon in a dry skillet or under the oven grill until golden.
Step 6: Serve immediately alongside chips.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant club sandwich with bacon, ham, and egg, stacked high on a rustic wooden board. Use diffused natural light to enhance the textures of the toasted bread and glistening mayonnaise. Style with fresh lettuce leaves and diced tomatoes spilling from the sides. Incorporate a vintage knife and fork beside the sandwich for added interest. Use a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, focusing sharply on the sandwich’s layers, evoking a cozy, inviting mood perfect for a brunch setting.

recipes.name: Swedish Mini Sandwiches with Smoked Trout
ingredients: 120 grams smoked trout or organic smoked salmon
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the crème fraîche and chopped dill. Season with a pinch of sea salt and a few turns of freshly ground black pepper. Mix well, then refrigerate until needed.
Step 2: Using a 4 to 5 cm round cutter, cut out circles from each piece of Swedish bread. You should be able to make 20 rounds. Then, use the same cutter to cut 10 rounds from the smoked trout.

Step 3: On 10 rounds of bread, spread a layer of the dill crème fraîche. Top with a slice of cucumber, a round of smoked trout, and another cucumber slice. Add a little more crème fraîche on top and finish with another round of bread.
Step 4: Repeat the assembly for another set of 10 rounds, following the same layering process.
Step 5: If using, sprinkle a pinch of dried edible flowers on top of the finished sandwiches and secure each with a toothpick.
Step 6: Arrange the mini sandwiches on a beautiful serving plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to serve.

video_script.title: Delicious Swedish Mini Sandwiches with Smoked Trout

recipes.name: Summer Sandwich with Sbrinz AOP, Apricot Chutney, Pistachios, and Prosciutto
ingredients: 6 small milk brioche baguettes, split in half
300 g fresh or frozen apricots, halved and pitted
directions: Step 1: In a saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the coarsely chopped onion and brown sugar; sauté until the onion is translucent.

Step 2: Add the halved apricots to the saucepan and stir to combine. In a separate pot, combine the white vinegar, balsamic vinegar, ginger, curry powder, paprika, ground cinnamon, and coarse salt. Heat until warm.
Step 3: Pour the vinegar mixture over the apricot mixture in the saucepan. Stir well to combine.
Step 4: Reduce the heat to low and simmer the chutney uncovered for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Add water as needed to adjust the consistency.
Step 5: Once cooked, allow the chutney to cool. Store it in a jar with a tight lid, turning the jar upside down until completely cool.

Step 6: To assemble the sandwich, slice each baguette in half. Spread a thin layer of chutney on one side, layer with prosciutto, sprinkle with chopped coriander and pistachios, and top with grated Sbrinz AOP cheese. Close the sandwich and serve.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant summer sandwich featuring layers of Sbrinz AOP cheese, prosciutto, and apricot chutney nestled in split milk brioche baguettes. Use natural light to enhance the rich textures and colors, placing the sandwich on a rustic wooden board. Incorporate fresh apricot halves and scattered pistachios for added color and interest. Utilize a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, drawing focus to the sandwich. Aim for a slightly elevated angle to showcase the layers and garnishes while creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Tuna and Ham Sandwich
ingredients: 1 cup diced ham or 1 cup chopped ham
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to a low setting, around 275°F (135°C).
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the drained tuna, diced ham, and heavy cream. Mix thoroughly until well combined.
Step 3: Take one half of a hamburger bun and spread the tuna and ham mixture evenly on top. Sprinkle grated Gruyère cheese generously over the mixture.
Step 4: Place the other half of the hamburger bun on top to form a sandwich.
Step 5: Place the sandwich in the preheated oven and heat gently, ensuring the bread does not harden. Heat for about 5-7 minutes or until warm.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Tuna and Ham Sandwich featuring a golden-brown toasted hamburger bun, overflowing with creamy tuna mixed with diced ham and Gruyère cheese. Use diffused natural light to highlight the textures of the ingredients, casting soft shadows. Style the sandwich on a rustic wooden board, accompanied by fresh herbs and a small bowl of pickles. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to emphasize layers, using a shallow depth of field to blur the background, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Salmon Burger with Guérande Sea Salt
ingredients: 800 g salmon fillets, skinless, diced small
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Fleur de sel de Guérande, for seasoning
200 g fresh cheese with garlic and herbs
Fresh parsley, tarragon, and chives, chopped
directions: Step 1: Prepare the salmon tartare by dicing the salmon fillets into small cubes. Grate the shallot and dice a quarter of the yellow bell pepper, removing the seeds. Mix them into the salmon tartare, add a few drops of nuoc-mâm, season with freshly ground black pepper, and let it rest for 15 minutes at room temperature. For an exotic flavor, consider adding a teaspoon of turmeric.

Step 2: Create a bed of coarse Guérande sea salt approximately 1 cm thick on a baking sheet and press it down firmly. Preheat the oven to 150°C (302°F). Divide the salmon tartare into 4 portions and shape them into firm patties. Place each salmon patty on the warmed bed of coarse Guérande sea salt in the preheated oven and bake for 10 to 15 minutes. Check for doneness by observing the inside of the patties without flipping them.

Step 3: Finely chop the basil leaves and mix them with your preferred mayonnaise. Peel the avocado and slice it thinly, then drizzle with lemon juice to prevent browning. Slice the beef heart tomato into thick slices. Open each burger bun and place them in the oven, cut side down, for 5 minutes to toast them. Assemble your burgers with the prepared ingredients.

Step 4: For the stuffed mini bell peppers, cut off the tops and remove the seeds. Chop the herbs and mix them with the fresh cheese, adding a teaspoon of fleur de sel de Guérande. Fill each mini pepper with this mixture. You can serve them fresh after letting them sit for an hour, or bake them covered with coarse Guérande sea salt in the preheated oven at 150°C (302°F) for 45 minutes to 1 hour. Your burgers can be cooked directly on top of this salt bed!

Arrange the burger with layers of bright yellow bell pepper, ripe avocado, and a slice of juicy beef heart tomato, topped with fresh basil. recipes.name: Oriental Inspired Chicken Sandwich
ingredients: 1 package of flatbread (for one generously filled sandwich)
A few leaves of Romaine lettuce, washed and sliced
1 can of artichokes, drained and chopped
1 can of roasted bell peppers, drained and sliced
1 serving of plain Greek yogurt or tartar sauce
directions: Step 1: Wash the Romaine lettuce thoroughly and slice it into thin strips. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on each flatbread.
Step 2: Evenly distribute the sliced Romaine, followed by the chopped roasted bell peppers and artichokes on each flatbread. Top with sliced cooked chicken breast.

Step 3: To prepare Sauce 1, mix the toasted coriander seeds and cumin seeds with olive oil in a bowl. Crush the feta cheese and fold it into the seed mixture. Add in the toasted pine nuts and season with salt and pepper.
Step 4: For Sauce 2, in a separate bowl, season the Greek yogurt with salt and pepper. Add finely chopped mint and chives, and finish with a drizzle of olive oil.
Step 5: Serve the sandwiches rolled up with the sauce of your choice on the side, or for a delightful mix, provide both sauces.

Utilize soft, diffused natural light to enhance the textures of the toasted flatbread and colorful fillings. Arrange the sandwich at a slight angle, showcasing the layers of sliced chicken, artichokes, roasted bell peppers, and crumbled feta. Incorporate fresh romaine leaves peeking from the sides and sprinkle toasted pine nuts around the plate. Use a shallow depth of field to create a dreamy background, focusing on the sandwich as the main highlight, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Turkey, Bacon, Reblochon, and Cranberry Sandwich
ingredients: 3 slices of bacon, cooked until crispy
100 grams turkey escalope, cooked and sliced
150 grams whole grain bread, halved lengthwise
directions: Step 1: Cut the whole grain bread in half lengthwise.
Step 2: Spread mascarpone cheese evenly on both cut sides of the bread.
Step 3: In a skillet, cook the bacon slices for 5 minutes on each side until crispy. Set aside on paper towels to drain.
Step 4: In the same skillet, cook the turkey escalope with a drizzle of olive oil for 3 minutes on each side until cooked through. Set aside and slice into strips.
Step 5: Remove the rind from the Reblochon cheese and cut it into small cubes.
Step 6: Assemble the sandwich by layering turkey strips, diced Reblochon, and dried cranberries on one slice of the bread.
Step 7: Top with crispy bacon and place the other slice of bread on top.
Step 8: Toast the sandwich in the skillet or a sandwich press for a few minutes until golden and the cheese is melted.

Use natural light to accentuate the crispy bacon and creamy Mascarpone, creating shadows that enhance texture. Style with a side of dried cranberries and a sprig of rosemary for garnish. recipes.name: Mediterranean Style Burger
ingredients: 80 g Corsican sheep's cheese (tome de brebis), sliced
directions: Step 1: Wash and slice the zucchinis using a knife or mandoline into varying thicknesses: one into thin slices (approximately 1 mm) and the other into thicker rounds (approximately 3 mm). Reserve the thinner slices on paper towels.
Step 2: In a skillet, heat a little olive oil over medium heat. Add the oregano and the thicker zucchini rounds. Season with salt and pepper, and cook until golden brown.
Step 3: Using a knife or vegetable peeler, cut slices of Corsican sheep's cheese and set aside.
Step 4: Wash the cherry tomatoes and cut them in half or into thirds, depending on the size of the buns.
Step 5: Grill the barbecue beef patties on the barbecue until cooked to your preference.

Step 6: To assemble the burger: Starting with the bottom bun, layer the raw zucchini slices (approximately 2 mm thick), followed by the sliced Corsican sheep's cheese (approximately 4 mm thick). Add the cooked zucchini rounds on top in a slightly thicker layer than the raw ones. Place a grilled beef patty on top, add some raw zucchini slices, and finally, top with the halved cherry tomatoes. Close the burger with the top bun and serve immediately.

Shoot from a 45-degree angle, focusing sharply on the burger while allowing the background to gently blur, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Blueberry and Goat Cheese Croque
ingredients: 1 raw beetroot, peeled and thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Peel the raw beetroot and slice it into thin rounds using a mandoline or a sharp knife.
Step 2: Cut thick slices of the whole grain bread and lightly toast them until golden.
Step 3: Spread a generous layer of fresh goat cheese on one slice of toasted bread, followed by a spoonful of blueberry compote. Top with another slice of bread and cut the sandwich in half.
Step 4: In a small bowl, combine the walnut oil and balsamic vinegar to create a dressing.

Step 5: Serve the sandwich with the sliced beetroot on the side and drizzle the dressing over the top. Optionally, add beetroot directly into the sandwich with a drizzle of the dressing before closing it.

Use natural light to highlight the vibrant colors of the blueberry compote and the creamy goat cheese, casting gentle shadows to enhance texture. Incorporate thinly sliced raw beetroot artfully around the croque for contrast. Style with a small bowl of walnut oil and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar nearby. Use a shallow depth of field to create a soft blur in the background, emphasizing the dish as the focal point, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Bagel Recipe
ingredients: 250 grams canned whole peeled tomatoes in juice
150 grams cream cheese (e.g., St Môret), softened
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 210°C (thermostat 7).
Step 2: Slice the bagels in half and toast them until golden brown.
Step 3: Generously spread cream cheese on the cut side of each bagel half.
Step 4: Sprinkle chopped dill evenly over the cream cheese.
Step 5: Distribute the canned tomatoes (with juice) evenly on the bottom halves of the bagels.
Step 6: Season with salt and black pepper to taste, then add thinly sliced red onions.
Step 7: Top each with a slice of smoked salmon.
Step 8: Cover with the top halves of the bagels and place them in the oven for approximately 15 minutes.
Step 9: Serve warm and enjoy your smoked salmon bagels.

Incorporate fresh dill and thinly sliced red onions as vibrant garnishes, and place a small bowl of canned whole peeled tomatoes nearby for color contrast. recipes.name: Princess Amandine® Potato Millefeuille with Serrano Ham and Sheep's Milk Cheese
ingredients: 2 tablespoons fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped, for garnish
1 tablespoon coarse sea salt, for seasoning
directions: Step 1: Cook the unpeeled Princess Amandine® potatoes in salted cold water for 20 minutes. Drain and let cool.
Step 2: Peel the cooled potatoes and slice them horizontally into 3mm thick slices.
Step 3: On each potato slice, place a layer of Serrano ham followed by a layer of Manchego cheese.
Step 4: Stack the potato slices to form a millefeuille, then cut into bite-sized pieces.
Step 5: Brush the assembled millefeuille with olive oil and season with freshly ground black pepper.
Step 6: Place the millefeuille bites in a preheated oven at 150°C for 5 to 6 minutes until warmed through.
Step 7: Serve the bites skewered with a toothpick, garnished with a sprig of chopped flat-leaf parsley.

Place the dish on a rustic wooden board, garnished with chopped parsley and a sprinkle of coarse sea salt. recipes.name: Tuna, Fresh Cheese, and Zucchini Club Sandwiches
ingredients: 1 large can of tuna in water, drained
100 grams fresh cheese, such as cream cheese or ricotta
directions: Step 1: In a food processor, finely chop the onion and zucchini slices.
Step 2: Add the drained tuna and fresh cheese to the food processor. Pulse until combined, but leave some texture. Season with salt and black pepper accordingly.
Step 3: Lay out 4 slices of toasted sandwich bread. Evenly spread the tuna and cheese mixture over each slice.
Step 4: Top each slice with thinly sliced zucchini, and then place another slice of toasted bread on top.
Step 5: Using a sharp knife, cut each sandwich into two triangles to serve.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Polenta Patties Styled as Hamburgers
ingredients: 6 thick slices of eggplant (approximately 1 cm each)
1 tablespoon olive oil (for boiling and sautéing)
directions: Step 1: In a pot, bring 1 liter of water to a boil. Once boiling, stir in 1 tablespoon of olive oil, dried herbs de Provence, salt, and pepper.
Step 2: Gradually add 250 grams of pre-cooked polenta into the boiling water while stirring continuously for a few minutes until the mixture thickens.
Step 3: Spread the thickened polenta evenly in a lightly greased dish to a thickness of about 1 cm and allow it to cool completely.
Step 4: In a skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions, sugar, salt, and pepper. Sauté until the onions are golden and caramelized.
Step 5: In another skillet, cook the 6 slices of eggplant with a drizzle of olive oil and 100 ml of water. Once the water evaporates, season with salt and pepper, and allow the eggplant to brown.
Step 6: Once the polenta has cooled, use a cookie cutter to cut out 12 patties from the polenta slab. In a pan, gently fry the patties in a bit of olive oil until golden on both sides.
Step 7: Assemble the burgers by placing a slice of eggplant between two polenta patties. Top with caramelized onion rings. Serve with a side of green salad.

Use warm, diffused natural light to enhance the rich colors and textures of the patties. Position the dish on a rustic wooden board, adorned with fresh herbs for garnish. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the layers, employing a shallow depth of field to blur the background, creating a cozy, inviting mood that draws attention to the delicious details.

recipes.name: Royal Chicken Club Sandwich
ingredients: 150 grams chicken breast, cooked and sliced
12 slices white sandwich bread, crust removed
8 sweet and sour pickles, sliced lengthwise
4 pinches fleur de sel, to taste
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 150°C (300°F).

Step 2: In a hot skillet, melt a small amount of margarine. Add the chicken breast and season with fleur de sel and freshly ground black pepper. Cook over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes, turning regularly until golden brown. Remove from the skillet, let it cool, and slice thinly into 5 mm pieces.
Step 3: In a pot of boiling salted water, gently add the eggs and cook for 9 minutes. Remove the eggs and place them in cold water. Once cooled, peel and slice them thinly.

Step 4: Peel the tomatoes and slice them into thin half-moons. Shred the iceberg lettuce and slice the pickles lengthwise. Remove the crusts from the sandwich bread and toast one side of each slice under the oven broiler.

Step 5: Assemble the club sandwich by first spreading Dijon mayonnaise on one toasted side of a slice of bread. Layer with a portion of tomato slices, followed by the egg slices, chicken pieces, pickles, and shredded lettuce.
Step 6: Top with another slice of bread that has been spread with Dijon mayonnaise, and repeat the layering with additional toppings. Finish with a final slice of bread spread with mayonnaise.
Step 7: Secure each sandwich with wooden picks and cut them into halves or quarters to serve.

Use soft, diffused natural light to accentuate the textures of the bread and the gloss of the mayonnaise. Incorporate a blurred background of fresh herbs and a vintage knife beside the sandwich, adding depth. recipes.name: Savory Poppy Seed and Smoked Salmon Sandwiches
ingredients: 50 g grated cheese (such as Gruyère or Emmental)
directions: 1. Prepare the dough: In a mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, grated cheese, lemon zest, and poppy seeds. Mix well.
2. Add the pinch of salt, almond flour, and all-purpose flour to the mixture. Stir until a dough forms.
3. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 5 mm (1/4 inch). Use a cookie cutter to cut out shapes.
4. Place the cutouts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake in a preheated oven at 170°C (340°F) for 15 minutes or until lightly golden. Remove from the oven and let cool.
5. Prepare the filling: In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, fresh cream, lemon zest, and poppy seeds until smooth and well combined.
6. To assemble the sandwiches: Spread a layer of the cream cheese mixture on half of the baked cookies. Top each with a slice of smoked salmon, then place another cookie on top to form a sandwich.

Use natural light to accentuate the buttery sheen of the sandwiches and the vibrant colors of the smoked salmon. Incorporate a soft-focus background with fresh herbs and lemon slices for contrast. Add a sprinkle of poppy seeds on top for texture, and choose a shallow depth of field to create an inviting, warm mood that draws the viewer's eye to the luscious filling and golden crust.

scenes.image_prompt: A flat lay of the ingredients needed for the recipe, arranged neatly with labels for each one.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding a pinch of salt, almond flour, and all-purpose flour into the mixing bowl, with hands mixing it together.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add a pinch of salt, 50 grams of almond flour, and 200 grams of all-purpose flour into the mixture. Stir until a dough forms.

scenes.image_prompt: Rolling out the dough on a lightly floured surface with a rolling pin, showing the dough being flattened.
scenes.voice_over: Roll out the dough on a lightly floured surface to about 5 millimeters thickness. Use a cookie cutter to cut out shapes.

scenes.voice_over: Place the cutouts on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 170 degrees Celsius for 15 minutes, or until lightly golden. Let them cool.

scenes.image_prompt: A small bowl with cream cheese mixture being whisked together, showing smooth texture.
scenes.voice_over: In a small bowl, combine 200 grams of cream cheese, 40 milliliters of fresh cream, lemon zest, and 1 tablespoon of poppy seeds. Mix until smooth.

scenes.image_prompt: Spreading the cream cheese mixture on a baked cookie, topped with a slice of smoked salmon.
scenes.voice_over: Spread a layer of the cream cheese mixture on half of the baked cookies. Top with a slice of smoked salmon, then sandwich with another cookie.

recipes.name: Chicken Bagels with Fresh Vegetables and Herb Cream Cheese Sauce
ingredients: 8 slices of Le Bon Poulet® HERTA® Nature Chicken Fillet
10 sprigs of fresh coriander, finely chopped
directions: 1. Finely chop the chives and coriander, and finely chop the shallot. Slice the radishes thinly and grate the carrot.
2. In a bowl, mix together the cream cheese, honey, apple cider vinegar, olive oil, chopped herbs, and paprika. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F). Place the bagel halves on a baking tray and warm them in the oven for 3 to 4 minutes or use a toaster.

4. Spread a layer of the cream cheese sauce on the bottom half of each bagel. Add shredded lettuce, radish slices, grated carrot, and a slice of red onion. Add another layer of the sauce followed by two slices of chicken fillet, a drizzle of sauce, and finish with a few leaves of lettuce. Close the bagel with the top half.
5. Repeat the assembly for the remaining bagels and serve immediately.
6. Culinary tip: For an extra touch, add a few slices of goat cheese.
recipes.image_prompt: Arrange the Chicken Bagels on a rustic wooden board, showcasing the vibrant colors of fresh vegetables. Use natural light from the side to enhance textures, casting soft shadows. Elevate the bagels slightly to create depth, focusing on the creamy herb sauce spilling over. Incorporate a few scattered radish slices and chives for contrast. Capture the shot at a 45-degree angle, with a shallow depth of field to blur the background, ensuring the vibrant colors and textures of the dish are the focal point. Aim for a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Roast Beef Baguette
ingredients: 500 grams cooked roast beef, thinly sliced
directions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped hard-boiled egg, minced garlic, grated carrot, chopped parsley, mustard, lemon juice, hot water, pepper sauce, and salt. Mix well.
2. Gradually add the extra virgin olive oil to the mixture and blend until smooth and homogeneous.
3. Slice the baguette in half lengthwise and spread the prepared sauce evenly on both halves.
4. Layer the thinly sliced roast beef, onion rings, and lettuce leaves on one half of the baguette.
5. Close the baguette and cut it into 4 equal parts for serving.

Use soft, diffused natural light to emphasize the textures of the crusty baguette and the glossy olive oil. Style the scene with rustic wooden boards and a few scattered pepper sauce drops for a pop of color. Incorporate a small bowl of mustard and a hard-boiled egg on the side for added interest. Use a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the baguette while softly blurring the background, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Curry Chicken Tortilla Wraps
ingredients: 1 packet (200g) corn tortilla dough (Ma pâte à Tortilla de maïs Francine)
70 grams kale, stems removed and chopped
directions: 1. Prepare the corn tortillas according to the package instructions.

2. In a saucepan, heat 500ml of water with the crumbled vegetable broth cube. Add the diced chicken and poach at a gentle simmer for 10 to 15 minutes, depending on the chicken size. Drain and shred the chicken using a fork. Set it aside in a bowl.
3. Rinse and dry the kale, remove the central stem, and chop it. Sauté in a pan with olive oil for 5 minutes, then let it cool.
4. Rinse the tomatoes, cut them in half, remove the seeds, and dice them into 5mm cubes.

5. In a mixing bowl, whisk the cream cheese to soften it, then add the curry powder, the finely chopped red onion, chopped coriander, chopped chives, roughly chopped golden raisins, and toasted pine nuts. Stir well to combine.
6. Finally, add the shredded chicken, sautéed kale, and diced tomatoes to the mixture. Season with salt and pepper, and mix thoroughly.

7. To assemble, place a tortilla flat on a clean surface. Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons of the filling near the outer edge of the tortilla, forming a line. Roll the tortilla tightly around the filling. Trim the ends if necessary. Secure with string or skewers and serve with a salad.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of Curry Chicken Tortilla Wraps, artfully arranged on a rustic wooden board. The wraps, filled with a colorful mix of golden curry-infused chicken, green tomatoes, and kale, should be cut in half to reveal their enticing filling. Use natural light to accentuate the creamy texture of the cream cheese and the vibrant colors of the ingredients. Incorporate fresh herbs and scattered golden raisins as garnishes. A blurred background of soft, earthy tones enhances the warm, inviting mood. Use a shallow depth of field to keep the focus on the wraps, creating an appealing contrast with the textured board.

recipes.name: Hot Beef Sandwich
directions: Step 1: In a skillet, heat the margarine over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and sauté for 2 minutes until they soften.
Step 2: Stir in the minced garlic and beef strips. Cook, stirring often, until the beef is fully cooked and browned.
Step 3: Remove the mixture from the heat and distribute the beef and onion mixture among the sandwich rolls.
Step 4: In the same skillet, add the sour cream, chopped tomatoes, mustard, salt, and pepper. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
Step 5: Spoon the creamy mixture into the prepared sandwich rolls and serve immediately.

Use warm, natural light to emphasize the rich, golden tones of the beef and the glossy sheen of the sour cream. Arrange thinly sliced onions and tomatoes artfully alongside the sandwich, while a small dish of grainy mustard adds color. Utilize a shallow depth of field to focus on the sandwich, creating a cozy, inviting mood that highlights the textures and layers.

recipes.name: Smoked Salmon Croque St Môret® Ligne&Plaisir® Sandwich
ingredients: 150 g St Môret® Ligne&Plaisir® cheese, softened
¼ bunch of fresh dill, finely chopped
A few pitted Niçoise olives, quartered
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine St Môret® Ligne&Plaisir®, finely chopped dill, salt, and black pepper. Mix well until smooth.

Step 2: Spread the St Môret® mixture over 4 slices of sandwich bread. Layer with Emmental cheese, smoked salmon, and another layer of the St Môret® mixture. Top with capers and quartered olives. Cover with remaining slices of bread to form sandwiches.
Step 3: Preheat a sandwich press or a skillet. Cook the sandwiches for 3 to 4 minutes, or until they are golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Step 4: Serve the Croque St Môret® sandwiches warm with mixed salad greens drizzled with lemon olive vinaigrette.

recipes.name: Stuffed Tuna and Tomato Breads
ingredients: 150 g tomato purée with onions, store-bought or homemade
directions: Step 1: Prepare the dough by combining the warmed soy milk and dried yeast in a bowl. Let it rest for a few minutes until bubbly.
Step 2: Add the olive oil, flour, and salt to the yeast mixture and knead for about 2-3 minutes until a smooth ball forms. Cover and let it rest for 1 hour to rise.
Step 3: Meanwhile, prepare the filling by mixing the tomato purée and drained tuna in a separate bowl. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 4: After the dough has risen, punch it down and roll it out to a thickness of 1 cm to form a rectangle (30 x 40 cm).
Step 5: Using a 5 cm round cutter, mark 6 circles on one half of the dough without cutting through. Place 1 tablespoon of tuna filling in the center of each marked circle.
Step 6: Fold the unmarked half of the dough over the filled circles, then cut around each filling using the cutter, pressing firmly without twisting the cutter.
Step 7: Gather the extra dough, re-roll it, and repeat the process until all dough is used.
Step 8: Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F). Brush the tops of the stuffed breads with soy milk and sprinkle with poppy and sesame seeds before baking.
Step 9: Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Use natural light to emphasize the golden crust and vibrant colors, highlighting the poppy and sesame seeds. Style with a small dish of tomato purée alongside a sprig of fresh herbs for contrast, enhancing the visual appeal. Use a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, focusing on the textured bread and filling, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Stuffed Tuna and Tomato Breads Recipe
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious stuffed tuna and tomato breads with this simple recipe tutorial.

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully arranged plate of golden-brown stuffed tuna and tomato breads, garnished with herbs and poppy seeds, set on a rustic wooden table.
scenes.text: Delicious Stuffed Tuna and Tomato Breads!
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to our cooking tutorial! Today, we're making scrumptious stuffed tuna and tomato breads.

scenes.image_prompt: A variety of ingredients laid out on a kitchen countertop, including soy milk, olive oil, flour, tomato purée, and canned tuna.
scenes.voice_over: You'll need soy milk, olive oil, flour, tomato purée, canned tuna, and some seasonings.

scenes.image_prompt: A mixing bowl with warmed soy milk and dried yeast being combined, bubbles forming on the surface.
scenes.voice_over: Begin by combining 300 ml of warmed soy milk with 15 grams of dried baker's yeast. Let it rest until bubbly for about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A hand pouring olive oil into a mixing bowl containing flour and salt, forming a dough.
scenes.text: Add olive oil, flour, and salt.
scenes.voice_over: Now, mix in 20 ml of olive oil, 450 grams of all-purpose flour, and 1.5 teaspoons of salt. Knead until smooth.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl covered with a cloth, representing the dough resting.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the dough and let it rest for 1 hour to rise until doubled in size.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl with tomato purée and drained tuna being mixed together with seasoning.
scenes.voice_over: In a separate bowl, mix 150 grams of tomato purée with 200 grams of drained tuna. Season with salt and pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: A rolling pin flattening dough on a countertop, showing the dough being rolled out.
scenes.voice_over: Once risen, punch down the dough and roll it out to a rectangle about 30 by 40 centimeters.

scenes.image_prompt: The dough with circles marked on one half and filling placed in the centers.
scenes.voice_over: Mark 6 circles with a cutter, then place 1 tablespoon of filling in each. Fold and cut again to seal.

scenes.image_prompt: A tray of stuffed breads ready for the oven, brushed with soy milk and sprinkled with seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 200 degrees Celsius. Brush the tops with soy milk and sprinkle with poppy and sesame seeds.

scenes.image_prompt: A timer indicating 15 minutes, alongside the stuffed breads baking in the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for 15 minutes until golden brown. Then, let them cool slightly before serving.

Experiment with different herbs or spices in the filling for added flavor.

recipes.name: Savoyard Croque Monsieur
ingredients: 8 slices of rustic bread (such as bio pavé)
directions: 1. Prepare for cooking by wearing a cozy outfit to match the Savoyard mood. Begin by peeling and finely slicing the onions. In a non-stick frying pan, over low heat, cook the onions without adding any fat for about 10 minutes, stirring regularly. They should soften without burning.
2. Once the onions are soft, add the sugar and stir well. This will help caramelize the onions and enhance their flavor.
3. In another non-stick pan, cook the bacon slices over medium heat until golden brown on both sides.

4. Preheat your grill, sandwich maker, or oven grill. Take a slice of bread, layer 4 slices of bacon down the center, add a generous amount of caramelized onions, and top with 2 slices of raclette cheese.
5. Place another slice of bread on top to form a sandwich. Repeat with the remaining ingredients to make more sandwiches.
6. Grill the sandwiches until the bread is crispy and the cheese is melted. Serve warm and enjoy!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Savoyard Croque Monsieur stacked elegantly on a rustic wooden board, showcasing layers of crispy bacon, caramelized onions, and melted raclette cheese oozing from the sides. Use soft, natural lighting to emphasize the golden-brown crust and rich textures. Surround the dish with fresh herbs and a small bowl of Dijon mustard for color contrast. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to highlight the height and layers, with a shallow depth of field to blur the background, creating an inviting, warm mood.

video_script.title: Savoyard Croque Monsieur Recipe Tutorial
video_script.description: Learn how to make a delicious Savoyard Croque Monsieur, a French sandwich layered with bacon, caramelized onions, and melted raclette cheese.

recipes.name: Mushroom Burger with Homemade Buns
ingredients: 250 grams fresh white mushrooms, thinly sliced
300 grams Caprice des Dieux cheese, sliced
directions: Step 1: Prepare the buns by mixing together the flour, yeast, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Step 2: In a saucepan, heat the water and butter until the butter is completely melted. Remove from heat and add the warm milk.
Step 3: Combine the dry ingredients with the warm mixture in a stand mixer bowl, mixing until well incorporated.
Step 4: Gradually add the egg yolks one at a time, kneading the dough for about 10 minutes with the mixer (20 minutes by hand) until elastic.
Step 5: Shape the dough into a smooth ball, place it in an oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm place for 1.5 hours until doubled in size.
Step 6: After rising, divide the dough into 6 equal pieces, shape them into balls, and place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cover and let rise for an additional hour.
Step 7: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F). Brush the buns with milk and sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds. Bake for 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool before slicing.

Step 8: For the aioli, peel and crush the garlic. Mix with the egg yolk and salt in a bowl, then slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking continuously until smooth and creamy. Adjust salt to taste and refrigerate.
Step 9: For the filling, heat olive oil in a skillet over low heat and sauté the sliced onions. Add the sugar and cook until they are lightly caramelized, then set aside.
Step 10: In the same skillet, sauté the sliced mushrooms with thyme until tender, then set aside.
Step 11: Cook the beef patties on a grill or skillet to your desired doneness.

Step 12: To assemble the burgers, preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F). Halve the buns and spread aioli on both halves. Layer the bottom half with a slice of Caprice des Dieux cheese, followed by the caramelized onions, patty, another slice of cheese, and sautéed mushrooms. Close the burger with the top bun and bake for 5 minutes until the cheese melts.
Step 13: Serve immediately and enjoy!

video_script.title: Homemade Mushroom Burger with Fresh Buns

scenes.image_prompt: A saucepan on the stove with melted butter and warm water, steam rising.
scenes.voice_over: Step 2: In a saucepan, heat 140 ml of warm water with 50 grams of melted butter, and then add 180 ml of warm milk.

scenes.voice_over: Step 3: Mix the dry ingredients with the warm mixture in a stand mixer until well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: A close-up of a person kneading dough by hand on a floured surface, showing the elasticity.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl covered in plastic wrap, with dough rising inside.
scenes.voice_over: Step 5: Shape the dough into a ball, place it in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise for 1.5 hours until doubled.

scenes.voice_over: Step 6: Divide the dough into 6 pieces, shape into balls, and let rise again for 1 hour.

scenes.image_prompt: Brushed dough buns on a baking sheet, sprinkled with sesame seeds, ready for the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Step 7: Preheat the oven to 220°C, brush the buns with milk, sprinkle with seeds, and bake for 10 minutes until golden.

scenes.voice_over: Step 8: For the aioli, combine crushed garlic, egg yolk, salt, and drizzle in olive oil while whisking until creamy. Refrigerate.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced onions caramelizing in a skillet, turning golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: Step 9: Heat olive oil in a skillet, sauté onions, add 4 tablespoons of sugar, and cook until lightly caramelized.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced mushrooms sautéing in a skillet with fresh thyme being added.
scenes.voice_over: Step 10: In the same skillet, sauté sliced mushrooms with fresh thyme until tender, then set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Beef patties grilling on a hot grill with grill marks.
scenes.voice_over: Step 11: Grill or cook the beef patties to your desired doneness in a skillet.

scenes.image_prompt: An oven ready to receive assembled burgers, with cheese slices ready for melting.
scenes.voice_over: Step 12: Preheat oven to 180°C. Assemble burgers with aioli, cheese, onions, patty, and mushrooms. Bake for 5 minutes to melt cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: A close-up of the finished mushroom burger, sliced in half, showcasing layers, served with side fries.
scenes.voice_over: Serve immediately and enjoy your incredible homemade mushroom burger with fresh buns!

cooking_tips: You can freeze leftover buns for later use.

recipes.name: Quick Croque Monsieur
ingredients: 2 slices of bread (white or whole wheat)
directions: Step 1: Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread.
Step 2: Place shredded Gruyère cheese generously on the unbuttered side of one slice of bread.
Step 3: Add one fold of ham on top of the cheese and sprinkle a bit more Gruyère cheese on top.
Step 4: Top with the second slice of bread, ensuring the buttered side is facing outward.

Step 5: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and place the sandwich in the skillet. Cook for 30 seconds until golden brown on one side. Carefully flip the sandwich; be cautious not to lose the cheese filling.
Step 6: Lower the heat to medium-low and cook for an additional 2 minutes on each side until both sides are golden brown and the cheese is melted.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Quick Croque Monsieur on a rustic wooden board, perfectly toasted with a golden crust. Use natural light coming from the side, casting soft shadows that enhance the textures of the melted Gruyère cheese and ham. Style with a small bowl of Dijon mustard and a sprig of fresh parsley for contrast. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to highlight the layers, with a shallow depth of field to soften the background, creating a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Homemade Sandwich Rolls
directions: 1. Add the ingredients to the bread machine in the order specified, then select the kneading and rising program.
2. Once the cycle is complete, divide the dough into small pieces of about 100 grams each and form them into rolls.
3. Place the rolls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and brush the tops with the beaten egg to give them a golden color.
4. Preheat the oven to 175°C (350°F) and bake the rolls for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
5. Allow the rolls to cool on a wire rack before serving.

Employ a shallow depth of field to blur the background slightly, focusing on the rolls as the hero of the scene, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Croque Tarte Flambée
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Finely slice the onion and sauté it with the smoked lardons in a skillet until fully cooked. Allow the mixture to cool.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked lardons and onion with the white cheese and grated Gruyère. Season with freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Step 3: Spread the cheese and lardon mixture evenly over 5 slices of bread. Top with the remaining 5 slices to form sandwiches.
Step 4: Melt the unsalted butter, then use a brush to coat the outer sides of each sandwich.
Step 5: Cook in a sandwich press for 5 minutes or bake in an oven preheated to 200°C (400°F) for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Club Sandwich Cake
directions: 1. In a medium bowl, use a fork to mix the softened Saint-Moret cheese until smooth. Add the plain yogurt, Worcestershire sauce, and finely chopped parsley. Season with salt to taste and set aside.
2. In another bowl, whip the liquid fresh cream until it forms stiff peaks. Gently fold in the mustard and season with salt. Set aside.

3. In a loaf pan or rectangular terrine, layer the ingredients starting with sliced sandwich bread, followed by the cheese mixture, sliced ham, and a mixture of chopped apples and grated carrot, repeating the layers: bread, cheese, tomatoes.
4. Cover the loaf with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow it to set.
5. Once chilled, remove from the refrigerator and carefully unmold. Use a piping bag to spread the whipped cream and mustard mixture over the top.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Club Sandwich Cake layered with alternating slices of ham, apples, carrots, and tomatoes, all nestled between soft sandwich bread. Use natural, diffused lighting to enhance the textures of the fresh lettuce and creamy Saint-Moret cheese, while a shallow depth of field blurs the background, drawing focus to the colorful layers. Style with rustic wooden cutting boards and vintage silverware, adding a sprinkle of parsley on top for a fresh touch. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to emphasize the height and inviting layers of the cake, creating a warm, appetizing mood.

recipes.name: Potato Burger with Hénaff® Pâté
ingredients: 600 grams of Princesse Amandine® potatoes, boiled and peeled
200 grams of mixed salad greens, washed and dried
directions: Step 1: Begin by boiling the Princesse Amandine® potatoes in salted water for 20 minutes until tender. Allow them to cool, then peel.
Step 2: Slice the cooled potatoes into rounds and thinly slice the pâté using a cookie cutter.
Step 3: Assemble the burger by placing 3 slices of pâté between 2 potato rounds, creating a layered effect.
Step 4: To prepare the vinaigrette, combine 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar in a small bowl. Gradually whisk in 3 tablespoons of rapeseed oil until emulsified.
Step 5: Serve the potato burgers with a side of mixed salad greens drizzled with the vinaigrette.

Use natural light to highlight the creamy texture of the pâté and the golden edges of the boiled potatoes. Arrange mixed salad greens artfully around the burger, drizzled with balsamic vinegar and rapeseed oil for a glossy finish. Shoot from a low angle to accentuate the layers, with a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background, creating a warm, inviting mood. Add coarse salt sprinkled around for contrast.

recipes.name: Pretzel Dogs
ingredients: 15 Strasbourg sausages or smoked tofu for vegetarians
directions: Step 1: Prepare the pretzel dough. In a large bowl, warm the water to a maximum of 45°C. Add the sugar and coarse salt, mixing until dissolved. Sprinkle the yeast on top and let it sit for 5 minutes until it becomes frothy and bubbly.

Step 2: In a stand mixer fitted with the dough hook or in another bowl, combine the sifted flour and melted butter. Add the yeast mixture and mix until a dough forms. Knead the dough for 5 minutes until smooth.
Step 3: Shape the dough into a ball, place it in an oiled bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
Step 4: Once the dough has risen, turn it out onto a lightly oiled work surface. Roll it into a rectangle about 35 cm wide by 25 cm tall. Cut the dough into 15 strips, each measuring 2.5 cm wide.
Step 5: Wrap each sausage with a strip of dough, leaving some of the sausage exposed at each end. Place the wrapped sausages on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Step 6: Preheat your oven to 220°C.
Step 7: Prepare the boiling broth. In a large pot, combine 2 liters of water and baking soda. Bring to a boil.
Step 8: Once the water is boiling, dip each wrapped sausage into the pot for 30 seconds. Remove with a slotted spoon and return them to the baking sheet.
Step 9: In a small bowl, mix the egg yolk with 1 tablespoon of water. Brush this mixture over each pretzel dog, then sprinkle with coarse salt, sesame seeds, and/or poppy seeds.
Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes, or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Use soft, diffused natural light to enhance the glossy finish of the pretzel crust and the juicy sausages. Incorporate scattered coarse sea salt and a sprinkle of fresh herbs for garnish. recipes.name: Fresh Fig and Cured Ham Sandwich
ingredients: 200 grams country-style cured ham, thinly sliced
150 grams sheep cheese (such as Ossau-Iraty), thinly sliced
directions: Step 1: Prepare the ingredients by quartering the figs and slicing the cheese and cured ham into thin pieces.
Step 2: Slice the baguette open lengthwise and divide it into three sections.
Step 3: In each section of the baguette, layer the slices of cheese and cured ham.
Step 4: Evenly distribute the quartered figs inside the baguette sections, pressing them gently to secure in place.
Step 5: Close the sandwich sections and slice them into desired serving sizes.

recipes.name: Wheat Tortillas or Wraps
directions: 1. In a large bowl, combine the flour, salt, sugar, and baking powder. Make a well in the center and gradually add the warm milk and oil, mixing until a dough forms. Knead the dough for 5 minutes until smooth.
2. Cover the bowl with a damp cloth and let the dough rest for 1 hour.
3. Divide the rested dough into 18 equal portions. Roll each portion out into thin circles using a rolling pin.

4. Heat a dry skillet over medium-high heat. Cook each tortilla for about 30 seconds on one side until bubbles form. Flip and cook for an additional 30 seconds. Be careful not to overcook, as they can become brittle.
5. Once cooked, stack the tortillas on a plate, covering them with a cloth to keep them warm and soft.
6. Serve warm with your choice of filling, such as in appetizers, fajitas, burritos, or chicken wraps.

recipes.name: Pita Bread with Gyros-style Tzatziki, Cucumber, Tomatoes & Feta
ingredients: 1 small bunch of fresh mint, finely chopped
Juice of 1 lemon or white wine vinegar
directions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine warm water and dry yeast. Stir gently and let rest for 5 minutes until frothy. Preheat your oven to 50°C (122°F) for proofing.
2. Add 300 g of flour, salt, and olive oil to the yeast mixture. Knead using a dough hook attachment for 3 minutes, then add the remaining flour and knead for another 8 minutes until smooth.
3. Transfer the dough to a greased bowl. Cover with a kitchen towel and place it in the warm oven. Allow the dough to rise for about 2 hours or until it has doubled in size.

4. Once risen, turn the dough out onto a floured work surface. Punch down the dough by kneading it for 1 minute. Shape it into a long log and divide into 8 equal pieces. Preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F).
5. Flatten each piece with your palm, then roll out to form disks approximately 15 cm in diameter. Lightly sprinkle with flour if needed.

6. Place the disks on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in the oven at 180°C (356°F) for about 5 minutes, keeping a close eye on them. They should puff up slightly and be only lightly golden.
7. To prepare the tzatziki, combine Greek yogurt with diced cucumber (set aside a few thin slices for garnish). Add chopped mint, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Mix well to combine.
8. To assemble the pita sandwiches, spread tzatziki on each pita. Top with cucumber slices, cherry tomato halves, and feta cubes.
9. Enjoy your delicious pita sandwiches!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a top-down shot of a rustic wooden table, featuring a warm, freshly baked pita bread at the center, surrounded by a vibrant tzatziki in a small ceramic bowl, garnished with a drizzle of olive oil and mint leaves. Scatter diced cucumber, halved cherry tomatoes, and crumbled feta artistically around the pita. Use soft, natural light to enhance the textures and colors, creating a warm, inviting atmosphere. Aim for a shallow depth of field to focus on the tzatziki while softly blurring the background.
