recipes.name: Homemade Hot Dogs
ingredients: 20 grams softened butter, cut into small pieces
1 small head of lettuce, leaves separated
directions: 1. Prepare the hot dog buns: Dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm milk. In a mixing bowl or stand mixer, combine the flour, sugar, and salt. Make a well in the center and add the water, the milk-yeast mixture, and the egg. Mix and knead the dough at medium speed until it pulls away from the bowl. Add the softened butter and knead for an additional 5 minutes. Shape the dough into a ball and let it rise for 1 hour in a warm, draft-free place covered with a damp cloth, or for 30 minutes at 35 degrees Celsius.

2. On a floured work surface, punch down the dough. Divide it into 6 equal pieces (approximately 110 grams each). Flatten each piece into a rectangular shape about 1 cm thick. Fold the top third over, then fold again to create small baguette shapes, sealing the edges tightly with your fingers. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet, allowing enough space between them. Let them rise for an additional 30 minutes in a warm, draft-free place. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius. Brush the buns with a little milk and optionally sprinkle with sesame or poppy seeds. Bake for about 15 minutes, monitoring towards the end to avoid burning. The buns should be lightly golden. Allow to cool on a wire rack.
3. Prepare the homemade ketchup: In a saucepan, combine all ketchup ingredients. Stir well and simmer for about 20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld and the sauce to thicken. Allow to cool.
4. Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook the sausages according to package instructions.

5. Assemble the hot dogs: Slice the buns open, spread some ketchup inside, add a leaf of lettuce, two tomato slices, a piece of cheddar, the sausage, and a drizzle of ketchup. Optionally, warm in the microwave or oven to melt the cheese and heat the buns before serving.
6. Note: This recipe is highly customizable based on personal preference. Feel free to add mustard, onions, or even sauerkraut!

recipes.name: Creamy Gratin Croque-Monsieur
ingredients: 4 slices of white or wholemeal bread
2 slices of ham, cut into quarters
1 cup shredded Gruyère cheese (plus extra for topping)
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, combine two generous handfuls of shredded Gruyère or Emmental cheese with a splash of milk. Season with salt and pepper, and set aside. This cheese will be used to cover the top of the Croque-Monsieur. Ensure the cheese is well-soaked in milk to prevent burning during cooking.
Step 2: Take 2 slices of bread and butter one side of each slice. Lay the buttered sides down on a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
Step 3: In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs, adding a pinch of salt and pepper, along with a few tablespoons of milk. Spread this mixture over the tops of the bread slices on the baking tray.
Step 4: Generously sprinkle shredded Gruyère cheese over the egg-coated bread.
Step 5: Evenly distribute the quartered ham slices on top of the cheese, ensuring each corner of the bread is well-covered.
Step 6: Add another generous layer of Gruyère cheese on top of the ham, making sure to use plenty of cheese for optimal flavor.
Step 7: Dip the remaining 2 slices of bread in the egg and milk mixture on both sides, and place them on top of the layered fillings to form the sandwiches.
Step 8: Top the sandwiches with the reserved Gruyère cheese that has been soaked in milk. Season with additional salt and pepper.
Step 9: Finally, bake the sandwiches in a preheated oven at 170°C (340°F) for 15 to 20 minutes, ensuring they do not brown too much.

Place the sandwich on a rustic wooden board, surrounded by sprigs of fresh thyme and a small bowl of coarse sea salt. recipes.name: Cheese Naan with Chicken Curry
ingredients: 8 portions of La Vache qui rit® cheese
directions: 1: Dissolve the yeast in warm milk and set aside.
2: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, dissolved yeast, melted butter, sunflower oil, plain yogurt, and salt. Knead the dough until smooth and elastic.
3: Cover the dough with a clean kitchen towel and let it rise in a warm place for 20 minutes.
4: Dust a clean workspace with flour and divide the dough into 4 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a ball and let them rest for 5 minutes.

5: Roll each ball into an oval or round shape using a rolling pin. Place 2 portions of La Vache qui rit® cheese on one half of the dough and fold the other half over to seal it. Gently roll out the stuffed dough to a thin disc.
6: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium-low heat. Cook each naan for a few minutes on each side until golden brown and cooked through.
7: For the chicken curry, combine the cubed chicken with the plain yogurt in a bowl, seasoning with salt and pepper.
8: Meanwhile, peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat and sauté the onion and garlic until soft.
9: Add the curry powder and the can of tomato paste to the saucepan. Stir well to combine.
10: Add the chicken mixture to the saucepan and cook for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
11: Squeeze fresh lime juice over the curry and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
12: Serve the chicken curry hot with the warm cheese naans and lime wedges on the side.

recipes.name: Beef and Gruyère Buns
ingredients: Optional: a handful of poppy seeds or sesame seeds
1 teaspoon Dukkah spice blend with chili
directions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and yeast. Add the softened butter and beaten egg. Gradually pour in the lukewarm milk while mixing the ingredients together. Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes until smooth. Cover the bowl with a clean towel and let it rise while preparing the filling.

2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a drizzle of olive oil. Sauté the chopped onion and diced mushrooms for about 5 minutes until they soften. Add the ground beef and cook for an additional 5 minutes until browned. Stir in the paprika, ground ginger, Dukkah spice blend, cinnamon, and oregano. Pour in the tomato puree, season with salt and pepper, and let simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.

3. Allow the beef mixture to cool before adding the grated Gruyère cheese. Meanwhile, divide the dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a disc about 1 cm thick and place 2 tablespoons of the cooled beef filling in the center. Fold the dough over the filling and pinch to seal, placing each bun seam-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Once all the buns are shaped, cover them with a clean towel and let them rise for 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F).
5. Brush the tops of the buns with a little milk before baking. Bake for 20-25 minutes, checking at the 20-minute mark until the buns are golden brown. Enjoy your delicious Beef and Gruyère buns!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of freshly baked Beef and Gruyère Buns, arranged on a rustic wooden board. Use natural light from the side to accentuate the golden-brown crust and the rich, melty Gruyère cheese oozing from the buns. Incorporate a soft-focus background with blurred herbs and a small bowl of dipping sauce. Include a sprinkle of poppy seeds on top for texture. Aim for a shallow depth of field to draw attention to the buns, creating a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: Delicious Beef and Gruyère Buns Recipe Tutorial
video_script.description: Learn how to make mouthwatering Beef and Gruyère Buns with this easy-to-follow recipe tutorial!

scenes.text: Welcome to our Beef and Gruyère Buns tutorial!

scenes.image_prompt: A mixing bowl with flour, salt, and yeast being combined with a spatula. Butter and a beaten egg are nearby.
scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, combine 400 grams of flour, 1.5 teaspoons of salt, and 1 teaspoon of active dry yeast. Then add 60 grams of softened butter and 1 beaten egg.

scenes.image_prompt: Lukewarm milk being poured into the mixing bowl, as dough is being formed with hands kneading it.
scenes.voice_over: Gradually pour in 210 milliliters of lukewarm milk while mixing. Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes until smooth, then cover and let it rise.

scenes.image_prompt: Skillet on stovetop with sautéing onions and mushrooms, creating aromas in the kitchen.
scenes.voice_over: In a skillet, heat some olive oil and sauté 1 chopped onion and 100 grams of diced mushrooms for about 5 minutes until softened.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef browning in the skillet with colorful spices being sprinkled over.
scenes.voice_over: Add 400 grams of ground beef and cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in the spices: paprika, ginger, Dukkah, cinnamon, and oregano.

scenes.image_prompt: Tomato puree being poured into the skillet forming a rich sauce with the beef mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in 400 grams of tomato puree, season with salt and pepper, and let this simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Dough divided into portions, rolling it into discs with beef filling being placed inside.
scenes.voice_over: Once the filling cools, divide the dough into 8 portions, roll into discs, and place 2 tablespoons of filling in the center before sealing.

scenes.image_prompt: Baking tray with the uncooked buns, covered with a towel, ready to rise.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the shaped buns with a towel and let them rise for about 30 minutes while preheating your oven to 180 degrees Celsius.

scenes.image_prompt: Buns being brushed with milk, twinkling with poppy seeds on top.
scenes.voice_over: Brush the tops of the buns with a little milk. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 180 degrees Celsius until golden brown.

scenes.voice_over: Here are your delicious Beef and Gruyère buns! Perfect for snacking or as a meal. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: Make sure the milk is lukewarm, not hot, to activate the yeast.
You can substitute the beef with your choice of ground meat or use a meat alternative to make it vegetarian.

recipes.name: Chicken Wraps with Mustard Sauce, Sun-Dried Tomatoes, and Feta
ingredients: 1 small sweet chili pepper, thinly sliced
directions: 1: Rinse the arugula under cold water and gently pat it dry with a paper towel. Crumble the feta cheese into a bowl using a fork. Chop the sun-dried tomatoes into small pieces. Remove the seeds from the sweet chili pepper and slice it thinly.

2: Cut the chicken breast into strips and heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken strips, season with salt and pepper, and cook until golden brown. Once browned, pour in the heavy cream, add the mustard, sliced chili pepper, and mix well. Allow the sauce to simmer and thicken for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Set aside.
3: Lightly dampen the wraps with water and microwave them for 30 to 45 seconds to soften.

4: On the lower half of each wrap, layer the arugula, crumbled feta, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, and the mustard-chicken mixture. Fold in the left and right sides, then roll the wrap tightly from the bottom up. Cut the wrapped portion in half. Repeat with the second wrap.
5: For tips on rolling the perfect wrap without spilling ingredients, check out this helpful guide: http://wrapadingue.fr/comment-bien-rouler-un-wrap.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of two chicken wraps, artfully arranged on a rustic wooden board. The wraps should be sliced diagonally to reveal the colorful filling of arugula, sun-dried tomatoes, and crumbled feta, glistening with a drizzle of creamy whole grain mustard sauce. Use soft, natural lighting to emphasize the textures and colors, with a shallow depth of field that softly blurs the background of fresh herbs and a small bowl of mustard sauce. Add a few slices of sweet chili pepper for pops of color and garnish with a sprig of arugula for an inviting, fresh look.

recipes.name: Rustic Croque Monsieur
directions: Step 1: Peel and thinly slice the onion. Sauté the onion in a skillet over medium heat until it becomes translucent.
Step 2: Assemble the croque by placing half a slice of ham on a slice of bread, followed by the sautéed onions and a slice of cheese.
Step 3: Spread margarine generously on the outer sides of each slice of bread.
Step 4: Grill the assembled sandwich in a sandwich maker for 5 minutes, or bake in an oven at 200°C (thermostat 6-7) for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Stuffed Baguette with Sun-Dried Tomatoes and Anchovies
ingredients: 5 sun-dried tomatoes preserved in oil, sliced
1 cup shredded cheese of your choice (e.g., mozzarella, cheddar)
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Step 2: Cut the baguette into a grid pattern, making cuts deep but not slicing all the way through.
Step 3: Between the cuts, insert slices of sun-dried tomatoes, chopped anchovies, mozzarella slices, and fresh basil leaves, alternating ingredients.
Step 4: Once each slot is filled, sprinkle shredded cheese generously over the baguette and season with black pepper.

Step 5: Place the baguette on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and golden. Adjust time as desired for a more toasted finish.
Step 6: Serve immediately while hot, and be cautious as it will be very hot!

Use natural light to enhance the golden crust and gooey mozzarella, with a soft focus on the background to draw attention to the dish. Style the scene with fresh basil leaves scattered artfully, and place the baguette on a rustic wooden cutting board. Include a textured linen napkin and a small dish of black pepper to evoke a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Mini Zucchini Burgers with Mozzarella
ingredients: 2 medium zucchinis, washed and sliced into 5 mm thick rounds
200 grams mozzarella cheese, drained and sliced into rounds
1 handful of arugula, washed and dried
directions: Step 1: Wash the zucchinis thoroughly and pat them dry with a clean kitchen towel. Slice them into rounds approximately 5 mm thick.
Step 2: Using scissors, open the mozzarella packaging, drain the whey into the sink, and retrieve the mozzarella balls. Slice them into rounds.
Step 3: Assemble the mini burgers by placing a zucchini round on a clean surface. Top it with a slice of mozzarella, trimming any excess mozzarella that hangs over the edges.

Step 4: In a small bowl, combine the salt, pepper, balsamic vinegar, and olive oil to make a dressing. Toss the arugula in the dressing until evenly coated. Add a small amount of dressed arugula on top of the mozzarella.
Step 5: Close the mini burger with another zucchini round. Enjoy immediately for a fresh treat!

Step 6: For a warm version, replace arugula with a fresh basil leaf (omit the dressing). Place the assembled mini burgers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and warm them in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 5 to 8 minutes. Ask an adult for help when removing the baking sheet from the oven, and serve the mini burgers on a platter.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant overhead shot of Mini Zucchini Burgers stacked elegantly on a rustic wooden board, surrounded by fresh arugula. Use natural light to accentuate the glossy mozzarella and the vivid green of the zucchini, highlighting textures. Incorporate a small bowl of balsamic vinegar and olive oil drizzles artistically placed nearby for allure. Opt for a shallow depth of field to create a soft bokeh effect in the background, evoking a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Croque Monsieur with Prosciutto, Mozzarella, and Pesto
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F).
Step 2: Spread 2 tablespoons of pesto on one side of each slice of bread.

Step 3: Assemble the sandwich by placing a slice of Prosciutto di Parma on top of the pesto side of two slices of bread. Add several slices of mozzarella, followed by a few tomato slices and a handful of fresh arugula. Top with the remaining slices of bread, pesto side down.
Step 4: Spread 1 tablespoon of softened butter on the outside of each sandwich.
Step 5: Place the sandwiches on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the mozzarella is melted and the bread is golden brown.
Step 6: Serve immediately, optionally accompanied by a side salad of arugula and tomatoes.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up of a golden-brown Croque Monsieur stacked high with layered prosciutto, creamy buffalo mozzarella, and vibrant tomato slices, all lightly glistening from the pesto. recipes.name: Croque-Monsieur with Cabécou du Périgord
ingredients: 100 grams soft goat cheese, for spreading
12 slices bread (preferably sandwich bread or pain de mie)
directions: Step 1: Spread the soft goat cheese evenly on one side of each slice of bread.
Step 2: Place the sliced Cabécou du Périgord on 6 slices of bread.
Step 3: Layer the ham on the remaining 6 slices of bread.
Step 4: Assemble the sandwiches by placing the slices with cheese on top of the slices with ham.
Step 5: Heat a sandwich maker or panini press and cook the sandwiches until golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Step 6: Serve immediately while the cheese is still gooey.
Tip: This recipe can also be made using fresh goat cheese from a tube, Cabécou d’Autan, or Rocamadour.

recipes.name: Provençal Vegetarian Burger Recipe
ingredients: 4 hamburger buns, cut in half and toasted
4 vegetarian patties (made with tomato, zucchini, and Provençal herbs)
1 medium sweet red onion, thinly sliced
1 small organic zucchini, sliced very thin
4 sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained and chopped
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 100°C (212°F). Slice the hamburger buns in half and toast them in the oven for a few minutes.

Step 2: Slice the sweet red onion into thin rings, the beefsteak tomato, and the zucchini into very thin rounds (no need to peel the zucchini). Cut the goat cheese into slices. Drain the sun-dried tomatoes and chop them into small pieces.
Step 3: Heat the vegetarian patties in a non-stick skillet or grill according to package instructions.
Step 4: On each toasted bottom half of a hamburger bun, spread a layer of pesto, and layer it with fresh mixed greens, zucchini slices, and tomato rounds, followed by the onion rings.
Step 5: Place a heated vegetarian patty on top, followed by 3 slices of goat cheese and a sprinkle of the chopped sun-dried tomatoes.
Step 6: Drizzle a little extra virgin olive oil over the top, then top with the upper half of the bun.
Step 7: Serve immediately for the best flavor.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Provençal vegetarian burger by styling four toasted hamburger buns stacked high, showcasing the colorful layers of the tomato-zucchini patties, fresh mixed greens, and slices of beefsteak tomato. Use a warm, diffused natural light to enhance the textures of the goat cheese and glistening sun-dried tomatoes, creating a mouthwatering effect. Incorporate rustic wooden or slate backgrounds, garnished with sprigs of fresh herbs and a drizzle of pesto. Opt for a slightly elevated angle with a shallow depth of field to focus on the burger while softly blurring the surroundings, evoking a cozy, inviting atmosphere.

recipes.name: Beef and Gruyère Buns
ingredients: Optional: Poppy seeds or sesame seeds for topping
50 grams Gruyère cheese, grated or cubed
directions: 1. Prepare the dough: In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, and yeast. Add the softened butter and beaten egg. Gradually pour in the lukewarm milk while mixing. Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes until smooth. Cover with a clean cloth and let it rise while preparing the filling.
2. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté the chopped onion and diced mushrooms for 5 minutes until softened. Add the ground beef and cook for another 5 minutes until browned.

3. Stir in the spices: Dukkah chili, paprika, ginger, cinnamon, and oregano. Pour in the tomato purée, season with salt and pepper, and let everything simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Allow the mixture to cool before adding the Gruyère cheese.

4. Once the filling has cooled, divide the dough into 8 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a thickness of about 1 cm. Place 2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of each circle and fold the dough over to seal.
5. Place the stuffed buns seam-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cover with a clean cloth and let them rise for 30 minutes.
6. Preheat the oven to 180°C (356°F). Brush the buns with milk before baking.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden brown. Check after 20 minutes for doneness. Enjoy your homemade beef and Gruyère buns!

Use soft, natural lighting to enhance the golden-brown crust and the rich, savory filling. Incorporate a blurred background of fresh herbs and a small bowl of dipping sauce for context. Focus on a shallow depth of field to draw attention to the buns' textures, evoking warmth and comfort in a cozy kitchen setting.

scenes.voice_over: In a mixing bowl, combine 400 grams of flour, 1.5 teaspoons of salt, and 1 teaspoon of active dry yeast.

scenes.image_prompt: A hand adding softened butter and a beaten egg to the mixing bowl, with additional pouring of lukewarm milk.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add 60 grams of softened butter, 1 beaten egg, and 210 milliliters of lukewarm milk.

scenes.voice_over: Knead the dough for at least 10 minutes until smooth. Then, cover it and let it rise.

scenes.voice_over: In a skillet, heat olive oil and sauté 1 medium chopped onion and 100 grams of diced mushrooms for about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Ground beef being added to the skillet with a golden-brown color, mixing with the onions and mushrooms.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add 400 grams of ground beef and cook until browned, which should take another 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A showcase of spices being sprinkled into the skillet, with tomato purée being added, creating a colorful mix.
scenes.voice_over: Now, stir in the spices, then add 1 box of tomato purée. Let it simmer for 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Dough being rolled out into circles, each filled with beef mixture and carefully folded over, showing the process.
scenes.voice_over: Once the filling has cooled, divide the dough into 8 pieces, roll them out and place 2 tablespoons of filling in each.

scenes.image_prompt: The stuffed buns arranged neatly on a baking sheet, with a cloth covering them for rising.
scenes.voice_over: Place the buns seam-side down on a baking sheet. Cover them and let rise for 30 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Brushing the tops of buns with milk, ready to go into the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat the oven to 180°C, and brush the buns with milk before baking.

scenes.image_prompt: Freshly baked golden brown buns resting on a cooling rack, with steam visibly rising.
scenes.voice_over: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until they are golden brown. Enjoy your delicious homemade buns!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished beef and Gruyère buns served on a table with garnishes and dipping sauces.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your beef and Gruyère buns warm, and enjoy every bite!

cooking_tips: Ensure the milk is lukewarm to activate the yeast effectively.
Let the buns cool slightly after baking before serving to enhance the flavor.

recipes.name: Croque-Monsieur with Prosciutto, Mozzarella, and Pesto
ingredients: 4 slices of sandwich bread (pain de mie)
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Step 2: Spread 1 tablespoon of pesto on one side of each slice of sandwich bread.

Step 3: Assemble the sandwiches by placing a slice of prosciutto on two slices of bread, followed by a few slices of mozzarella, then some tomato slices, and finally a handful of arugula. Top with the remaining slices of bread, pesto side down.
Step 4: Spread a thin layer of butter on the top of each sandwich.
Step 5: Place the sandwiches on a baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for about 10 minutes, or until the mozzarella is melted and the top is golden brown.
Step 6: Serve immediately, accompanied by a salad of arugula and tomatoes.

Surround with a handful of arugula and a small bowl of additional pesto, while a soft-focus background of blurred kitchenware adds warmth. Shoot from a low angle for depth, ensuring the focal point is the sandwich's layers, evoking a cozy, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken Pita Sandwich
ingredients: 3 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the plain yogurt and tandoori paste until well mixed.
Step 2: Add the cubed chicken breasts to the yogurt mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated. Allow to marinate for 30 minutes.
Step 3: While the chicken is marinating, slice the onion thinly.
Step 4: Heat a skillet over medium heat and sauté the sliced onions until they are golden and soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 5: Preheat a grill or grill pan on medium-high heat. Grill the marinated chicken for approximately 5 minutes on each side, or until fully cooked and charred.
Step 6: Meanwhile, warm the pita bread in the oven for a few minutes until soft.
Step 7: Assemble the sandwiches by placing the grilled chicken and sautéed onions inside the warm pita bread.

Use natural, diffused lighting to enhance the rich reds and yellows of the tandoori paste and the creamy yogurt. Create a blurred background with a rustic wooden table and a side of sliced onion, allowing the sandwich to be the focal point. Implement a shallow depth of field for an inviting, warm mood, emphasizing texture and color.
